This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. In this year within this sector there were 5,800 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the air transport industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2019, by employment size band. In this year, within this sector there were 90 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the national debt of Indonesia from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2020, the national debt of Indonesia amounted to approximately 37.02 percent of the GDP.

Of the 27.7 thousand sports and recreation local enterprises operating in the United Kingdom in 2020, the majority were businesses that employed less than five people. Sports and recreation enterprises that employed between five and nine people numbered 5.7 thousand, while there were just 140 companies that employed 250 people or more.
In the fiscal year of 2021, the United States Postal Service had 238,017 vehicles in its fleet, up from 237,836 vehicles in the previous fiscal year.

This statistic displays the number of doctors per 100,000 population in West African countries that are suffering from Ebola outbreak in 2014. Sierra Leone has some 2.2 doctors per 100,000 population. In comparison, the U.S. average stands at 245 physicians per every 100,000 of its population. Ebola first emerged in 1976 in Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo. The outbreak in West Africa has proven difficult to control, especially in poor countries.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the coke manufacturing industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2012 to 2019, by turnover size band. As of March 2019, there were 20 enterprises with a turnover of more than 5 million GBP in this sector.
This statistic shows the average income rating in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018, by region. The average income rating in London was 6.1 out of 5, compared with 3.7 in Northern Ireland.

As of March 2020, 65 percent of U.S. consumers reported that they expected to spend about the same amount on mobile electronics in the next six months. However, 16 percent expected to spend a little less on mobile electronics, while nine percent expected to spend a lot more.

Of the 27.9 thousand civil engineering enterprises operating in the United Kingdom in 2021, the majority were businesses that employed less than five people. Civil engineering enterprises that employed between five and nine people numbered 2.2 thousand, while there were just 90 companies that employed 250 people or more.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the programming and broadcasting activities sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. As of this year, there were 35 enterprises with between 20 and 49 employees.

In 2021, there were 2,340 security companies operating in London, making it the region with the most enterprises in this sector in the United Kingdom. In total there were 6,890 security companies operating in the UK in 2021.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the education sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. During this year within this sector there were 3,560 enterprises with between 20 and 49 employees.

This statistic shows the reported Fairtrade International sales income worldwide in 2018, by product. In that year, the reported Fairtrade International sales income from coffee amounted to 76.1 million euros.

This statistic shows the share of restaurant employees who would like to own a restaurant some day in the United States as of October 2013, by age group. During the survey, 66 percent of restaurant employees aged between 25 and 34 years said they would like to own a restaurant some day.

This statistic illustrates the distribution of home owners in England as of 2021, broken down by age. Home ownership is most common among the over 65 year old age group, with 35 percent of people within this group owning a home.

This statistic shows the percentage change in the distribution of mail segments in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2012. In 2012, transactional mail made up 50.4 percent of all mail sent within the United Kingdom.

This statistic shows different dealership franchises'ratings of the cost and quality of their manufacturers'used car warranties in the United Kingdom ( UK ) according to a car dealership survey carried out in January 2016. The respondents gave a score out of ten. Jaguar and Volvo dealers gave their manufacturer's used car warranty terms and conditions the lowest rating while the highest score of 8.6 out of 10 was given by Lexus dealers.

This statistic shows the best-rated midsize-ship cruise lines by travelers in the United States as of May 2021. With a score of 94, Royal Caribbean was the best midsize-ship cruise line according to Cond Nast Traveler readers.

According to a survey conducted in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in March 2020, 59 percent of respondents said they would consider using a digital health service if it was free and easily accessible. Furthermore, 14 percent said they would consider using such a service even if it required an appointment, while five percent said they would not consider using a telehealth service at all.

This statistic presents the advantages of buying art online according to international buyers as of April 2015. The survey revealed that 71 percent of respondents stated that buying art online allowed them to discover new artists.

This statistic shows the best-rated large-ship cruise lines by travelers in the United States as of May 2021. The Viking Ocean Cruises was the best-rated large-ship cruise line according to Cond Nast Traveler readers with a score of 94.5.

This statistic shows different dealership franchises'ratings of the professionalism of their manufacturers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) according to a car dealership survey carried out in January 2016. The respondents gave a score out of ten. Jaguar and Fiat dealers gave their manufacturer's professionalism the lowest rating while the highest score of 9.6 out of 10 was given by Lexus dealers.

This statistic shows the friendliest cities in the United States as of August 2014. The term `` friendly city '' was determined by the American Community Survey and refers to cities where at least 50 percent of residents rated the quality of life as `` high '' or `` very high ''. In 2014, about 84.1 percent of residents in San Francisco Bay Area, California, considered the quality of life in their city to be high or very high.

The statistic presents the distribution of actors and actress who have won an Academy Award as of March 2014, broken down by age. As of March 2014, 37 percent of actors who have won an Academy Award have been between 26 and 34 years of age.

The statistic presents the box office revenue of `` Best Picture '' nominees at the Academy Awards in 2020. `` The Irishman '', which was nominated for `` Best Picture '' for the 77th Academy Awards, generated 1.22 billion U.S. dollars in domestic box office revenue.

This statistic shows the reasons for using the internet to interact with public authorities or services in Great Britain in 2020. According to the survey, 44 percent of respondents used the internet to interact with public authorities or services in order to obtain information.

This statistic shows the reasons for online file sharing and saving in Great Britain in 2014, by age group. Most commonly reported reasons were `` to exchange data with others '' and `` to use files from several devices or local storage ''.

This statistic shows the share of internet users who regularly visited public services or local authority websites in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2012, by age. In 2012, 43 percent of internet users aged between 55 and 64 reported visiting public services or local authority websites regularly.

This statistic shows the number of new Mercedes large heavy goods vehicles which were registered in the United Kingdom between January 2014 and October 2015 on a monthly basis. Large heavy goods vehicles were not particularly popular in the United Kingdom. The number of new registrations for these vehicles was below 20 in both years recorded here.

During a representative survey of the British adult population, undertaken between the 16th and 17th March 2020, respondents were asked about their preferred approach to deciding the winners and losers of any sports leagues, competitions or tournaments that have been suspended or paused as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.

This statistic shows the responses that adults from the United Kingdom ( UK ) gave when asked `` Could you please tell me from this list of things you currently do with the internet? '' in 2015. The most common activities listed were going online for general surfing or browsing, followed by using search engines. Only a small number of respondents said that they currently did not use the internet.

This statistic shows the number of new bus and coach registrations in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2020, by bus manufacturer. The leading bus manufacturer in 2020 was the bus building company, Alexander Dennis, with a total of 478 new bus and coach registrations.

This statistic shows a forecast for the number of new hotel rooms opening in Europe from 2012 to 2016. In 2013, 30,966 new hotel rooms opened in the European hotel market. It was forecasted that 34,248 new hotel rooms would open in 2016.

This statistic shows a forecast for the number of new hotel rooms opening in the Middle East from 2012 to 2016. In 2013, 9,868 new hotel rooms opened in the Middle Eastern hotel market. It was forecasted that 17,568 new hotel rooms would open in 2016.

This statistic provides information on the top ten nation brand performers in the people and skills segment in 2014, based on the Brand Strength Index ( BSI ). In that year, Singapore received a people and skills segment BSI score of 80, higher than all other nations that year.

This statistic ranks the leading light goods vehicle models in Great Britain in 2019, by the number of vehicles registered. That year, Ford Fiesta was the most popular LGV model with approximately 956,600 vehicles registered. This was followed by Volkswagen Transporter and Vauxhall Vivaro.

Since 2001 there has not been a clear trend in the annual deviation of average daily sun hours in the United Kingdom from the 10-year mean. In 2020, the deviation from the 10-year mean amounted to 0.2 hours per day. The largest deviation during this period occurred in 2003, at 0.6 hours per day.
The highest average daily temperature in the United Kingdom since 2001 was recorded in 2014 at 10.9 degrees Celsius. The lowest average daily temperature, 9.0 degrees Celsius, was measured in 2010.

This statistic shows the wages in the United States paid to workers who did not go to college or university from 1979 to 2013. In 2013, a high school graduate earned about 7.25 percent more than a person who had completed college.

The highest average daily temperature in the United Kingdom was recorded in July 2021, at 17.9 degrees Celsius. The summer of 2020 was the joint hottest since institutions began recording temperatures in 1910. The winter of 2020/21 was also one of the coldest on record, with the average daily temperature in December falling to just 5.6 degrees Celsius.
In 2021, the total population of Europe was estimated to be 745 million. This was an increase of three million when compared with the previous year.

This statistic shows the quarterly average number of heating degree days in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2011 to 2019. The highest average number of heating degree days, 12.2 days, was recorded in the third quarter of 2013. The lowest, zero days, was recorded in the first quarter of 2019.

Over the past decade, the average wind speed in the United Kingdom has remained relatively stable. In 2021, the average wind speed in the UK was 9.2 knots. Speeds peaked during this period in the first and fourth quarters of 2020, reaching 11.4 knots. One knot is equivalent to one nautical mile per hour. Overall, wind speeds have mostly remained between eight and nine knots, dropping to a low of 6.8 in the third quarter of 2021.

This statistic shows the leading international fall destinations for United States travelers as of August 2016. During the survey, 31 percent of respondents stated that they were considering visiting New Zealand in the fall of 2016.

The statistic shows the number of Facebook fans/Twitter followers of the NBA franchise Charlotte Hornets from September 2012 to September 2021. In September 2021, the Facebook page of the Charlotte Hornets basketball team had around 1.72 million fans.

This statistic shows the growth in retail spending in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, by food and non-food sectors. From 2012 to 2013, total expenditure in the retail sector grew by 1.6 percent. The food and grocery sector showed the biggest growth, at four percent.

The statistic shows the number of Facebook fans/Twitter followers of the NBA franchise Memphis Grizzlies from September 2012 to September 2021. In September 2021, the Facebook page of the Memphis Grizzlies basketball team had around 1.77 million fans.

This statistic shows the general attractiveness factors of the United Kingdom ( UK ) for tourists in 2014. The survey was conducted in five countries. Over half of respondents said the UK's cultural and historic attractions contributed to its attractiveness. 14 percent said the same about its economy.

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in 2014 on which three countries are the most attractive to travel to for Europeans. The survey was conducted in six countries. 60 percent of respondents stated the United States, ranking it as the most attractive country to travel to for Europeans in 2014.

This statistic shows the top reasons for U.S. employees to mutate themselves on a mobile conference call in 2013. During the survey, it was found that 35 percent of employees in the United States use mobile conference calls to eat or make food.

This statistic shows the share of net marine insurance premium income in the total global marine insurance premium from 1992 to 2014. In 2012, the United Kingdom ( UK ) share of net marine insurance premium income amounted to 11.3 percent.

The first death case related to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Denmark was reported on March 11, 2020. The number of deaths has since reached a total of 1,699 as of December 17, 2020. The number of people who were confirmed infected by the virus in the country had reached a total of 123,813 as of December 17, 2020.

This statistic shows the share of private label and brand label types of milk British shoppers choose most regularly when shopping, according to a survey conducted in December 2012. Consumers who regularly bought milk were asked to indicate which type they bought most regularly. Of respondents, 55 percent tended to buy premium or standard named brands, while 42 percent bought some form of own label product.

This statistic shows the reasons for which tourists used their mobile devices while traveling in the United States as of July 2014. During the survey, 60 percent of respondents said they used their mobile device while traveling for local recommendations.

This statistic shows the number of pedestrians killed or seriously injured in road accidents, with engines of 50 cc or over, in Great Britain as of 2019, categorized by gender and age group. In that year, there were 1,749 more male pedestrians killed or seriously injured than female pedestrians. People between 25 and 59 years old were by far the group age with the highest number of casualties, with 1,742 men and 1,078 women.

This statistic shows the most annoying types of tourists in the United States as of July 2014. During the survey, 22.5 percent of locals said the most annoying tourists were those who stopped and looked around as if they were lost.

This statistic shows the preferred customer service methods for travel-related problems in the United States as of June 2014, by income. During the survey, 42 percent of respondents with an income of 75,000 to 99,999 U.S. dollars said they preferred customer service by telephone call.

This statistic presents the preferred mobile messenger apps of moms in the United States. During the July 2014 survey it was found that 35 percent of U.S. digital mothers used the Facebook messenger app on their phone.

This statistic shows the supply levels of logistics space in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in the first half of 2013 and the first half of 2014, by region. 3.94 percent of all logistics space available to rent in the London area ( UK ) was in the first half of 2014.

This statistic shows the take-up of logistics space in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the first half of 2014 and the first half of 2015, by region. 14 percent of all logistics space taken up in the first half of 2015 was in the West Midlands.

This statistic shows the leading post-vacation lifestyle changes of travelers worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 37 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

This statistic shows the leading lifestyle changes of travelers after city or cultural vacations worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 37 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

During a representative survey of the British adult population, undertaken between the 16th and 17th March 2020, respondents were asked their opinion on how the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo should be handled and scheduled to take place during the COVID-19 pandemic.

This statistic shows the leading lifestyle changes of travelers after nature vacations worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 31 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

This statistic shows the most used definitions of `` off the beaten path '' in North America as of August 2014. During the survey, 17 percent of respondents stated that `` off the beaten path '' means a destination that is not as well-known or as popular as the `` mainstream ''.

This statistic shows the most popular `` off the beaten path '' destinations for North American travelers as of August 2014. During the survey, 14 percent of respondents said that South America was a popular off the beaten path destination for North American travelers.

This statistic displays the distribution of contractors in Obamacare's Healthcare.gov website as of December 2014. The Healthcare.gov website reported that Obamcare.org received 250 million U.S. dollars in traffic since its launch.

This statistic illustrates the most collectible living artists at auction worldwide from 2011 to 2016, by value of sales. Between 2011 and 2016, the most collectible living artist at auction was Yayoi Kusama, with sales at auction of 1.21 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows opinions of members of the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders ( SMMT ) on the possibility of the use of third parties to fill skills gaps in the industry. The respondents are from all SMT companies and large and small. Only 21 percent of respondents were in favor of such a step.

This statistic illustrates the sales at auction of post-war and contemporary art in Europe and the United States from 2000 to 2015. In 2013, auction sales of post-war and contemporary art in Europe and the U.S. reached 3.92 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic illustrates the sales at auction of modern and contemporary art in Latin America from 2013 to 2018. According to the source, auction sales of modern and contemporary art in Latin America had reached 75.4 million U.S. dollars in 2018.

This statistic shows British public opinion from September 18 to 19, 2014, and one week later on September 24 to 25, 2014, on whether the United Kingdom and the United States should send troops back into Iraq to fight the Islamic State/ISIS. On the second date, more people approved of the potential UK and US re-entering Iraq, whereas fewer people disapproved or were unsure. This could be due to increased media portrayal of ISIS as violently anti-Western.

This statistic shows the different British public approval ratings by political stance on September 24 to 25, 2014 of the RAF air strikes in Syria against Islamic State/ISIS to weaken them and push them back. The majority of participants who affiliated themselves with the Liberal Democrats approved of the air strikes, while the majority of participants who identified themselves as being pro-Labour League supporters disapproved of the strikes.

Nearly 80 percent of respondents were of the opinion that Romania's neighboring countries were reliable in case of a conflict with Russia. Only 28 percent of respondents considered Hungary to be a reliable ally.

During the week of March 15, 2020, the dollar sales of turkey meat grew by 96.4 percent compared to the same period of the previous year. Conversely, the dollar sales of deli meat appreciated by some 40.6 percent in that period.

This statistic shows the results of a yougov survey conducted in 2014, asking British adults to select types of beer they like. Of respondents, 25 percent said they like stout, 18 percent pale ale and 17 percent craft beer. 42 percent said they did not like any of the types listed.

This statistic shows the sales value of compounded, unvulcanized rubber based on PRODCOM estimates * * in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2010 and 2014. The UK experienced an increase in sales value over this period. The sales value reached 212.5 million British pounds in 2013.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in Syria by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 11.2 percent of the employees in Syria were active in the agricultural sector, 22.9 percent in industry and 66.5 percent in the service sector.

This statistic shows the methods consumers prefer to use to contact their local public sector organizations in the United Kingdom in 2013. According to the survey, 47 percent of consumers prefer to use telephone to contact their local public sector organizations, while 39 percent prefer to use e-mail.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Germany from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 104.05 points.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Estonia from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 109.02 points.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Slovenia from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 104.05 points.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products and preparations in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, there were 661 enterprises manufacturing pharmaceutical products and preparations in the UK.

This statistics shows the share of countries worldwide where sexting or sharing private sexual images or videos of a person without their consent occurred from 2007 to 2012. In 2012, this type of violation happened in 32 percent of countries around the world.

This statistic shows the economic contribution of tourism in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013. Both domestic and outbound travel for personal purposes contributed 114.1 billion British pounds to the UK economy that year, while business travel contribution amounted to 34.2 billion British pounds.

A survey from April 2020 showed that the Italian population appreciated the government's communication strategy during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. Indeed, the information provided by the Ministry of Health was rated positively. However, some people were not satisfied with the communication channels, as the information flow could have been more transparent.

This statistic shows the results of a survey among U.S. adults by gender on issues facing working women in the United States in September 2014. During the survey, 6 percent of men were of the opinion that balancing work and personal life is the most important issue facing working women and 41 percent of women were of the opinion that paid family leave is the most important issue facing working women in the U.S. today.

This statistic shows the economic contribution of tourism in Scotland in 2013. Both domestic and outbound travel for personal purposes contributed 14.3 billion British pounds to the economy, while business travel contribution amounted to 9.2 billion British pounds.

This statistic illustrates the monthly trend in volume sales of the total retail trade in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from December 2017 to November 2018. Retail trade sales volume in the UK had a steady increase until November 2018.

This statistic displays the annual turnover of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations manufacturing in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2019, by subsector. In 2019, the total turnover of the manufacture of pharmaceutical products was over 20.3 billion British pounds.

This statistic displays the value of purchases in the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations from 2008 to 2019, split by type. In 2019, the value of purchases in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations amounted to over 12 billion British pounds.

This statistic illustrates the percentage change in the volume of retail trade ( excluding motor vehicles and motorcycles ) compared to the previous month in the European Union, from September 2016 to August 2018. Retail trade volumes increased in August 2018 by 0.1 percent compared to the previous month.

This statistic shows the average monthly savings as a share of monthly income in Great Britain from 2013 to 2015, by gender. The average monthly savings of women in 2015 amounted to 8.7 percent of their monthly income, compared to 7.9 percent of men's average monthly savings.

This statistic shows the preference of male and female consumers in the United States for fork and knife or chopsticks when eating Asian meals as of May 2014. During the survey, 75 percent of male respondents stated that they preferred to use fork and knife when eating Asian cuisine.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of vulcanized rubber threads and cord in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. EU exports of vulcanized rubber threads and cord reached a value of 1.3 million British pounds in 2018.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of rubber transmission belts in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. The EU was clearly an important trade partner for the United Kingdom over this period. EU exports of rubber transmission belts reached a value of 22.5 million British pounds in 2018.

In 2018, more than 8.6 billion tonne-kilometers of freight were transported by train in France. Among the different types of goods transported by train, the highest volume concerned passenger trains, which moved more than four billion tonne-kilometers in 2018.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of vulcanized rubber seals in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. EU exports of vulcanized rubber seals reached a value of 116.2 million British pounds in 2018.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of rubberized textile fabric adhesive tape and other textile adhesive tape of rubberized textile fabric in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2013. EU exports of rubberized textile adhesive tape reached a value of 326 thousand British pounds in 2012.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of plastic monofilaments exceeding 1mm diameter in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. EU exports of plastic monofilaments reached a value of 38.6 million British pounds in 2018.

This statistic shows the house price index in Czechia from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 150.92 index points - the highest level recorded during this period of time.

This statistic illustrates the house price index in Ireland from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 134.92 index points - the highest level recorded during this period of time.

This statistic shows the house price index in the Netherlands from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 141.05. This was an increase from the previous year and the highest value in the period of consideration.

This statistic shows the house price index in Portugal from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 134.92 index points - the highest level recorded during this period of time.

This statistic shows the house price index in Slovenia from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 135.12 index points - the highest level recorded during this period of time.

This statistic shows the percentage of the population of Scotland's that had issues with English in 2011. 0.6 percent of the population could not speak, read or write English, and 1 percent could not speak but could read or write.

This statistic displays the results of a survey on the physical activity level of children aged between 5 and 15 years old in England in 2008 and 2012, by gender. In the year 2008, it was found that 24 percent of boys and 17 percent of girls met the recommendations for physical activity of being physically active for at least 60 minutes per day.

In the second week of March 2020, foot traffic in Sam's Club stores increased by 66 percent when compared to the same period in 2019. After weeks of increased foot traffic in their stores, Costco, Target, and Walmart Supercenter all experienced a decrease in foot traffic in the third week of March. This represented the first drop in traffic since the beginning of the pandemic in the United States.

This statistic shows the sales value of paints and varnishes based on non-aqueous synthetic or chemically modified natural polymers based on PRODCOM estimates * * in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2010 and 2018. The UK experienced a decrease in sales value over this period. In 2018, the sales value reached 34.3 million British pounds.

This statistic shows the sales value of vitreous enamels and glazes for ceramics, enameling or glass based on PRODCOM estimates * * in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2010 and 2018. The UK experienced a decrease in sales value over this period. The sales value reached a low of 5.9 million British pounds in 2016.

This statistic shows the national debt of Slovenia from 2016 to 2019 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2019, the national debt of Slovenia amounted to approximately 65.69 percent of the GDP.

According to a survey conducted in November 2019, 93 percent of respondents were aware of CNN. In comparison, only 18 percent of respondents were aware of the then-newly launched Fox News Channel. Although less than two thirds of respondents were aware of it, 49 percent of those surveyed were aware of Fox News Channel's launch date.

This statistic shows the unemployment rate of non-native speakers in England and Wales in 2011, by proficiency in English. The unemployment rate was greater for those who were not proficient in English than for those who were, and for both genders.

In 2020/21, 6.9 percent of pupils at primary school in England spoke another first language than English at home. This was a slight decrease from the previous year, when 7.1 percent of pupils spoke another first language than English at home.

The number of smallpox deaths per million inhabitants in Sweden during the various stages of vaccination between 1700 and 1900 was relatively low, with the exception of the 1802/1803 outbreak. This was despite the fact that the first case of smallpox in Sweden was not reported until 1771, and that the second case was not confirmed until 1784. When the outbreak did occur, it was in the region of Uppsala, and it was responsible for over one thousand deaths, and almost ten thousand injuries. The reason for the relatively low number of deaths during this outbreak is because of the high level of vaccination in Sweden at the time, and the fact that the 1802/1803 outbreak was not endemic to Sweden.

From the Battle of the Somme in 1916 to the Second World War in 1940, the British Army was involved in almost all major wars involving the British Empire. Throughout this time, the mortality rate of soldiers in the British Army was relatively high, with approximately 7.7 percent of all soldiers in the army dying in each decade. The only years where the mortality rate was lower than this were in the 1870s and 1890s, as Britain was able to benefit from the technological advancements of the Second Industrial Revolution. When compared with other European countries that were involved in the same conflicts, such as Germany and France, the British Army had the third highest number of fatalities in World War One, with 46,240 deaths.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Italy from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the production value of this industry came to approximately 32.16 billion euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Lithuania from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 422.8 million euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Slovakia from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 361.4 million euros.

This statistic shows the share of respondents who have experienced a safety issue on holiday in the European Union ( EU ) in 2014. 2 percent of respondents said they had been robbed or had their luggage stolen while on holiday.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Sweden from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 235.8 million euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 4.7 billion euros.

This statistic represents the share of French people who practiced these leisure activities in 2015, by gender. It reveals that women were more likely to go to a caf or a restaurant with their friends than men. Also, women practiced more often yoga and meditation than men.

Banco Santander is one of the largest banks in Europe in terms of total assets. It is also among the European banks with strongest international presence, operating in 50 countries worldwide. As of the end of 2020, Banco Santander employed approximately 190.5 thousand people globally. This was a decrease compared to the previous year, when the number of employees amounted to 195.2 thousand.

The outbreak of coronavirus in Poland had a significant impact on the economy. In March 2020, the index of economic activity in the main sectors of the economy decreased by as much as possible compared to March 2019. The most significant drop was recorded in the services sector.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Denmark from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, this industry produced a turnover of approximately 13.84 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Hungary from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, this industry produced a turnover of approximately 3.24 billion euros.
This statistic shows the number of custodial parents in the United States as of 2011, by marital status. As of 2011, about 3.5 million custodial parents were divorced.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Ireland from 2008 to 2014. In 2014, this industry had personnel costs of approximately 1.27 billion euros.

This survey presents the opinions of U.S. adults on whether health research is a problem in rising health care costs, comparing 2016 and 2020 data. In 2016, 33 percent of respondents stated that they believed health research is part of the problem in rising health care costs. In 2020, the share of respondents who believed the same increased to 23 percent.

The statistic shows the financial assets of mutual investment funds in Norway as of 2013, broken down by asset type. The total value of equity and other shares owned by mutual funds amounted to approximately 442 billion Norwegian kroner in 2013.

This statistic illustrates the total value of financial assets of investment funds in Poland as of 2013, broken down by asset type. It can be seen that the total value of financial assets of investment funds held in equity amounted to approximately 87.5 billion Polish zloty at that time. The total financial assets of investment funds held in other asset types reached a value of over 21.1 billion Polish zloty in 2013.
This statistic depicts the dental treatment ever received by 15 year olds in Wales in 2013. The majority of respondents, 52 percent, had a check-up with a dentist.
This statistic displays the dental treatment ever received by 15 year olds in Northern Ireland in 2013. The majority of respondents, 64.2 percent, had received advice on oral care.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Denmark semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 8.97 euro cents per kWh.

A total of over 302 thousand confirmed cases of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) were reported in Sweden as of December 8, 2020. The number of confirmed cases was higher among women, and the first case of the virus in Sweden was confirmed on February 4, 2020. The number of cases has since risen to a total of 304,813.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Estonia semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.03 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Poland semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.23 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Slovakia semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.27 euro cents per kWh.

Household electricity prices in Denmark averaged 30.35 euro cents per kilowatt-hour ( kWh ) in the second half of 2020. Over the past decade, household electricity prices have seen an overall increase, peaking at 34.26 euro cents per kWh in the first half of 2018. On average, prices were cheaper in the second half of each year.

Household electricity prices in Estonia averaged 13.26 euro cents per kilowatt-hour ( kWh ) in the second half of 2020. Residents of Estonia using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh paid 13.26 euro cents per kWh, while those using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh paid 14.26 euro cents per kWh. Households using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh paid 13.26 euro cents per kWh, while those using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh paid 14.26 euro cents per kWh.

For households consuming between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh electricity prices in Luxembourg averaged 19.65 euro cents per kilowatt hour ( kWh ) in the second half of 2020. This was the highest cost over the past decade. Households using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh paid less for electricity in Luxembourg.

This statistic illustrates the use of social networks as a communication method among different age groups and by gender in France in 2014. Social network usage was more common among males than females and more among the young than the old.

In the second half of 2020, the average electricity price for households using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh was 21.48 euro cents per kWh. This constituted an increase of over one euro cent per kWh compared to the first half of 2020.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on attitudes towards advertising in Germany in 2012. During the survey period it was found that 63 percent of respondents agreed to some extent that advertising is an integral part of modern life.

This statistic illustrates the use of photo sharing as a communication method among different age groups and by gender in France in 2014. Among respondents aged 18 to 24, 39 percent reported using photo sharing to contact family and friends.

In 2020, every third company in Poland expects redundancies as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. The most significant number of people who expect to lose their jobs are employees of the aviation industry.
This statistic displays the number of independent contractors of community pharmacies in England from 2006/07 to 2020/21. In 2019/20, there were 4,749 independent contractors of community pharmacies.
This statistic shows the purchase reasons for tablet devices in France in 2014. The most common reason was that an existing product had broken, with 26 percent of respondents giving this reason.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology manufacturing industry in Finland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the ICT manufacturing industry employed a total number of 15,905 people.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Volvo in Turkey between 2012 and 2019. In the period of consideration, Turkish sales of Volvo cars fluctuated, peaking at 6.9 thousand units sold in 2015. In 2019, Volvo sold approximately 4.2 thousand cars, a decrease of roughly 29 percent in comparison with the previous year.

This statistic displays the results of a survey of individuals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, regarding their attitude towards receiving mail and e-mail. Of respondents, 56 percent reported they spend a lot of time reading e-mail.

This statistic displays the response of individuals in Great Britain when asked, why would they not be likely to get information from a pharmacy on some of the issues that they just mentioned? In this period, 36 percent of individuals interviewed said they would not be likely to get information from a pharmacy on issues that they just mentioned because they would already have this information and only 8 percent of individuals interviewed said they would not be likely to get information from a pharmacy because they do not need advice.

In 2020, the most registered passenger car models in France were produced by Peugeot. That year, more than 313,000 units of the French manufacturer were registered in the country. The Renault Clio was the second most popular model, with more than 300,000 registrations, while the Volkswagen Golf ranked third.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) manufacturing industry in Bulgaria from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the production value of the ICT manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 265.8 million euros.
The statistic shows the U.S. retailers running the most circular advertisements for analgesics in 2014. In that year, Walgreens ran the most effective circular ads for analgesics with a count of 228.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the time spent using products or devices in Germany in 2014. During the survey period it was found that respondents spent an average of 2.5 hours watching TV.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most car parts manufacturers in Poland feel uncertain about the future. Nearly one in five manufacturers expect the company's production to fall by about 20 to 40 percent.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Fiat in Austria between 2012 and 2018. Austrian sales of Fiat cars decreased from 12.5 thousand units sold in 2012 to 10 thousand units sold in 2014, before increasing again the following year. The sale of Fiat cars in Austria peaked at 15.5 thousand units sold in 2017. In 2018, there were 14.6 thousand units of Fiat cars sold in Austria.

The production value of the ICT services industry in Belgium increased by 2.5 billion euros since the previous year. With 35,539 million euros, the production value thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Kia in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Kia cars declined from 12.4 thousand units sold in 2012 to 9.3 thousand units sold in 2014, before increasing slightly in 2015.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Citroen in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Citroen cars decreased from 13.5 thousand units sold in 2010 to 10.3 thousand units sold in 2012, before increasing slightly in the following years. In 2018, 7.6 thousand Citroen cars were sold in Austria.

This statistic illustrates the number of complaints submitted to the Financial Ombudsman regarding customer current accounts in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the financial years of 2009/2010 to 2020/2021. It can be seen that the number of complaints regarding customer current accounts fluctuated during the period under observation, reaching a total of under 23.5 thousand as of March 2021. The largest number of complaints were found in 2015, when a total of approximately 58.5 thousand complaints were recorded.
This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Mitsubishi in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Mitsubishi cars rose to a peak of 4.9 thousand units sold in 2018.

This statistic illustrates the number of complaints to the Financial Ombudsman regarding credit card services and products in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the financial years of 2009/2010 to 2019/2020. It can be seen that the number of complaints regarding credit cards fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a total of under ten thousand as of 2019/2020. The largest number of complaints were found in 2012/2013, when a total of over 19.5 thousand complaints were recorded.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 62.82 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 23.02 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in Slovenia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 2.47 billion euros.

The number of daily visits on online health portals in Hungary peaked on March 22, 2020, when over 5.2 million visits were recorded. Between March 9 and March 22, 2020, there was a drastic increase in the number of online health portal visits.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Opel in Belgium between 2009 and 2020. Belgian sales of Opel cars peaked at 43,000 units sold in 2011, but decreased in the following years, amounting to 20,099 units in 2020.

This statistic shows the share of American adults who remained married after their first marriage in 2013, by age. In 2013, 51 percent of adults aged 55 to 64 remained married after their first marriage.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information and communication technology services sector in Slovenia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector turnover amounted to approximately 3.35 billion euros.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Italy from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 9.1 percent to 16.8 percent.

The number of cars sold by Alfa Romeo in Switzerland fluctuated between 2009 and 2019, peaking at 4,100 units sold in 2011. In 2019, there were 2,900 units of Alfa Romeo cars sold in Switzerland, down by 14 percent compared with the previous year.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Hungary from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 3.6 percent to 9.1 percent.

The number of cars sold by Honda in Switzerland decreased between 2009 and 2019, from a peak of 8,300 units sold in 2009 to just over 4,000 units sold in 2019. The latest figure represents an increase of over nine percent compared with the previous year.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Slovakia from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 9.3 percent to 16.2 percent.

The number of cars sold by Hyundai in Switzerland fluctuated between 2009 and 2020, peaking at 11,500 units sold in 2012. In 2020, there were just over 6,300 units of Hyundai cars sold in Switzerland, down by 14 percent compared with the previous year.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Finland from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 9.1 percent to 16.2 percent.

As of May 31, some 33 percent of respondents in the United States who had lost income due to the pandemic stated that they are receiving financial support from their government. This statistic is based on the daily COVID-19 / coronavirus pandemic survey conducted by Statista.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Volvo in Norway between 2009 and 2020. Norwegian sales of Volvo cars experienced a net increase over the period, increasing from 7,400 units sold in 2009 to a peak of 12,000 units sold in 2013. In 2020, 9,300 Volvo cars were sold in Norway.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Tesla in Norway between 2009 and 2020. Norwegian sales of Tesla cars experienced net growth over the period, rising from zero sales in 2009 to over 9,000 units sold in 2020.

This statistic shows the results of a 2015 survey among adult Cubans living in Cuba regarding their satisfaction with the economic system that exists in Cuba today. 80 percent of respondents stated they are not too satisfied or not at all satisfied with the economic system that exists in Cuba today.

This statistic shows the proportion of electricity derived from renewable sources in Czechia from 2007 to 2018. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources in electricity generation climbed from 16.6 percent to 25.4 percent.

The statistic shows the proportion of electricity derived from renewable sources in Italy from 2007 to 2019. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources in electricity generation climbed from 16.7 percent to 26.4 percent.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Italy from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 22.79 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 1.3 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 5.18 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Romania from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 2.87 billion euros.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology services sector in Ireland from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector employed a total number of 87,076 people.

In mid-March 2020, during the coronavirus pandemic outbreak in North America, brands had to pay on average around 30 percent less for Facebook ads than they did in mid-January 2020. The social network's advertising cost-per-click ( CPC ) decreased by nearly 70 percent, as the coronavirus outbreak influenced ad demand in the region.

Since 2000, the average weekly working hours in France have remained stable, with French employees working 36.5 hours a week. However, in 2019, the average weekly working hours in France reached 36.3 hours, which was the lowest value since 2002.

This statistic presents the share of ATM units that were not working ( non-compliant ) in selected European countries from 2005 to 2012. In 2012, 99.5 percent of all ATMs in Europe were working, up from 99 percent in 2011.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology services sector in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector employed a total number of 234,834 people.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in Spain from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 40.04 billion euros.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in Latvia from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 882.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 18.9 billion euros.

This statistic displays the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) as a percentage of GDP in Belgium from 2000 to 2019. Over the period, the GERD share rose by a total of 0.61 percentage points. The GERD peaked in 2019, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.69 percent of Belgium's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.58 percent, much lower than in Austria but nevertheless, higher than in Italy.

This statistic shows the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) as a percentage of GDP in Estonia from 2000 to 2017. Over the period, the GERD share rose by a total of 0.61 percentage points. The peak was in 2010, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.92 percent of Estonia's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.58 percent, much lower than in Austria but nevertheless, higher than in Italy.

Over the period from 2005 to 2019, the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) share rose by a total of 0.62 percentage points. The GERD peaked in 2019, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.69 percent of Finland's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.6 percent, which was the highest value in the shown period.

This statistic presents the annual loss incurred due to physical attacks on automated teller machines ( ATMs ) in selected European countries from 2010 to 2019. During this time period, the loss of physical attacks on ATM machines fluctuated. The highest amount of losses due to physical attacks on ATM machines was recorded in 2016, at approximately 49.4 million euros. In comparison, in 2019, approximately 22.1 million euros in losses were reported.

In the period from March 11 to 20, 2020, CEOs, sales managers and marketing managers of Swedish export companies were asked how they assess the business impact of the coronavirus in terms of exports from Sweden. 44 percent stated to see very negative impacts in the current situation, and 43 percent assessed it moderately negative for the next four weeks as well.
This statistic shows the innovation expenditure of the advertising industry in Germany from 2008 to 2021. In 2021, the German advertising industry spent roughly 493.5 million euros on innovation.

This statistic shows the final consumption expenditure of households in Germany on clothing as annual figures from 2005 to 2020. Since 2009, spending on clothing has increased overall, reaching approximately 53.1 billion euros in 2020.

This statistic depicts the share of home owners who planned home improvement projects in the United States from 2014 to 2016. The survey revealed that some 65 percent of respondents planned home improvement projects in 2016.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for the chief financial officers ( CFOs ), working on the permanent basis in the public and charity accounting and finance sector in London ( United Kingdom ) in 2015, listed by the size of the organization. In that time, chief financial officers working in small to medium enterprises earned between 50 thousand and 90 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance & accounting market.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for the director in audit and assurance, working on the permanent basis in the public practice in London ( United Kingdom ) from 2014 to 2015. In 2014, directors in audit and assurance earned between 90 thousand and 130 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance market.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for partners, working on the permanent basis in the public practice in London ( United Kingdom ) in 2015, listed by type of branch. In that time, partners in the corporate finance branch earned between 120 thousand and 200 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance market.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for market risk management specialists, working on a permanent basis, in the banking and financial services sector in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed by years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified specialists, with up to two years experience, earned between 40 thousand and 55 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified specialists with over ten years experience earned between 110 thousand and 150 thousand British pounds per year.

This statistic displays the volume of revenue made in the Spanish food, beverages and tobacco wholesale market in 2014, by sub-sector. That year, the wholesale of vegetables, fruits and other edibles generated more than 29 billion euros in revenue.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the product information search activities of distance selling users in Switzerland in 2013. During the survey period it was found that roughly 32 percent of respondents stated that they had looked up a product description on a website.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for credit risk analysts both in banking and non-banking financial institutions, working on a permanent basis, in the banking and financial services sector in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed by years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified analysts with up to two years experience earned between 32 thousand and 45 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified analysts with over ten year experience earned between 95 thousand and 125 thousand British pounds per year.

This statistic gives an overview of the favorite fruits in France in 2017. It reveals that 30 percent of respondents preferred bananas, followed by 29 percent of respondents citing the cherry as their favorite fruit.

The monthly volume of issued credit cards by Russian banks reached 535.5 thousand in January 2020, marking a decrease compared to the previous month. In December 2019, the number of credit cards issued in the country exceeded 930 thousand.

In the period from March 11 to 20, 2020, CEOs, sales managers and marketing managers of Swedish export companies were asked how they assess the business impact of the coronavirus in terms of exports from Sweden. 45 percent stated to see very negative impacts in the current situation, and 46 percent assessed it moderately negative for the next four weeks as well.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for business change analysts, working on a permanent basis, in the commerce and industry sector in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed for the level of qualification and years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified analysts with up to three years experience earned between 65 thousand and 80 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified analysts with more than six years experience earned between 95 thousand and 115 thousand British pounds per year.

This statistic displays the share of individuals in the United Kingdom with metabolic conditions in 2018, by age and gender. In this year, 26 percent of individuals diagnosed were aged between 35 and 44 years old.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the telecommunications sector in Lithuania from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector had a production value of approximately 675.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the telecommunications sector in Portugal from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector had a production value of approximately 5.47 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2013, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to 1.03 billion euros.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in Spain from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to 4.66 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in France from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to approximately 11.39 billion euros.
This statistic illustrates the occasions mobile instant messages were used in Italy in 2014. Thirteen percent of respondents reported using this communication method for festive greetings.
This statistic illustrates the frequency of contact with grandparents in Italy in 2014. Among respondents, 23 percent reported keeping in contact every 2 to 3 days.

The number of employees in the telecommunications industry in Belgium decreased by 593 employees since the previous year. As a result, the number of employees in Belgium saw its lowest number in 2019 with 21,853 employees. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018.

According to a survey carried out in Chile among company executives and directors, the main problem faced by businesses due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in the country was the decrease in demand and sales. Up to 58 percent of the businesspeople surveyed pointed out that this was the main problem in their companies, followed by 32 percent of respondents who mentioned the cancellation of business activities.

This statistic shows the total volume of wine produced in Portugal from 2006 to 2018. In 2018, the total volume of wine produced in Portugal was expected to reach approximately 6.1 million hectoliters.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Estonia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector employed 4,143 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Cyprus from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the telecommunications sector employed 3,596 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Latvia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector employed 5,009 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Hungary from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the telecommunications sector employed 19,459 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Sweden from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the telecommunications sector employed 26,564 people.

This statistic presents the results of a survey on the influence of the local quality and variety of sporting facilities has on the local community in England in 2014/15. Of respondents, 84 percent said that the quality and variety of sporting facilities has no influence on their local community.

This statistic shows the results of a survey question asking adults in England how much influence they have over the quality of their local environment. Of respondents, 73 percent said they have no influence.

This statistic displays the lifestyle choices of individuals with a musculoskeletal condition in the United Kingdom in 2018. In this year, 78 percent of individuals with a musculoskeletal condition consumed alcohol.

This statistic shows the share of air passengers who bring a Wi-Fi enabled tablet onboard flights worldwide in 2015, by region. During the survey, 37 percent of the respondents from Latin America said that they take a tablet with them on flights that are Wi-Fi enabled.

This statistic presents the number of fatalities in transport accidents in France from 2011 to 2017, by mode of transport. In 2017, more than 3,500 people died on the road. That same year, more than 100 people died by air accident.

This statistic displays the share of individuals in the United Kingdom with a respiratory condition in 2018, by age. In this year, 26 percent of individuals diagnosed were aged between 45 and 54 years old.
This statistic shows the value of publishers'book copy payments in France from 2009 to 2020. In 2020, the value of publishers'book copy payments amounted to 483 million euros.
The turnover of the information sector in Spain increased by 533.5 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the total turnover amounted to 17.8 billion euros in 2019.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information sector in France from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the information sector turnover amounted to approximately 41.3 billion euros.
The turnover of the information sector in Austria increased by 171.6 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the total turnover amounted to 4.7 billion euros in 2019.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, the information sector turnover amounted to approximately 77.27 billion euros.

According to the 2020 survey, reading and writing were the most popular arts activities among 11 to 15 year old girls in England, with 86 percent of girls reporting having taken part in reading and writing activities in the last year. Film and video activities ranked highly among girls, with 81 percent of girls having engaged in this art form.

This statistic shows the proportion of patent applicants in Finland from 1980 to 2013 that were female. Over this three decade period, the share of female Finnish inventors experienced an overall increase of 6.9 percentage points, peaking in 2008, when 11 percent of Finnish patent applications were from women.

This statistic illustrates the results of a survey regarding the reliability of information provided by media and other sources in France in 2015, by age group. The results of this survey show that the share of respondents aged 50 to 64 who considered radio as a source of reliable information was ten points higher than among respondents aged 25 to 34.

This statistic represents SEAT's worldwide vehicle sales from the fiscal year of 2013 to the fiscal year of 2020. In the fiscal year of 2020, the Volkswagen Group sold some 476,000 vehicles under its SEAT brand.
The value of the total wine production in France has fluctuated significantly between 2010 and 2020. In 2020, the total value of wine production was worth 7.6 billion euros.

This statistic presents the share of children aged 5 to 15 who recently participated in any sport in England, as of annual surveys conducted between 2008/09 and 2017/18. In the period 2013/14, around 90.1 percent of children had participated in sports in the last 4 weeks. Since then there has been a small decline in participation.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Citroen in Sweden between 2009 and 2019. Swedish sales of Citroen cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 6.4 thousand units sold in 2011. In 2019, there were 3.2 thousand units of Citroen cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Mazda in Sweden between 2009 and 2019. Swedish sales of Mazda cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 6.6 thousand units sold in 2016. In 2019, there were 6.2 thousand units of Mazda cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Toyota in Sweden between 2009 and 2020. Swedish sales of Toyota cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 23.1 thousand units sold in 2017. In 2020, there were 22.8 thousand units of Toyota cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic illustrates the distribution of preferences among the adult British population regarding the type of property purchase in the first and second quarter of 2017. The most popular option for first-time buyers was a house ( 50 % ), followed by flats and maisonette ( 43 % ). In the second quarter of 2017, the preferences changed and the most popular choice among first-time buyers was a house ( 49 % ), while the popularity of flats and maisonette increased significantly ( 28 % ).

This statistic gives information on the frequency of Apple Pay usage in the United States as of June 2017. During the survey period, 18 percent of Apple Pay users stated that they had set up their account and were now trying to use it.

This statistic shows the total market sales of Christmas trees in Europe from 2013 to 2014, by country. In 2013, Germany was the leading market for Christmas trees with approximately 27.5 million euros worth of sales, followed by France with 10.9 million euros.

This statistic shows the market share of chilled fruit juice as a proportion of all fruit juice consumed in the European Union from 2007 to 2018. In 2018, the market share of chilled fruit juice was approximately 12.6 percent.

This statistic shows the market share of fresh fruit juice as a proportion of all fruit juice consumed in the European Union from 2007 to 2018. In 2018, the market share of fresh fruit juice was approximately 11.6 percent.

This statistic presents the share of children who recently participated in sports in England, as of annual surveys conducted between 2012 and 2014. In the period 2014/15, it was found that around 30 percent of the children aged between 11 and 15 had taken part in a sports activity in the last 4 weeks prior to the survey. Further information about sports in the United Kingdom can also be found in the Dossier : Sport in England - Public funding and participation.

The eSports industry has become an increasingly significant part of the entertainment sector in recent years. Players can compete against each other, individually or in teams, in a multiplayer video game tournaments across the world. In a survey conducted in May 2021, 12 percent of Hispanic respondents were avid fans of eSports in the United States.

The production value of the information sector in Belgium increased by 172.2 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the total production value amounted to 5.1 billion euros in 2019. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

During the first week of lockdown imposed by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Italy, the audience of the website of the Italian daily newspaper La Gazzetta increased by almost 250 percent compared to the week. The audience of ANSA News Agency's website grew by about 115 percent.

The statistic shows the global market share of smartwatch vendors in 2016, based on sales. Apple's share of the smartwatch market was 49 percent in 2016, more than any other vendor.

This statistic illustrates the total amount of venture capital private equity investments in Europe from the first quarter 2008 to the fourth quarter of 2014, broken down by quarter. Private equity is the OTC provision of equity capital through private or institutional investments with the participation of companies in another company for a limited time in order to generate financial benefits. It can be seen that total venture capital investments fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of more than 2.2 billion euros as of the fourth quarter of 2014. The largest value of investments was found in the third quarter of 2014, when venture capital investments of almost 3.1 billion euros were recorded.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Nepal from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Nepal amounted to 1.88 children per woman.

This statistic shows the number of guest accommodation and B & B ( bed and breakfast ) spaces sold in Northern Ireland from 2016 to 2017. The number of rooms in B & B accommodation increased from 376 thousand in 2016 to 414 thousand in 2017.
This statistic presents the market size of soft drink in Vietnam from 2010 to 2014. In 2010, the Vietnamese soft drink market size was valued at about 16.5 trillion Vietnamese dong.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing industry in Greece from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 45.4 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing industry in Slovenia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 23.19 billion euros.

The weekly value of bankruptcies in Norway after the coronavirus outbreak was significantly higher for companies with revenues lower than one million Norwegian kroner in week 13 of 2020 compared to the same week in 2019. This statistic shows the distribution of research and development spending on pharmaceuticals in Canada by region from 2017 to 2019. In 2019, the highest proportion of research and development spending on pharmaceuticals was in Ontario, representing 51 percent of the total pharmaceutical R & D spending in Canada.

This statistic shows the change in house prices in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between April 2020 and April 2021, according to the Halifax house price index. The index was set at 100 in 1992. In the 12 months to April 2021, the house price index in Manchester increased by seven percent.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in Ireland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 10.25 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 36.69 billion euros.

With 42.1 billion euros, the personnel costs thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in Sweden from 2008 to 2014. In 2014, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 35.44 billion euros.

This statistic shows the age distribution of Nepal from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 28.9 percent of the Nepalese population fell into the 0-14 year category, 64.5 percent into the 15-64 age group and 5.4 percent were over 65 years of age.

This statistic displays the total volume of Scotch whisky produced per annum from 2000 to 2015. The largest volume of Scotch whisky produced was in 2008 with a total production of 524 million litres of whisky. Since then the total volume of whisky produced has declined.

This statistic illustrates the penetration photo sharing as a communication method among various demographic groups in Italy in 2014. Thirteen percent of males reported using this method to contact family or friends.
