According to Ipsos, 52 percent of the respondents supported the introduction of more restrictive measures.

This statistic illustrates the usage of free media content and services in Italy in 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 25 percent of respondents stated to have used free on-demand video content in the past month.

The share of Swedes who used the internet on a daily basis was the highest among the 25 to 34-year-olds, with 100 percent of men and women in this age group reporting daily internet use. The share of women who used the internet daily was higher than the share of men in all age groups except for the 75 to 85-year-olds.

This statistic shows the share of individuals who have never used the internet in Sweden in 2020, by gender and age group. During the survey period, 6 percent of the total population stated that they had never used the internet. The group with highest share of never using the internet was women aged 75 to 85 years with a share of 27 percent.

The production value of the food product manufacturing industry in Austria saw no significant changes in 2020 in comparison to the previous year 2019. Still, the production value reached its highest value in the observed period in 2020.

The production value of the food product manufacturing industry in Switzerland decreased to 29.1 billion euros since the previous year. This means a decline by 1.2 billion euros in 2018.

In 2020, over 18 thousand Volvo cars were sold in Sweden. This was more than twice as many as the second most popular car model, the Volkswagen Golf. The Volvo brand is one of the largest automobile manufacturers worldwide.

The number of employees in the food product manufacturing industry in Denmark decreased to 53,086 employees since the previous year. This means a decline by 845 employees in 2019. This decrease was preceded by an increasing number of employees in this industry.

This statistic shows the percentage change in the number of passenger cars sold in Sweden in selected years from 2009 to 2020. This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Croatia from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the Croatian food product manufacturing sector employed a total number of 52,477 people.

As of February 28, 2022, the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the Americas region had reached over 1.47 million, while the number of confirmed deaths had totaled more than 319 thousand. The World Health Organization's strategic objectives as a response to the outbreak include interrupting human-to-human transmission, early identifying and isolating care for patients, identifying and reducing transmission from animal sources and addressing crucial unknowns regarding clinical severity, extent of transmission and infection, as well as treatment options.

According to a survey from April 2020, the level of worry about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak varied among the Finnish people according to their age group. The highest share of respondents aged 25 to 34 years ( 44 percent ) were not at all worried about the COVID-19 situation, while the largest share of people aged 65 to 79 years ( 25 percent ) expressed similar feelings. The first COVID-19 case in Finland was confirmed on January 29, 2020. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

American Football is one of the most popular sports in the United States, enjoyed by thousands of people live in the stadiums and millions more back home. The highest league in the land is the NFL, which consists of 32 teams divided equally into two conferences. At the end of the season, the two best-performing teams compete for the ultimate prize at the Super Bowl. College football is seen as the final step up towards the NFL, with the best performers on the college circuit gaining lucrative contracts with NFL teams at the end of each season during the NFL Draft. A January 2020 survey showed that 17 percent of male respondents very much preferred watching college football to NFL, while the same was true for 11 percent of females.

More than 50 percent of respondents were of the opinion that the elections for the Romanian Parliament in autumn 2020 should not be organized. However, over 40 percent of respondents believed that the elections should take place in autumn 2020.

This statistic displays the number of successful and unsuccessful quit dates among adults who had quit smoking in England in 2019/20, by age. In this period, 21 percent of respondents aged between 45 and 59 years old reported they did not know how many successful or unsuccessful their quit date was.

This statistic illustrates the trend in sales turnover of shops selling outerwear in the Netherlands annually from 2007 to 2017. The turnover value of Dutch outerwear stores showed a slight decline between 2011 and 2015. In 2016 and 2017, the turnover increased again.

This statistic illustrates the trend in sales turnover of shops selling footwear in the Netherlands annually from 2007 to 2017. The turnover value of Dutch footwear stores showed a decline between 2011 and 2016. In 2017, turnover increased again.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Kazakhstan from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Kazakhstan was 73.23 years.

This statistic shows the number of personnel in police services in Canada from 1990 to 2019. In 2019, there were 100,291 people employed in police services across Canada.
This statistic shows the total value of life benefits paid on the domestic insurance market of Slovenia between 2004 and 2019. The payments peaked in 2019 at 506 million euros.

This statistic shows the total public expenditure on education in Finland from 2003 to 2011. Such spending peaked for this period in 2011 when it reached 10.6 billion PPP ( Purchasing Power Standard ).

This statistic shows the total public expenditure on education in the European Union from 2003 to 2011. Public expenditure on education increased between 2003 and 2011, reaching 664 billion PPP ( Purchasing Power Standard ) in 2011.

A recent survey from IPSOS found that an increasing share of people worldwide think that the population in their country should be locked down until the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) is contained, with this number increasing by as much as 17 percentage points in Italy. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents worldwide who felt that the population in their country should be locked down until COVID-19 is contained as of March 12, 2020, by country.

This statistic shows the customer satisfaction with Wal-Mart in Canada as of May 2014 and 2016. During the survey, 37 percent of the respondents said they were very satisfied with their overall shopping experience at Wal-Mart in 2014, decreasing to 33 percent in 2016.

This statistic shows the customer satisfaction with Costco in Canada as of May 2014 and 2016. During the survey, 63 percent of the respondents said they were very satisfied with their overall shopping experience at Costco in 2014, decreasing to 62 percent in 2016.

In 2020, the national debt of New Zealand amounted to approximately 44.09 percent of the GDP.

This statistic displays the quantity of breakfast cereal products consumed per day in the United Kingdom between 2008 and 2012, by age. In this four year period, individuals aged between 19 and 64 years old consumed 20 grams of high fibre breakfast cereals per day.

This statistic displays the quantity of butter consumed per day in the United Kingdom between 2008 and 2012, by age. In this four year period, individuals aged 65 years and over consumed 7 grams of butter per day.

Overwatch is a team-based online shooter video game published by Blizzard Entertainment. The player can choose between 32 varied heroes, all of whom have different skills, and each character fulfills a specific role. The game was released in May 2016 on Xbox One, Windows and PlayStation 4. Overwatch events on the video streaming service Twitch were watched by an average of 12.2 thousand viewers in January 2022.

This statistic displays the quantity of sausages consumed per day in the United Kingdom between 2008 and 2012, by age. In this four year period, individuals aged between 4 and 10 years old consumed 15 grams of sausages per day.

The statistic displays the share of wealth that the richest ten percent of the population owned in selected European countries as of 2014. The statistic displays the threshold of wealth owned by the richest ten percent of the population in selected European countries as of 2014. For instance, in Germany the cut-off point was at 0.72 million euros in 2014. This means that the richest ten percent of the German population owned more than 720 million euros in 2014.

Between 2006 and 2020, road fatalities in Belgium were on a general decline. During this period, the number of road deaths decreased by over 550. In 2020, Belgium recorded 496 road traffic fatalities, a decrease of roughly 25 percent in comparison with the peak year.

This line graph shows the number of road traffic fatalities per year in Germany between 2006 and 2019. An overall decrease in the number of road deaths was observed within the time period shown. The highest number of road fatalities in this timeframe occurred in 2006, which is the starting date of this statistic.From 2006 to 2019, the number of road traffic fatalities per year in Germany decreased from 5,099 fatalities to 3,099 fatalities. This represents a decrease of approximately 33 percent over the 12-year period. Since 2012, the number of road fatalities in Germany have been below 3,500 fatalities per annum.

This statistic displays the age-standardized rate of bladder cancer among males in Canada between 1988 and 2013, with a forecast for 2014 to 2017. During the survey period, it was found that 62 percent of respondents stated that digital learning enabled them to learn at their own pace.

This statistic displays the proportion of the total public drug program expenditures for non-seniors in Canada by broad drug classes as of 2020. During this year, 11.4 percent of total drug program spending for non-seniors was dedicated to antirheumatic and immunosuppressant drugs.
This statistic shows the most important import partners for Algeria in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for Algeria was China with a share of 18 percent in all imports.
This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Armenia in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Armenia was Russia, with a share of 22 percent in exports.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the Danish insurance market from 2004 to 2019. The number of employees fluctuated throughout the time. A total of 14,267 people were employed in Danish insurance companies in 2019.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information and communication industry in Malta from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the information and communication industry produced a turnover of approximately 1.57 billion euros.
This statistic shows the age structure in Georgia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 20.23 percent of Georgia's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.
This statistic shows the median number of weeks of unemployment for people who became unemployed employed in the U.S. from 2007 to 2014. In 2010, the median duration of unemployment was 10.4 weeks.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the Dutch insurance market from 2004 to 2019. The number of employees decreased year-on-year, except for 2018, 2019, and 2020, when the number of employees increased slightly. In 2019, there were approximately 40,000 employees working in insurance companies in the Netherlands.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the Turkish insurance market from 2004 to 2019. The number of people employed fluctuated throughout the time. In 2019, there were 19,521 employees working in insurance companies in Turkey, a decrease from the previous year.

On February 10, 2022, there were 1,979 new cases of COVID-19 in New York City. The state of New York has been one of the hardest hit U.S. states by the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the number of new COVID-19 cases in New York City from March 8, 2020 to February 10, 2022, by diagnosis date.

In 2019, the production value of the information and communication industry in Bulgaria increased by 765.9 million euros since 2018. With 6.4 billion euros, the production value thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

In 2019, the production value of the information and communication industry in Switzerland increased by 4.2 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the production value in Switzerland reached a peak in 2019 with 54.4 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry has been, with the exception of 2013, continuously increasing over the last years.

This statistic illustrates the market share of life premiums distribution channels in Luxembourg from 2012 to 2017. In 2017, the leading distribution channel was agents, accounting for approximately 32.5 percent of total life insurance sales.

This statistic shows the share of households with children that own a pet in Canada in 2013, by age of child. Among the households with children aged between three and five years, 48 percent owned a pet.

This statistic illustrates the market share of life premiums distribution channels in Slovenia from 2012 to 2017. In 2017, the leading distribution channel was agents, accounting for 72.2 percent of total life insurance sales.

This statistic illustrates the market share of non-life premiums distribution channels in Belgium from 2012 to 2016. In 2016, direct writing dominated the market with 60.7 percent of non-life insurance policies being distributed directly by insurance companies.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Guatemala from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Guatemala amounted to 2.87 children per woman.

Non-cash payments in Europe are expected to increase to 178 billion by 2020. In 2005, the number of non-cash transactions was 70 billion. The rise of digital payments, both in physical stores and online, has been one of the main drivers behind the growth of this market.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the accommodation and food service activities industry in Malta from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the accommodation and food service industry employed a total number of 17,542 people.

This statistic displays how often adults in the United Kingdom consume an alcoholic beverage containing alcohol. In 2018, 21 percent of respondents said they consume an alcoholic drink containing alcohol 2 to 3 times a week.

On February 10, 2022, there were 17 deaths due to COVID-19 in New York City. The state of New York has been one of the hardest hit U.S. states by the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the number of new COVID-19 deaths in New York City from March 3, 2020 to February 10, 2022, by date.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Lithuania from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 17,098 people. By 2018, the number of employees had remained fairly stable at 18,015 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Lithuanian construction industry amounted to approximately 82.7 thousand people.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in the Netherlands from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 51,076 people. By 2018, the number of employees had decreased to 50,766 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Dutch construction industry amounted to approximately 363.7 thousand people.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Austria increased by 1,936 employees since the previous year. Therefore, the total number of employees amounted to 35,099 employees in 2019.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Malta from 2009 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 814 people. By 2018, the number of employees had remained stable at 892 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Maltese construction industry amounted to approximately 4.7 thousand people.

This statistic displays the reasons why individuals sometimes drink alcohol in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. Of respondents, 72 percent drink alcohol to celebrate special events such as weddings, anniversaries or birthdays.

In 2019, the personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Germany increased by 1.1 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the personnel costs in Germany reached a peak in 2019 with 13.3 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Spain from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 4.68 billion euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had decreased to around 4.39 billion euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the Spanish construction industry amounted to approximately 33.9 billion euros.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in France from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 8.84 billion euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had risen to around 10.74 billion euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the French construction industry amounted to approximately 161.7 billion euros.

This statistic displays how often adults in the United Kingdom get drunk when they consume alcohol. In 2014, almost half of respondents said they never get drunk when they consume alcohol.

The COVID-19 case rate among adults in New York City was highest among those aged 18 to 24 years as of February 13, 2022. This statistic shows rates of COVID-19 cases in New York City as of February 13, 2022, by age group.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 219.9 million euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had decreased to around 233.6 million euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the Luxembourg construction industry amounted to approximately 1.1 billion euros.
This statistic displays the number of employees working in the publishing activities industry in Portugal from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the publishing activities industry employed 9,543 people.

This statistic displays the response of individuals in the United Kingdom when asked how much they agree that moderate drinking is good for their health. Of respondents, 41 percent neither agreed nor disagreed that moderate drinking is good for health.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the wholesale and retail trade including the repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles industry in Malta from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the wholesale and retail trade industry produced a turnover of approximately 7.6 billion euros.

The total greenhouse gas emissions of the British Barclays Group have decreased considerably between 2015 and 2020. In 2015, the group emitted 467.5 thousand tons of CO2, whereas in 2020, this amount had fallen to 197.5 thousand tons.
The number of enterprises in the publishing activities industry in Germany decreased to 7,664 enterprises since the previous year. This means a decline by 545 enterprises in 2019.
This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the publishing activities industry in Estonia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 401 enterprises in the publishing activities industry.

The production value of the publishing activities industry in Belgium decreased to 2.2 billion euros since the previous year. As a result, the production value in Belgium saw its lowest number in 2019 with 2.2 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018.
In 2021, Metro, Inc., had a total of 646 drugstores, and 351 neighborhood stores in Canada. The company had a total of 1,098 properties in Canada that year.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the publishing activities industry in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the publishing activities industry had a production value of approximately 28.19 billion euros.

The outbreak of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) had a major impact on the online retail industry in Hungary. During the 2020 March 22 to March 28, 2020 survey, 56 percent of respondents stated that they had increased their online purchases of food and groceries. At the same time, respondents also stated that they had decreased their spending on clothing and footwear.

This statistic illustrates the share of the gross domestic product ( GDP ) spent on all modes of inland transport infrastructure in Belgium from 2004 to 2017. The highest share was recorded in 2015 at 0.9 percent.

In 2018, the most popular source for listening to music among respondents aged 16 to 19 was on-demand streaming, with 60 percent of respondents using this method to listen to music. This was followed by digital downloads ( 49 percent ) and FM/FM radio ( 44 percent ).

According to a study carried out by Deezer in May 2018, the most popular genre among Americans was rock music, with 57 percent of respondents stating that they were currently listening to music within this genre as of the date of survey. Pop and country music were the second and third most popular genres respectively, and 21 percent of respondents said they preferred the electronic music genre.

In 2019, the production value of the transportation and storage industry in Denmark increased by 2.2 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the production value in Denmark reached a peak in 2019 with 61.8 billion euros. The recent development could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry has been, with the exception of 2016, continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the number of feed cattle produced in Canada from 2011 to 2020, by region. In 2020, around 2,110 feed cattle were produced in Alberta.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the transportation and storage industry in Latvia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the transportation and storage industry had a production value of approximately 4.18 billion euros.

This statistic shows the travel information sources that residents of Turkey considered to be the most important when making holiday plans in 2015. Based on figures from the European Commission, recommendations of friends, colleagues or relatives were the most considered sources for 52 percent of respondents, while 6 percent contacted travel agencies or tourism offices.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the transportation and storage industry in Norway from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the transportation and storage industry had a production value of approximately 47.1 billion euros.

This survey shows the percentage of Canadians over the age of 65 years that had written a will or a living will as of 2017, by province. Some 81 percent of elderly citizens living in Saskatchewan had a will or a living will.

This survey shows the percentage of Canadians over the age of 65 years that had been told by a health professional that they had a limited life expectancy of five years or less as of 2011. Some 16 percent of those surveyed had been told they did not have a hospitalization order.

As of March 3, 2022, the number of active coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) infections in France was over 22.7 million. Since the start of the pandemic, the virus had infected almost 67 million people in the country. Over 1.6 million people had died from the disease, while more than 16.5 million had recovered.

During a March 2020 survey of media buyers and planners in the United States, gauging the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on short term advertising strategies, 44 percent of respondents said they were planning to increase their emphasis on cause-related marketing efforts, and 33 percent said the same about brand equity. On the other hand 45 percent were going to step away from performance marketing for the time being. All in all, 63 percent of responding marketers said they were going to make changes to their messaging strategies between March and June 2020.

In a 2019 survey, 61 percent of informal caregivers in the United States reported that they had to take time off from work to provide care, while 54 percent stated they needed to take time off to deal with their own health issues. This statistic shows the annual turnover for the mining and quarrying industry in Norway from 2008 to 2016. In 2012, the mining and quarrying industry produced a turnover of approximately 187.9 billion euros.

According to a survey from March 2020, about two thirds of Norwegian media executives thought the COVID-19 outbreak has a very or fairly large impact on short-term advertising revenues, with 63 percent of respondents even agreeing with the statement that advertising will be nearly non-existent in the coming months. However, over 40 percent of respondents believed that advertising will survive the crisis and even grow in the long run.

At the same time 58 percent were going to decrease their spend on TV advertising, and 40 percent the same for print.

This statistic displays the migration figures of Spanish people leaving or returning to Spain from 2010 to 2020. This trend however initiated a fall by 2016, year in which the amount of Spaniards coming back to their country started to pick up. In 2020, the amount of people originally from Spain that returned to their country outnumbered those who left for other places, with figures reaching over 54 thousand returnees.

This ranking system is then used to match players of similar skill levels against each other in online games. Given the competitive nature of the game, it is no surprise that Call of Duty : Warzone has developed a loyal legion of fans. This statistic shows the median age of the population in Ghana from 1950 to 2050 *.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups ; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Ghanaian population was 20.3 years.

The statistic shows Tanzania's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2020, Tanzania's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity amounted to approximately 0.06 percent.

During the first years of the period under consideration, the net migration figures of foreign nationals leaving or moving to Spain resulted in positive figures, with the number of migrants exceeding the number of departures by approximately 30 thousand in 2010. This trend, however, terminated in 2015, year in which the net migration of foreign nationals leaving or moving to Spain resulted in negative figures, with the number of departures exceeding the number of arrivals by approximately 84 thousand. This trend also affected the population of foreign nationals residing in Spain, with the number of residents with a migration background decreasing in the last years.
In 2019, nine percent of total enterprises in Denmark sold products via websites or apps to other European countries. This is a one percent increase from 2017.
This statistic depicts the volume of apple production in France from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, the volume of produced apples was expected to reach more than 1.4 million tons.

This statistic shows the age structure in Uganda from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 46.23 percent of Uganda's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the leading kitchen appliance finish types among homeowners in Canada as of February 2015. During the survey, 82 percent of the respondents said they chose to have a kitchen appliance finish made of stainless steel.

This statistic shows the distribution of the gross domestic product ( GDP ) across economic sectors in Uganda from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, agriculture contributed around 24.01 percent to the GDP of Uganda, 26.09 percent came from the industry, and 43.94 percent from the services sector.

This statistic shows the share of economic sectors in the gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Tanzania from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the share of agriculture in Tanzania's gross domestic product was 26.59 percent, industry contributed approximately 28.79 percent and the services sector contributed about 36.06 percent.

This statistic ranks the outdoor advertising locations in Spain by number of people who had perceived it as of April 2020. The location with the highest number of people who had perceived it as of April 2020 was the roundabout of the city of Valencia with about 20.2 thousand people.
This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Ireland from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 422.5 million euro.
This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Italy from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 712 million euros.

A recent survey of U.S. adults showed that the majority of respondents would consider changing their behavior to protect themselves against coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who would consider taking the following actions in the future to protect themselves from coronavirus as of February 9, 2020.

More than one third of respondents considered that the most important challenge that Romania would have to face in the European Union was related to the country's status as a member of the union. Only five percent of respondents considered that taxation was the most important issue for Romania in the EU.

This statistic displays the permitted blood alcohol levels for driving road vehicles in Europe in 2018, in grams of alcohol per liter of blood. Malta and the United Kingdom ( UK ) have the highest limits by a margin of 0.3 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. These two countries have an alcohol limit of 0.8 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. However, the vast majority of countries have set their legal alcohol limits for drivers at 0.5 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. Five countries have more restrictive rules and set their legal limit at 0.0 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. These restrictive rules are applied in the Slovak Republic, Hungary, China, Indonesia and Russia.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the programming and broadcasting activities industry in France from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the programming and broadcasting activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 11.94 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the programming and broadcasting activities industry in Finland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the programming and broadcasting activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 575.4 million euros.

This statistic shows the number of employees of the leading food and beverage companies in Canada in 2016. McCain Foods Inc. employed approximately 200,000 people in Canada in 2016, making it the largest food and beverage company in terms of employee numbers.

The statistic shows Lesotho's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2020, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2020, Lesotho's budget surplus amounted to around 0.21 percent of GDP.
This statistic shows the number of stores operated by Canadian Tire Corporation in Canada in 2020, by brand. Canadian Tire operated 672 Canadian Tire stores in 2020.

This survey shows the percentage of physicians in the U.S. that reported having a burn-out workplace, according to a survey conducted from March to May 2019, by generation. It was found that 35 percent of Millennial physicians reported having a workplace with burn-out programs.

This statistic shows data on the total consumption of chocolate and cocoa products by households in Spain from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, a total of 162 million kilograms of chocolate and cocoa products were consumed by Spanish households.

The personnel costs of the real estate industry in Switzerland increased by 183.9 million euros since the previous year. With 3.1 billion euros, the personnel costs thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2017. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

This statistic shows the percentage of adults in the U.S. with at least one permanent tooth who had complete tooth loss ( edentulism ) in 2011-2012, by age and ethnicity. During this time, 11.9 percent of non-Hispanic black adults aged between 20 and 39 years had complete tooth loss.
This statistic shows the population change in Niger from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Niger's population increased by approximately 3.76 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the system-wide average business class air fares in Canada from the first quarter of 2015 to the second quarter of 2017. The average quarterly discounted business air fare in the second quarter of 2017 amounted to 5,300 Canadian dollars.

This statistic shows the consumption of frozen fries in Canada from 2000/01 to 2018/19. In the marketing year of 2017/18, the consumption of frozen fries in Canada amounted to approximately 235,000 metric tons.

This statistic shows the number of spinal cord injuries in Scotland in the period 2020/21, split by the mechanism of injury. It was followed by road traffic accidents which came to 20.

The outbreak of coronavirus in Poland had a significant impact on Poles'mobility. The most significant decrease in mobility was recorded in places such as restaurants, cafs, shopping centers, theme parks, museums, libraries, and cinemas. Significant changes also took place in shops, pharmacies, and parks. However, Poles'mobility in shops and pharmacies increased significantly.

This graph shows the total number of students enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada from school year 2000/01 to 2019/20. In the 2019/20 school year, about 4.96 million students were enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada.

In 2019, e-commerce accounted for six percent of total retail sales in Canada. That year, clothing and clothing accessories stores generated 2.5 percent of total retail sales via e-commerce.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the scientific research & development industry in Croatia from 2009 to 2015. In 2009, the scientific research & development industry produced a turnover of approximately 148.5 million euros.

This statistic displays the potential cost savings in healthcare through mobile health in 2014. In that year, it was estimated that mobile health could save 34 U.S. dollars per patient visit in costs for payers. There has been a slow adoption of mobile health in the United States market.

This statistic displays the mortality rate of lung cancer in 2013, by selected European countries and gender. During the time of the coronavirus pandemic, consumers seem rather positive about brands keeping in touch. Therefore, the production value declined to 696.8 million euros in 2020. This decrease was preceded by an increasing production value in this industry. This statistic shows the value of organic and ecological vegetable seed in Canada in 2012, by region. In Ontario, approximately 6.5 million Canadian dollars worth of organic and ecological vegetable seed was produced in 2012.

During the time of the coronavirus pandemic, global consumers seem rather positive about brands keeping in touch. In March 2020 they were asked how they feel about brands communicating their response to the outbreak, and the majority said they were pleased that brands were contributing to the fight against the global crisis by making various donations. Most wanted to hear from brands in that time, and in all countries surveyed, the majority were happy to receive news from brands. However, they were less enthusiastic about receiving news from brands in China.

The production value of the wearing apparel manufacturing industry in Switzerland decreased to 791.8 million euros since the previous year. As a result, the production value in Switzerland saw its lowest number in 2018 with 791.8 million euros. The recent development could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2017.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Panama from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. Gross domestic product ( GDP ) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2020, Panama's gross domestic product amounted to around 30.66 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Malta from 2009 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 7.4 million euros.
This statistic shows the main import partners for Panama in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for Panama was China with a share of 21 percent in all imports.

This timeline displays the household purchase value of chilled fish and seafood from discounters in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the purchase value gradually increased over this period of time, going from roughly 177 million euros in 2009 to over 283 million euros in 2018.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in Panama by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 15.01 percent of the employees in Panama were active in the agricultural sector, 18.12 percent in industry and 67.01 percent in the service sector.

This statistic shows the distribution of the frozen fish and seafood market value in France from 2009 to 2020, by distribution channel. It reveals that supermarkets and hypermarkets consistently held the highest share over this period of time.

Between 2008 and 2019, the value of whole milk powder imported to France increased by more than 20 million euros. In 2019, the import value of whole milk powder amounted to 120 million euros, compared to an estimated 45 million euros in 2008.

The statistic shows Ethiopia's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2020, Ethiopia's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity amounted to approximately 0.06 percent.
This statistic shows the population change in Ethiopia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Ethiopia's population increased by approximately 2.54 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic presents the distribution of hours watched of selected games on Twitch worldwide in 2022. According to the source, League of Legends accounted for 14.7 percent of the total hours watched on Twitch in 2022.
This statistic shows the age structure in Lebanon from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 24.93 percent of Lebanon's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

In 2019, the number of bullfighting events and other bull festivals in Spain amounted to 1,450, down from 1,530 a year earlier. Other festivals involving cattle, such as the widely known San Fermin celebrations in Pamplona, account for approximately a quarter of bull events.
This statistic shows the number of inbound tourist arrivals in France in 2018, by continent of residence. That year, there were approximately seven million tourist arrivals from Asia in France.
In 2019/2020, over 76 thousand first-time asylum applications were filed in the European Union, with the majority coming from Hungary, followed by Afghanistan.
In 2020 there were 652 thousand illegal border crossings detected at the borders of the European Union, compared with just over 730 thousand in the previous year.
In 2020 there were 22,819 illegal border-crossings of the Western African route into the European Union through the Canary Islands, the highest recorded since 2009.

The statistic shows the leading U.S. second screen devices used while watching TV and digital video streamed on TV as of January 2017. During the survey period, it was found that 35 percent of respondents who watched digital video streamed on TV while doing so on a computer.

The statistic shows Libya's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2019, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2019, Libya's budget surplus amounted to around 20.21 percent of GDP.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Belgium from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 98.38 percent of Belgium's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

Based on a survey conducted in the country in October 2021, 41 percent of respondents were feeling the effects of not seeing friends or family, while 32 percent were missing going to concerts or sporting events.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Ecuador from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 64.18 percent of Ecuador's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the number of new semi-trailers registered in France between 2004 and 2017. Semi-trailers are vehicles which are not mechanically propelled and weigh more than 3.5 metric tons. The number of new semi-trailers registered amounted to 22,000 in 2017.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Finland from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 85.51 percent of Finland's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Malaysia from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 77.18 percent of Malaysia's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in New Zealand from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 86.69 percent of New Zealand's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Romania from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 54.19 percent of Romania's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic presents the results of a survey among U.S. adult consumers. The survey was fielded online by Harris Interactive in March 2015, asking the respondents if they try to include or avoid organic foods in their diet. Some 44 percent of U.S. adults indicated to try to include organic foods in their diet.

This statistic shows the share of residents who agree or disagree that food trucks compete with restaurants in Toronto as of April 2014, by gender. This statistic shows the amount of waste sent to different treatment methods by local authority services in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2016/17 and 2017/18. Waste sent to incineration or energy recovery increased from 166,000 tonnes in 2016/17 to 383,000 tonnes in 2017/18.

This statistic shows the distribution of the United Kingdom ( UK ) government's Department of Energy & Climate Change ( DECC ) grant-in-aid recipients in 2014 and 2015/16. The majority of grants were awarded to large-scale renewable projects.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Switzerland has led to restrictions on contact between people and larger gatherings being cancelled. This statistic displays the age-standardised rate of cancer per 100,000 population in 2012. In this year, the highest rate of cancer was in Belgium with approximately 337 people per 100,000 population diagnosed.

This statistic shows the people French tourists traveled with on their vacation in 2014. It appears that more than 40 percent of the respondents traveled alone, while nearly 20 percent traveled with their partner.

This statistic shows the sales volume of wine in British Columbia ( BC ) from 2012/13 to 2018/19. The sales volume of wine in the Canadian province of British Columbia reached approximately 76.68 million liters in the fiscal year ending March 2019.

This statistic shows the retail sales of the beer import market in British Columbia ( BC ) in the fourth quarter of 2019/20, by region. This statistic shows the sales volume of domestic cider in British Columbia ( BC ) from 2011 to 2015, by type. The sales volume of domestic packaged cider in the Canadian province of British Columbia reached approximately 12.68 million liters in the fiscal year ending March 2015.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in Switzerland, the population was advised to stay at home as much as possible and only go outside for necessities. Based on a survey conducted in the country in 2020, most respondents stated they spend their time at home watching TV.

This statistic shows the sales volume of grapefruit and pomelo in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2018. This statistic provides information on the number of internet users in Saudi Arabia from 2015 to 2019 and a forecast up to 2025. In 2019, Saudi Arabia had 28.5 million internet users. This figure is projected to grow to 36.5 million internet users in 2025.

This statistic shows the percentage of educational institutions with internet connection in Spain from 2009/2010 to 2016/2017. In 2016/2017, 95.9 percent of educational institutions in Spain had internet connection.
This statistic shows the total number of jobs in Canada in 2020, distinguished by industry. In 2020, there were 1.47 million construction workers employed or self-employed in Canada.

This statistic illustrates how many Nissan Qashqai passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2007 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Nissan Qashqai was observed in 2016, when over 63 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 52,372 units.

This statistic illustrates how many Audi A3 passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2001 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Audi A3 was observed in 2015, when over 42 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 17,448 units.

This statistic illustrates how many Range Rover Evoque passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2001 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Range Rover Evoque was observed in 2019, when over 51,000 units were newly registered.

In 2021, 42.4 percent of respondents in Central and Eastern Europe ( CEE ) were confident that their company's revenue would grow in the next three years. This is a significant increase compared to the previous year, when only 26.5 percent of respondents felt the same.

This statistic illustrates how many Fiat 208 passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2012 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Fiat 208 was observed in 2013, when over 37 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 20,371 units.

This statistic shows the wireless internet access worldwide as of June 2015, by device. During the survey period, it was found that 82 percent of the global population had online access via Wi-Fi at home.

This statistic displays the greenhouse gas emissions in Northern Ireland in 2014, in kilotons of carbon dioxide equivalent. The majority of emissions came from the land use, land use change and forestry ( LULUCF ) sector, with 1,067 kilotons of carbon dioxide equivalent emitted.

This statistic displays the number of dentists employed in the health sector in Germany from 2000 to 2019. In 2019 there were over 71 thousand dentists employed in the healthcare sector in Germany, an increase from previous years.

The number of dentists employed in Iceland was relatively stable during the period from 2000 to 2020. The highest number during this period was in 2008, when there were 301 dentists employed in Iceland. In 2020, there were 290 dentists employed in the country.

This statistic displays the number of dentists employed in the health sector in Luxembourg from 2000 to 2017. In 2017 there were 581 dentists employed in the healthcare sector in Luxembourg, the highest number in the provided time interval.
The number of pharmacists employed in Denmark generally increased since 2000. The number grew from around 2.2 thousand pharmacists in 2000, up to over 3.2 thousand pharmacists in 2018.

This statistic shows the biggest online threats to older relatives according to internet users worldwide as of June 2015. During the survey period, 52 percent of respondents stated that they were afraid of getting infected with a virus or malware when using the internet.

The statistic presents information on the expected duration of time that businesses will invest in social media usage and implementation worldwide in 2014. During the survey, 27 percent of respondents stated that it would take them between one and two years to get used to social media and its implementation.

This statistic shows the volume of radioactive waste produced by the non-nuclear industry in France in 2016, by type of waste in cubic meters. In 2016, the French non-nuclear industry produced more than 20,000 cubic meters of radioactive waste.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, many employees were working from home. Their main inconvenience was the lack of direct interaction with colleagues - 38 percent of respondents, and the difficulty in separating work and private time - 38 percent as well.

This statistic shows the annual value of residential property purchase transactions carried in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014, by individuals. It appears that the value of transactions fell during the period under observation, reaching a low of approximately 173.2 billion British pounds in 2009. In 2014, the transactions value increased to over 283 billion British pounds.

This statistic shows the value of property purchase transactions carried in the public sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014. The transactions were valued at approximately 3.3 billion British pounds ( GBP ) in 2014.

This statistic shows the annual value of property purchase transactions carried out by financial institutions in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014. There was a sharp reduction in transaction values at the beginning of housing market and credit crisis in 2008, when the value of property purchase transactions carried out by financial institutions fell to approximately 5.6 billion British pounds. By 2014, the transactions value recovered and reached a total of 7.7 billion British pounds.

This statistic presents information on the most commonly experienced financial threats by internet users worldwide as of June 2015. During the survey period it was found that 20 percent of respondents had received anonymous or unsolicited e-mails or messages claiming to be from a bank or financial institution.

In 2020, Canada had a trade surplus of around 3.2 billion Canadian dollars with its neighbor to the south, the United States. This is compared to a trade deficit of around 4.2 billion dollars with the U.S. in 2019.

This bar chart shows the number of powered road goods vehicles registered in Slovenia that travelled by ferry from United Kingdom ( UK ) ports to mainland Europe between 2009 and 2017. A total of nine thousand Slovenian goods vehicles travelled to mainland Europe in 2012, which accounted for 1.09 percent of all goods vehicles that travelled by ferry to the continent that year. In 2016, the number decreased to eight thousand.

This bar chart shows the number of powered road goods vehicles registered in Bulgaria that travelled by ferry from United Kingdom ( UK ) ports to mainland Europe between 2009 and 2017. A total of 31 thousand Bulgarian goods vehicles travelled to mainland Europe in 2010, which accounted for 1.63 percent of all goods vehicles that travelled by ferry to the continent that year. In 2016 this had increased to 80 thousand vehicles.

This statistic presents the sentiments of adults in the United Kingdom ( UK ) towards the government's proposal to force empty homes into use, as of 2014. A total of 44 percent of respondents said that they `` strongly disagree '' with the proposal.
This statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Canada in 2018, distinguished by major industry. In 2018, the GDP of the construction industry in Canada was 173.7 billion Canadian dollars.
This statistic shows the real Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of Canada in 2020, distinguished by province. In 2020, Ontario's real GDP was 710.05 billion chained 2012 Canadian dollars.

The number of specialists in infectious diseases and public hygiene in Russia reached 13.9 thousand in 2020, marking a slight increase from the previous year. In the period under consideration, the highest number of doctors in this specialty was recorded in 1995, at over 34.3 thousand.

This statistic presents the expectations of adults in the United Kingdom ( UK ) regarding the actions that the government should take to deal with empty homes as of 2014. A total of 66 percent of respondents said that they expect the government to make it more difficult for owners to get a mortgage on an empty property, while a further 51 percent said they want the government to impose a tax on empty homes.

The Rugby Football Union ( RFU ) is the governing body of rugby union in England. History During the end of the 18th century British public schools, almost exclusively attended by boys from the more affluent upper classes, were governed by strict and often cruel disciplinary action in lessons. In contrast to this, the Masters were almost entirely ambivalent to the activities that took place outside the classroom, resulting in a culture of bullying and brutality that persisted into the 19th century. During this time the Masters were also almost entirely ambivalent to the financial situation of their school, resulting in mismanagement of funds and widespread waste. In contrast to this, the Headmaster of Rugby School, Dr Thomas Arnold recognized the potential of a group sport activity to occupy the time of the mischievous students whilst simultaneously introducing positive Christian values, in a concept known as  muscular Christianity'_. The successful use of games as a vehicle for achieving social control in Rugby School lead to a similar application of muscular Christianity across the increasingly expanding number of public schools. Although many schools adopted a form of group competitive activity, the precise rules of the game varied considerably from school to school, often formed by former public school boy that wished to continue participating in their sport. In the late 19th Century two proponents of the game published a letter in The Times suggesting that a national governing body should be established to regulate the game, however the letter was largely ignored. The first national governing body for the game was established in 1894, the Rugby Football Union ( RFU ), with the primary objective of governing the game, but also to promote the  muscular Christianity'_'_, raise funds for charity, and improve the playing standards of both amateur and professional players. Although the precise rules of the game varied from club to club, the general objective was to have a governing body that could make decisions regarding player selection, competition structure and overall game standards. In the beginning the Rugby Football Union was made up of the leading public schools, but as the game grew in popularity it increasingly drew in schools from outside of the public system. In the first half of the 20th century the Rugby Football Union also began to make decisions regarding the financial standards of the clubs, however mismanagement of funds and a culture of waste continued to plague the organization. In the late 1990s a group of former public schoolboys that wished to continue participating in their sport formed the Rugby Football Union ( RFU ) Charitable Trust, a not-for-profit organization dedicated to the promotion of rugby union, it

This statistic depicts foreign affiliate sales of goods and services in Canada in 2017, distinguished by country or region. In 2017, Canadian-owned foreign affiliates generated sales of about 393.5 billion Canadian dollars in the United States.

This bar chart shows the total number of registered cars in Great Britain ( UK ) with carbon dioxide emission levels between 201 and 225 grams per kilometer from 2001 to 2017. In terms of emissions-based vehicle tax, these cars fall under band K, although this category also includes older vehicles with higher emissions figures. The number of cars in this emission band grew steadily over the observed time period, until 2012 when the number of cars with these emission levels began to decline.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who visit a dentist regularly in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. According to the data, 69 percent of individuals in Scotland and Wales regularly visit the dentist.
This statistic shows the number of full-time workers in Canada in 2019, distinguished by province. In 2019, about 4.77 million people were working full-time in Ontario.

This statistic illustrates the percentage of the total licensed cars in Great Britain that fell into the 131 to 140 grams per kilometer carbon dioxide emission band between 2001 and 2017. For the purposes of vehicle taxation, this category is known as Band E. In 2017, cars in this emission band accounted for 9.8 percent of the total licensed car stock in Great Britain.

This statistic depicts the percentage distribution of after-tax income in Canada in 2019, based on the income level. In 2019, income earners in the top 20 percent earned 12.5 percent of all after-tax income in Canada.

This statistic shows the leading home system upgrades among homeowners who renovated in Canada in 2017. During the survey, some 31 percent of the respondents said that they had upgraded their plumbing system during their most recent home renovation project.

This statistic shows the likelihood of consumers to use their mobile phones to shop around for energy deals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. The figures are very similar across each category. Almost half of the respondents strongly agree that they would use their mobile phones to shop around for the best deals, and 24 percent of respondents strongly disagree that they would do so.

The number of requests for driving routes on the Apple Maps application in Russia increased by over 60 percent on March 19, 2021 compared to the previous day. The service resumed working on March 25, 2020 after a two-day shutdown.
This statistic depicts the median annual family income in Canada from 2000 to 2018. In 2018, the median annual family income in Canada was 87,930 Canadian dollars.

This statistic displays the distribution of long term empty dwellings in England as of 2014, by region. Long term empty dwellings are defined as dwelling which were empty for longer than six months. In 2014, the North East had the highest proportion of long term empty dwellings with 17 percent.

This statistic displays the total sales value of small retail businesses ( excluding automotive fuel sales ) in Great Britain monthly from January 2017 to December 2021. The amount spent in small retailers reached approximately 11.6 billion British pounds in December 2021.

This statistic displays the share of hot beverages consumed most often by individuals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. Of respondents, 44 percent drink tea most often, followed by 21 percent who drink instant coffee. Hot drinks have always played an important role in British culture, particularly in the case of tea, as seen in the high and rising market value of hot drinks. Recently, however, the increasing popularity of coffee has dented sales of tea, turning Brits into a nation of coffee drinkers. This has been furthered exaggerated by cheaper and easier access to premium coffee via the likes of coffee pod machines. Tea is also making a new name for itself, however, with loose leaf tea, as well as fruit and herbal teas, appealing to the many that are improving their eating habits and following current health and wellness trends.

This statistic shows the monthly export value of farm and fishing products in Canada from January 2015 to March 2021. In March 2021, exports of farm and fishing products from Canada amounted to approximately 3.47 billion Canadian dollars.

This statistic shows the monthly export value of wheat in Canada from January 2015 to August 2021. In August 2021, exports of wheat from Canada amounted to approximately 793.8 million Canadian dollars.

The expectation for men in France was 79.2 years in 2020. Variations are relatively small by region, except for the island of Mayotte. Indeed, the gap is three years ( except Mayotte ) between the expected life of a man in Haut-de-France and that in le-de-France ( 75.9 years ).

This statistic shows the monthly export value of dairy products in Canada from January 2015 to March 2021. In March 2021, exports of dairy products from Canada amounted to approximately 1.1 billion Canadian dollars.
This statistic displays the awareness of e-cigarettes in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. The majority of respondents, 62 percent, were aware of e-cigarettes.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of Cox's Orange-group dessert apples in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from January 2015 to November 2019. The wholesale price of Cox's apples was valued at 0.88 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019, a decrease compared to a year before.

This statistic illustrates the value of illicit liquor seized in India during the general assembly elections in 2019, by state and union territory. The largest amount of illicit liquor was seized in the state of Uttar Pradesh, valued at over 461 million Indian rupees.

Between January and March 2021, the Italian e-commerce industry registered a decrease in sales value of consumer packaged goods. In fact, in February 2021, the e-commerce sector in Italy registered a growth of about 111 percent in terms of sales value of packaged goods. This figure decreased in the following months, recording a growth of 67.7 percent in March 2021.

The highest number of news articles about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in the Nordic countries from January 1 to March 23, 2020, was published in Sweden. The number of articles in Sweden amounted to 196 thousand. Denmark followed with 163 thousand articles, and Norway with over 118 thousand. Finland published the least amount of articles about the coronavirus in the Nordic countries, amounting to 79 thousand.

This statistic compares the average number of journeys made per person annually for all purposes in England in 2018, by mode of transport. Travel by car or van as a driver was the most common mode of transport with an average of 397 trips made per person per year.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the East Midlands Trains rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the East Midlands Trains trains increased by one year each year as of the fourth quarter of the financial year 2007/08 until the fourth quarter of the year 2016/17. In the fourth quarter of 2017/18 and the fourth quarter of 2018/19, the average age was 26 years.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the London North Eastern Railway rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the LNE rolling stock increased by one year each year as of the fourth quarter of the financial year 2007/08 until the fourth quarter of 2016/17, when the average age of the rolling stock reached 31.5 years. By the fourth quarter of 2018/19, the average age of the London North Eastern Railway rolling stock was 25.8 years.

This statistic displays the revenue generated by business transactions during trade shows in France as of 2015, by participant origin. It shows that foreign exhibitors generated 9.8 billion euros revenue during business transactions at trade shows in France.

This statistic displays the average weekly sales value of large retail businesses in Great Britain monthly from January 2016 to May 2021. An average of 6.9 billion British pounds were spent per week in large retailers in May 2021.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of beetroot in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2015 to 2019. The wholesale price of beetroot was valued at 0.49 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019, a decrease of five pence compared to a year before.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the London Overground rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the London Overground trains decreased from 30.6 years in 2007/08 to 15.9 years in 2016/17. In 2017/18, the average age increased to 16.7 years.

This statistic displays the average weekly sales value of small non-store retail businesses in Great Britain monthly from January 2015 to November 2021. The amount spent in via small non-store retail businesses, such as mail order houses, reached approximately 583.5 million British pounds in November 2021.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of kent cauliflower in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2015 to 2019. The wholesale price of kent cauliflower was valued at 0.89 British pounds per head in November 2019, an increase compared to a year before.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of celery in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from June 2014 to November 2019. The wholesale price of celery was valued at 0.77 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019, a decrease of 21 pence compared to the price a year before.

In the third quarter of 2020, 16.4 percent of playback on OTT services in the United States occurred within the drama category, down from 15.1 percent in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Drama was the most viewed genre in early 2019 and 2020, followed by action and adventure. Meanwhile, science fiction and horror content became less popular.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises manufacturing musical instruments in the United Kingdom for 2021, by turnover size band. As of March 2021, there were 5 enterprises with a turnover of more than 5 million British pounds.

This statistic shows the share of consumers who are likely to buy Canadian brands in Canada as of May 2015, by age group. During the survey, 68 percent of the respondents aged between 18 and 34 years said that they were probably or definitely going to buy Canadian brands.
This statistic depicts the median annual family income in Canada in 2019, distinguished by province. In 2019, the median annual family income in Alberta was 101,780 Canadian dollars.

The number of smartphone users in Russia has been increasing steadily since 2015, when the country's smartphone population was measured at approximately 52 million. By 2025, the number of smartphone users in Russia is expected to reach about 113.5 million.

This statistic shows the reasons consumers in the United Kingdom have shopped around for a new energy supplier in the last three years, as of 2014. Nearly half of those surveyed, 47 percent, said they had shopped around for a new energy supplier in the last three years in order to save money.

This statistic illustrates the number of aircraft landings and take-offs at Edinburgh Airport in the UK from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic, there were only 43,100 aircraft movements at Edinburgh Airport.

In 2019, there were about 1.69 million single people living in Canada with low income. This is an increase from 2000, when there were about 1.03 million single people living in Canada with low income.

This statistic displays the age distribution of consumers who complained about `` no hang-up fraud '' reviewed by the Financial Ombudsman Service in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2012 and 2014. It shows that over half of the consumers who complained about `` no hang-up fraud '' were over 65 years of age.

This statistic shows the distribution of time spent researching energy use by consumers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. The majority of respondents, 25 percent, spent between one and two hours researching their current energy tariff, while 22 percent spent between two and three hours researching.

In December 2020, the movie `` Call Me by Your Name '', which had a lower quality rating of 70 out of 100, became the highest-rated movie on Netflix with a score of over 122.5 thousand. This marks a significant jump in quality rating from the 70th percentile in July 2020, indicating a substantial improvement in the movie's overall quality.

This statistic displays the results of the Catalan election held on September 27, 2015 showing the share of votes won by each party in the different regions. The pro-independence alliance Junts pel S ( Together for Yes ) won the majority of votes in the region of Catalonia with 1.12 million votes, followed by Ciutadans ( Citizens ) with 588,000 votes.

This statistic shows the time consumers in the United Kingdom spend comparing energy suppliers, in 2014, by the number of suppliers they are comparing with. The majority of respondents, 77 percent, spend between one and two hours comparing energy suppliers.

This statistic shows the type of technology used by travel managers to manage business trips in France in 2014. It reveals that 60 percent of respondents used online travel booking sites, while 47 percent used a travel management solution.

This statistic shows how satisfied consumers were with their new energy supplier after switching in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. Of those who had switched, 32 percent were much more satisfied and only two percent much less satisfied with their new supplier.

This statistic displays the findings of a survey on consumers attitudes towards mobile commerce in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 14 percent of responding consumers strongly agreed that they were more likely to use their mobile phone to shop around more efficiently than they were to use their desktop or laptop.

This statistic displays the main barriers to mobile commerce according to the consumers in the United Kingdom in 2014. The most common barrier to mobile commerce was the cost of items purchased. Only 2 percent of respondents reported that they did not use mobile commerce because they did not know how to use it.

The graph shows data on movies with largest TV advertising budgets in the United States in 1st half 2015. 'Avengers : Age of Ultron'ranked first, with a TV ad budget of 44 million U.S. dollars. 'Furious 7'ranked 7th, with a budget of 31.5 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the average amount of money non-owners are able to save weekly towards a mortgage deposit in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015, listed by region. The average amount that non-homeowners in London are able to save per week towards a mortgage deposit is 52 British pounds.

This bar chart illustrates the average haul length for articulated heavy goods vehicles with a weight over 33 tons in the United Kingdom from 1990 to 2016, in kilometers. In 2012, the average haul length for over 33 ton HGVs was 126 kilometers. Despite a small decrease in 2014, it had increased to 132 kilometres by 2016.

This statistic shows the state of mind of the Spanish population regarding the coronavirus lockdown as of April 2020.
