In 2020, the vast majority of Poles ( 78 percent ) were in favor of the opportunity to purchase medicines online.

In January 2022, Austria's unemployment rate amounted to almost 350,000. This was a decrease compared to the previous month. The figures refer to the whole country and include the unemployed, the underemployed, and the employed.
In 2020, the main reason for using telemedicine among Polish respondents was the convenience of the service, followed by restrictions on medical operations and the need to save time.

The majority of respondents stated that their home office during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Romania was very efficient. However, more than 30 percent answered that they had difficulties in achieving a work-life balance.

From January to December 2021, a total of 1,836 femicides were recorded in Argentina. March and April were the months with the highest number of femicide victims with over 40 women murdered on account of their gender per month. The number of femicides in Argentina has also been analyzed by province.

In June 2021, around 16.3 thousand heavy vehicles were produced in Brazil, up from about 14.8 thousand units produced in the same month a year earlier. The severe fall in production in 2020 is linked to the health emergency declared by the Brazilian government at the end of March 2020 due to the COVID-19 outbreak in the country.

According to a survey carried out in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in April 2020, it was found that respondents would be much more comfortable with their family and friends visiting them rather than them visiting them. The respondents were also less likely to be comfortable with people from other households visiting their home, although less than half said this at all. On the other hand, respondents were more likely to be comfortable with shopping in the supermarket than being visited to the pub or going to the gym.

In 2019, the occupancy rate of hospital acute care beds was around 65 percent in Australia, compared to around 91 percent in 2000. This statistic shows the percentage of hospital acute care beds occupied in select countries worldwide in 2000 and 2019.

The majority of professors who held online classes during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Romania did it on a daily basis. However, for various reasons, over one-third of professors could not hold their classes daily.
This statistic shows the breakdown of Disneyland Paris tourist attendance in 2016, by country of origin. That year, 49 percent of visitors to Disneyland Paris were French.

This statistic presents the favorite French holiday activities in 2017. For more than 70 percent of respondents, the best way to spend a holiday was to relax on a beach. A holiday in the mountains or in a city? 53 percent of French holidaymakers chose a destination in the mountains.

As of March 2020, 48 percent of new chemical projects worldwide were located in the Asia-Pacific region. In comparison, 20 percent of new projects were located in North America. The Asia-Pacific region is home to many of the world's largest chemical companies.

As of April 2020, 75 percent of healthcare workers in the United Kingdom have not been offered testing for coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) despite showing symptoms. While 16 percent have been offered testing, 15 percent have been refused.

This statistic presents the frequency of outings due to the coronavirus crisis in Spain as of April 2020, broken down by age. Most of the respondents from the youngest group claimed to have been on an outing once a day since the lockdown was imposed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

In the first quarter of 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, the mobile traffic to Walmart's official website in Mexico increased by 63 percent in comparison to the same period a year earlier. In turn, the traffic to MercadoLibre, a popular online marketplace in the Latin American country, rose by 16 percent.

Russia reported approximately 186.7 thousand new cases of COVID-19 on February 28, 2022. The total number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the country was over 18.6 million, with the capital Moscow accounting for the largest number of infected individuals.

Temporary layoffs ( ERTE ) was the most popular measure taken by businesses in the catering industry in Spain due to the coronavirus crisis in 2020. Some 75 percent of restaurants, bars, cafeterias and pubs that were forced to stop their activity implemented ERTE.

A May 2020 survey revealed that 44 percent of global businesses intend to reduce their spending on general software, as an effect of the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, 35 percent of businesses intend to reduce spending on IT support technology, and 32 percent on project management software.

There were around 6.5 million registered vehicles across the Indian state of Chhattisgarh at the end of fiscal year 2019. The south Asian country's transport sector accounted for a 4.85 percent share of the GVA with road transport accounting for over three percent of it. The GVA from railways was about 0.7 percent and air transport accounted for about 0.16 percent during the same time period.

Approximately one half of Russians would not visit crowded places where it was impossible to maintain a distance of six meters due to the COVID-19 pandemic as of May 2020. Furthermore, 14 percent of respondents stated that they would refrain from attending public events, concerts, and cinemas.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) has affected life in Austria, as confirmed by the rising number of cases in the country. In the face of this development, the Austrian government is communicating information to the population about the current situation and the steps to be taken. In March 2020, the most popular news channel was the A4 news channel, which was mentioned by 31 percent of respondents as a source for information about the coronavirus.

The 4x100 meter relay has been included in all Olympic Games since 1984, and teams from the United States have had the most success in the event. US teams have won 13 golds and 35 overall medals, with the last of these coming in 2012. The world records and Olympic records were set in the 2012 Olympics ; the men's were set by Jamaica, with a time of 36.82 seconds, and the women's records were set by the United States, with a time of 40.82 seconds. The most successful athlete in this event is the US'Frank Wykoff, who won three back-to-back golds between 1928 and 1936.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in Russia led to a significant increase in TV news consumption across the country. The audience of the news channel with the highest growth potential over the next two weeks was the one aged between 18 and 24 years, according to both survey waves.

During the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis, 45 percent of respondents who were offered relief from their landlord in the United Kingdom ( UK ) received a reduction in their rent from the landlord, with a further 31 percent receiving a deferred rent agreement.

The price level of organic products in the Netherlands increased by roughly five percent in 2019 in comparison to the previous year. Products containing organic ingredients had a price level of 175.4 percent, where the year 2015 equals 100.

In April 2020, a survey carried out in the United Kingdom found that 30 percent of healthcare workers who had not received a COVID-19 test did not know why this was, while a further 8 percent thought it was because their employer did not have enough staff in specific roles to take the tests.

Women's skincare products were the most popular on the online marketplace Wildberries prior to the Women's Day celebration in Russia in 2020. The most sold item in the given period were facial masks, with nearly 230 thousand units sold on the website.

In total, more than 30,000 bed and breakfast establishments were registered in France as of January 1st 2017. In Auvergne-Rhne-Alpes, there were 3,000 listings, making it the region with the most bed and breakfasts in France.

The Eiffel Tower was the most visited cultural and recreational site in France in 2017, recording more than 14.8 million tourist admissions. The Parc Astrix ranks 13th on the list with around two million visitors.
In Brittany, the number of 4-star hotels rose to more than 40 in 2018. In Auvergne-Rhne-Alpes, there were more than 400 4-star hotels.

In June 2021, the volume of container cargo handled in the ports of Panama amounted to approximately 696,000 TEUs. This represented a decrease of around 3.5 percent in comparison with the throughput reported during the same month a year earlier.
This statistic shows the visitor spend at outdoor events in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018, by type of event. Visitor spending at music events amounted to over 17.5 billion British pounds in 2018.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, almost one in two employees in Poland worked remotely. This situation was more significant in the services sector, where as many as 51 percent of employees worked from home. In manufacturing, this share was 34 percent.

This statistic presents the average price per night for the rental of an apartment containing a bedroom on the selection of cities in France on Airbnb for January 1st, 2017. According to the source, the average price per night for the rental of an apartment containing a bedroom in the city of Marseille was of 63 euros.

In 2017, the prevalence of atrial fibrillation and flutter in men was 19.9 million, compared to 17.7 million in women. Atrial fibrillation and flutter is a known risk factor for stroke. This statistic shows the prevalence of atrial fibrillation and flutter worldwide in 2017, by gender.

In 2019, the United States had around 208 hospitals per million population. In comparison, Korea had around 36 hospitals per million population. This statistic shows the number of hospitals in select countries worldwide in 2019, per million population.

Over the observed period, the most significant traffic was directed to the official website of the platform zoom.us, with an average of over 23 million visits per month. Skype.com accounted for over four million visits per month, while trello.com made over three million visits on average.

As of June 2018, the average sales price of premium wine in Argentina amounted to 141 Argentine pesos per liter, whereas standard wine recorded an average price of 85 pesos per liter. In comparison, low-alcoholic wine had an average price of 53 pesos per liter. Overall, the sales price of wine in the South American country showed a large variation between the different wine category.

The Women's 800 meter event was first introduced to the Summer Olympics in the women's 80m Hurdles in 1928. Since then, athletes from the Soviet Union have seen the most success, winning three golds and eight total medals ( including one bronze ). The Soviet Union's Tatyana Kazankina, and 2020 champion Faith Kipyegon of Kenya are the only athletes to have won two golds in this event. No athlete has ever been stripped of a medal won in this event.
The hotel occupancy rate on the Reunion Island has been fluctuating between 2013 and 2018. It was at its lowest in 2014 with 59 percent, and then peaked in 2018 at 66.7 percent.

The Women's 10,000 meter event was introduced to the Summer Olympics in 1988, and Ethiopian athletes have had the most success in this event. Five athletes from Ethiopia have won gold medals in this event, and a total of seven Ethiopian athletes have won medals in this event. No athlete has ever been stripped of a medal won in this event.

This statistic shows the results of a survey asking respondents for their opinion on whether or not the United Kingdom's national health service ( NHS ) has a funding problem from 2014 to 2019. In 2014, 52 percent of respondents believed that the NHS has a major funding problem, however in 2019 only 46 percent of respondents believed the same.

The Men's Long Jump has been included in all Summer Olympics since the inaugural games in 1896. Since then, athletes from the United States have won the most medals, with 23 golds and 55 total medals ; although the combined Russian, Soviet and ROC tally gives 24 golds and 58 total medals. The U.S.'Bob Mathias is the most successful athlete in this event, winning two golds and one bronze medal between 1948 and 1956. Two athletes have been stripped of medals in this event, they were the 2008 gold medallist Yuriy Bilonoh of Ukraine, and the bronze medallist Andrei Mikhnevich of Belarus in 2004 ; both medals were redistributed accordingly.

From March 16 to 22, 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, sales of cleaning products on online marketplace Mercado Livre increased by more than 60 percent in Brazil comapred to the week from February 24 to March 1, 2020. Moreover, sales of toiletries increased by over 15 percent. In Brazil, Mercado Livre is known as Mercado Livre Livre, its name in Portuguese.

The Men's Triple Jump was first introduced as an Olympic event in the 1896 Summer Olympics, and the event has been present in every Summer Olympics since then. Athletes from the United States have had the most success in this event, winning eight golds and 19 total medals ; although the last U.S. athlete to win a gold medal was Ashton Eaton in 2008, and U.S. athletes have not won another gold since 1992. Three athletes have won two golds in this event, they were the U.S.'Bob Mathias in 1948 and 1952, the Soviet Union's Sergey Litvinov in 1960 and 1964, and Great Britain's Jonathan Edwards in 1984 and 1992. The event's most successful athlete is the U.S.'Kenny Harrison, who won the gold medal in 1996, and silver and bronze medals in 2000 and 2004 respectively.

According to a survey from May 2020, the share of Danes worrying that hospitals in Denmark would run out of oxygen due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) was highest between April 11 and May 9, when around 45 percent of the respondents stated to worry about this. The numbers were significantly lower, at around 12 percent, between May 23 and May 29.

From March 9 to March 15, 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, sales of puzzles on online marketplace Mercado Libre increased by over 283 percent in Argentina comapred to the week from February 24 to March 1, 2020. Other fitness-related products that experienced growth in sales were dumbbells, discs, and bars, with an increase of over 150 percent.

In January 2020, 56 percent of Germans thought that the easing of the preventive measures due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak was not enough. 32 percent felt the measures were too loose, while only ten percent thought they were unnecessarily strict.

A study from May 2019 found that 44 percent of internet users in the United States had purchased music in the last month. This was more than double the share of U.S. internet users who had bought music in the previous month.

The pharmaceutical market volume in Russia is forecasted to grow to nearly 3.3 billion U.S. dollars by 2030. The initial estimates of the market size in the country in 2019 were set at 1.5 trillion U.S. dollars.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, many cultural institutions in Denmark, including museums and art galleries, are expected to close their doors to visitors for the foreseeable future. According to a survey from March 2020, the majority of institutions stated that they expected to close between two and four months. Museums and art galleries reported an expected loss of approximately 83 million Danish kroner, while event venues expected to lose around 22 million Danish kroner.

In 2019, around 47 percent of African Americans surveyed in the U.S. reported illicit drug use in the past year. The statistic illustrates past year substance use among African Americans in the U.S. in 2019, by mental health status.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 93.57 percent of female and 94.48 percent of male Vietnamese respondents felt safe after stockpiling on items. In the same survey, the majority of respondents who engaged in panic buying indicated that they stocked up on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour, or hygiene paper products such as toilet paper, paper towels and tissues.

In 2020, the air passenger transport in the European Union ( EU-27 ) amounted to only 26.3 million passengers due to travel restrictions imposed to curb the spread of the novel coronavirus. The country with the highest number of passengers was Germany with 57.5 million travelers.

Frankfurt processed the most air passengers in the European Union ( EU-27 ) in 2020, with 22.2 million passengers utilizing the city  s main airport. In that same year, the second and third largest airports for passenger air transport were London Heathrow and Paris Charles de Gaulle.

The average interest rate paid on bank loans in the United Kingdom is expected to increase to 0.25 percent by 2022, up from 0.1 percent in 2020. Between 2008 and 2020, the average interest rate dropped to a low of 0.06 percent.
In France in 2018, the number of 5-star campsites varied according to the region. In total, there were more than 220 5-star campsites in the region of Provence-Alpes-Ctes d'Azur.
This statistic shows the revenues from out-of-home catering in France between 2010 and 2016. In 2011, the revenues from out-of-home catering amounted to 69 billion euros.

Between 2007 and 2019, the number of annual trips made by metro and tram in Paris and le-de-France progressively increased. In 2007, this figure was around 1.4 billion trips, compared to more than 1.5 billions ten years later. However, the outbreak of the COVID-19 coronavirus epidemic in 2020 caused a drop in the number of annual trips made by metro and tram in Paris and le-de-France.

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in 2018 in Mexico City asking respondents if they would replace red meat during Lent and Easter, or not. According to 70 percent of respondents, they would keep consuming red meat during Lent and Easter as they did before.

This statistic shows the preferred destinations of French business travelers since the start of 2015. It reveals that 41 percent of respondents had already traveled to another European country, while 10 percent of respondents stated that they were considering traveling to the Americas.
In February 2020, 41 percent of Russians negatively assessed their national health system. Approximately one quarter of respondents stated that the health care system in Russia worked quite well.

According to a survey carried out in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in May 2020, it was found that the majority of British respondents were confident that their workplace was secure enough to prevent the spread of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). A total of 24 percent of respondents said they were very confident, while a further 44 percent were somewhat confident. On the other hand, eight percent of respondents said they were not confident at all.
As of 2019, 72.4 percent of rural population in Ghana had access to electricity. Between 2008 and 2019, the share of population with access to electricity increased by ten percentage points.

Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, the number of visits to online grocery stores in Mexico increased significantly. In fact, during the week starting on March 22, 2020 ( week 46 ), the number of visits to this type of stores increased by nearly 150 percent in comparison to the week starting on February 15, 2020 ( week 44 ). The peak was registered in week 51 of 2020 ( October 15-21 ), with a growth of 253 percent.

A survey on the share of adults subscribing to cable television found that in 2021, 45 percent of White respondents had a current cable subscription, compared to just 36 percent of African Americans. The survey also found that the share of adults who had never subscribed to a cable TV service was higher among younger generations, with 18 percent of those aged 18 to 29 years old having no subscription, compared to just 12 percent of those aged 50 years and older.

This statistic illustrates the price paid for most expensive paintings ever sold in 2010. The most expensive painting ever sold is `` The Mona Lisa '' by Leonardo da Vinci, which sold for approximately 845,000 U.S. dollars in 2014.

This statistic shows the distribution of cost-sharing for biologics in Canada based on the gross drug revenue in 2018. During this year, 17 percent of the cost of biologics was paid by the patient or the family.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 79 percent of female and 76 percent of male Indian respondents stated that they stocked up on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.

A survey held in the United States in May 2020 found that White adults were the least frequent viewers of streaming movies, with just under half saying that they never watched a movie from a streaming service. Hispanic adults were the most frequent viewers, with almost a quarter saying that they watched a movie from a streaming service several times per week.
In 2020, every second respondent in Poland stated that he knew how to deal with the coronavirus outbreak. However, more than half of the people admitted that they did not know how to deal with it.

During a 2020 survey of publishers, platforms, and programmatic companies worldwide, gauging the state of the audio advertising market, 72 percent of respondents said that having other spoken word ( e.g. serials, books ) was important but not essential for their business. The same was true for 49 percent of publishers, platforms, and programmatic companies who responded that having short audio for voice devices was important but not required.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 49 percent of female and 43 percent of male Indian respondents stated that they stocked up on items because they thought that they or their household might be quarantined and would therefore not be able to buy groceries. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.
Nearly 82 percent of independent brewers in the United Kingdom expected a decline in sales due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Only 3.5 percent thought sales would increase.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 43 percent of Indian respondents aged between 45 and 54 years stated that they purchased items in bulk in supermarkets and hypermarkets. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.

The oil and gas industry, as well as financial services, were expected to have the highest positive effect on the gross domestic product of Russia in 2018, according to the estimates made in July 2018. The manufacturing sector was estimated to have the third highest effect on the GDP of Russia.

The largest share of the Nordic Choice impact on Russian economic output was recorded in the accommodation and food services sector, at over 24 percent in 2018. The second most significant effect was observed in the retail trade, with a share of 18 percent.

This ranking represents the most visited tourist sites in the French region of Normandy between 2015 and 2016. It reveals that the Cathedral of Notre-Dame de Bzema was the most visited site in the region, with around 23,000 visitors.
In 2020, over 169 cases of other sexually transmitted chlamydia were diagnosed in Poland. The highest number of cases occurred in 2019.

This statistic shows the percentage of foods that were considered to be self-efficient in the United Kingdom from 1988 to 2019. The term self-efficient food refers to foods which use fewer ingredients or require less cooking or preparation. In 2019, 76 percent of all food and 75 percent of indigeneous food types were considered to be self-efficient.

As of February 1, 2021, California was the state with the most retail stores of the clothing retailer Casper, with 11 outlets. The company had a total of 46 stores in operation in the United States that year.

In 2020, the travel and tourism industry contributed approximately 186 billion U.S. dollars to the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Southeast Asia. In comparison, the GDP contribution of the travel and tourism industry in Southeast Asia was approximately 205 billion U.S. dollars in 2011.

The COVID-19 crisis that spread across the world at the beginning of 2020 was not only a big threat to public health, but also to the entire sports industry. Many professional and amateur leagues and events were postponed to a later date and the public was advised to not spend time in large groups or in public areas. During a survey carried out in April 2020, approximately one third of gym members stated that they were still hesitating to return to their sports center, while more than half of them claimed they would be back as soon as the lockdown as an end.

According to a 2020 global survey of artificial intelligence ( AI ) leaders, the leading reason for their organization to use AI was to assist business workers. Other top reasons included to replace workers, and to improve existing processes.

Before the novel coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) lockdown, the air quality in Delhi was the worst among the selected cities. The reduction in industrial activity and traffic congestion that came as a result of the lockdown helped bring down the levels of nitrogen dioxide and particulate matter pollution in the Indian capital. Compared to the air quality in Delhi, the reduction in PM2.5 and PM10 pollution in Wuhan, China was not as significant.

The labor market indicators recorded their lowest values in April 2020 because of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) impact on the Romanian economy. The unemployment rate increased from 3.9 percent in February to 6.3 percent in April 2020, while the net wage index dropped from 8.7 percent to -1.7 percent in the same period. By May 2021, the unemployment rate dropped to 5.5 percent, and the net wage index increased to 9.7 percent.
As of May 2020, leading app publishers generated an average of 1.24 million downloads per app. In contrast, the average number of downloads for all apps was 165,000 per app.

In May 2020, a survey carried out in the UK found that 38 percent of respondents who said they wear a face mask outside during the coronavirus pandemic experience issues with the mask fogging, making it difficult to see. Additionally, almost 40 percent of respondents said that the mask makes it feel too hot, uncomfortable, or restrictive, while around a third said that it causes a general discomfort.

An in depth study on patients admitted to hospital and later deceased from the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) infection revealed that the majority of cases showed one or more comorbidities. As the chart shows, hypertension was the most common pre-existing health condition, detected in 67.6 percent of male and 68.2 percent of female patients who died after contracting the virus. Diabetes, chronic lung disease, and ischemic hearth disease were also among the most common comorbidities in COVID-19 patients who lost their lives.

During a March 2020 survey of consumers in the United States, it was found that 35 percent of respondents were more engaged in consuming news on social media during the coronavirus crisis, compared to just 13 percent who were less engaged. Overall, 33 percent of respondents were more engaged in using their smartphones for news during this time, while 18 percent were less engaged.

The NFL is composed of 32 teams and each team plays eight home games during the regular season for a total of 256 games per season. Over the past years, professional sports leagues have gained significant popularity offering great entertainment to people and fans while generating significant earnings from their broadcasting rights. In 2019, the NFL generated around 200 million U.S. dollars from domestic rights and 15 million U.S. dollars from overseas rights.

The Major League Soccer ( MLS ) is a men's professional soccer league which comprises 26 teams from the United States and Canada. Over the past years, professional soccer has gained significant popularity, offering great entertainment to fans while generating significant earnings from broadcasting rights. In 2019, the MLS generated around 88.5 million U.S. dollars from domestic rights and 16.5 million U.S. dollars from overseas rights.
The average annual gross salary for full-time employees in the United Kingdom was approximately 31.5 thousand British pounds in 2021, compared with 18.6 thousand pounds in 1999.
The gross minimum wage in Romania increased by 3.7 percent in 2021 compared to the previous year. The minimum monthly wage increased from 2,230 Romanian lei in 2020 to 2,430 Romanian lei in 2021.

In 2020, the United Kingdom exported 42.5 billion British pounds worth of food and live animals to the European Union member states. The UK imported more vehicles and computer and electronic goods than it exported them to the EU in the same year.

As of May 2021, the average spend for grocery delivery and pickup in the United States amounted to 77 U.S. dollars. This figure was calculated based on the average order value from leading online grocery retailers.

Naomi Osaka is the highest-paid female athlete worldwide in the past two years. Between June 2019 and June 2021, she earned approximately 57.5 million U.S. dollars in prize money and around 39.5 million U.S. dollars from endorsements. Her total earnings amounted to around 113 million U.S. dollars in the 2019/20 season.
In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic and the closure of schools in Poland, almost half of the parents had difficulties in combining work and child education at home.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around 54 percent of female and 49 percent of male South Korean respondents stated that they stocked up on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour. In the same survey, 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

According to a survey conducted in the United States in March 2020, around 38 percent of respondents reported that they were highly concerned about the coronavirus outbreak, and as a result, they increased their online grocery spending.

During the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, the majority of Hungarians used the internet for keeping in touch with family and friends, as well as for entertainment and relaxation. Another popular internet activity was working from home, followed by watching online TV and streaming.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around half of female and male South Korean respondents stated that they purchased items in bulk in supermarkets and hypermarkets. In the same survey, around 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, the top three places where South Korean respondents bought goods were online on an e-commerce platform, supermarket, and in small grocery stores or hypermarkets. Of the almost ten thousand South Koreans surveyed, a mere 15.4 percent of respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

Major League Baseball ( MLB ) is one of the biggest sporting leagues in the United States and its most valuable team, the Los Angeles Dodgers, had around 14.48 million followers worldwide across its social media channels as of November 2019.

Russia was the major exporter of major arms between 2014 and 2020. The country accounted for nearly 40 percent of the global total over the observed period. India was the second major supplier, with China ranking third. The value of major weapons exports from Russia was measured at approximately 1.3 billion U.S. dollars between 2014 and 2020.

This statistic shows the perception of Spaniards of the 2020 holiday flexibility due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis. In April 2020, half of the respondents claimed they would probably have to pay more for their holidays due to the travel restrictions or cancellations.

The number of positive influenza cases per week can vary per subtype or lineage. During the 2021 influenza season, there were around 6,857 positive influenza cases per week from the H1N1 subtype. Influenza and pneumonia are currently the ninth leading cause of death worldwide.

Over the observed period, the share of the population using digital TV services in Russia increased steadily. As of 2019, nearly 100 percent of the population watched digital TV, exceeding the 90 percent mark for the first time.

Most consumers stated that their meat consumption had not changed since the coronavirus outbreak in the United States in 2020. This is in contrast to plant-based food alternatives, of which 34 percent of respondents reported eating more.

The most common change in eating habits among consumers in the United States during the COVID-19 outbreak was to cook more often. This is unsurprising given the popularity of home cooking during the pandemic. The survey also revealed that 21 percent of respondents were eating more frozen meals than usual, and 11 percent were eating more processed foods than usual.

The coronavirus outbreak of 2020 in the United States caused a surge in consumer spending on food at home, in the attempt to stock up in case of extended quarantine. During the period from April to June 2021, total consumer spending on food at home increased by 20.6 percent compared to the same period in 2020.

In May 2020, a survey carried out in the United Kingdom found that 30 percent of respondents said they were feeling panicked by the lockdown and the coronavirus pandemic, while a further 11 percent said they were feeling suicidal.

As of the end of 2020, the largest share of Eltel's shareholders were located in Sweden. The share of Swedish shareholders increased from nearly 50 percent in 2019 to over 60 percent in 2020. The second largest shareholder was Finland, followed by Luxembourg.

During the coronavirus outbreak in the United States in 2020, Millennials and Gen Zers were more likely to increase their spending on food and non-alcoholic beverages than their older counterparts. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who reported increasing their spending on selected food and beverage categories due to the COVID-19 outbreak in the United States as of March 2020, by age group.
Between November 2018 and March 2019, the average price of a standard double hotel room in Lille remained stable at around 77 euros.

This statistic shows the distribution of doctors newly registered in France in 2014, by specialty. Over 42 percent of newly registered doctors in France that year were specialized in general medicine.
The coronavirus pandemic deeply impacted travel and tourism in 2020. That year, international tourists spent in total 29.1 billion euros in France, compared to more than 60 billion euros in 2019.

In 2020, the South African government added an amount of 495.5 billion rand ( roughly 32.8 billion U.S. dollars ) to the country's gross domestic product ( GDP ) through general government services. This represents an increase of roughly 5.5 percent in comparison to the previous year.

During the third week of April 2020, online sales of toasters in Brazil increased by nearly 264 percent compared to the same period a year earlier. Meanwhile, sales of air conditioners increased by around 136 percent. The growth was linked to the outbreak of COVID-19 in the South American country. Furthermore, during the same week, online sales of home appliances in Brazil increased by an average of 64.7 percent.

In 2020, the crude birth rate in Angola reached 48.6 live births per 1,000 inhabitants, the highest birth rate in Africa. The country with the second highest crude birth rate in the continent was Somalia, with 43.6 births per 1,000 people. Among the African countries with the highest crude birth rate, Angola, Mali, and Chad recorded the highest figures. In 2020, the total population in Angola amounted to roughly 92.3 million people.

The majority of respondents believed that the Romanian authorities were taking the necessary measures to tackle the coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ) in 2020. Only nine percent of respondents considered that the authorities were taking too many measures.
More than 70 percent of respondents were planning to spend their summer holidays in Romania in 2020. Only 12 percent of respondents were willing to travel abroad for their summer vacation.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 116 points regarding vegetables. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 125 points regarding wine. This is symbolizing an increase of 6.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 111.1 points regarding property maintenance and repair. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 127.8 points regarding water and other services. This is symbolizing an increase of 2.9 points from the previous year.

Before the government's decision to close down schools and universities due to the outbreak of coronavirus in Poland, the majority of Poles assessed the situation positively. However, after the decision was made, the number of people assessed the government's actions negatively.

As of the first quarter of 2020, the fastest-growing footwear item worldwide was running shoes, with a year-on-year search growth of 39 percent. During the same period, slipcovers experienced the second-fastest growth with a search increase of 38 percent.

This statistic shows the regional market share of the global pharmaceutical market in 2018, and a forecast for 2023. In 2018, the total global market was valued around 8.4 trillion U.S. dollars, of which almost a quarter was generated in the Asia-Pacific region.

This statistic presents the value of product shipments of frozen foods in the United States from 2007 to 2019. In 2019, the U.S. product shipment value of frozen foods amounted to approximately 32.39 billion U.S. dollars.

Of the U.S.'first eighteen presidents, twelve owned slaves throughout their lifetime, and eight of these were slave owners while occupying the office of president. Of the U.S.'first twelve presidents, the only two never to own slaves were John Adams, and his son John Quincy Adams ; the first of which famously said that the American Revolution would not be complete until all slaves were freed. George Washington, leader of the revolution and the first President of the United States, owned many slaves throughout his lifetime, with 240    at the time of his death. Historians believe that Washington's treatment of his slaves was typical of slaveowners in Virginia at the time, however he did develop moral issues with the institution of slavery following the revolution. Washington never publicly expressed his growing opposition to slavery, although he did stipulate in his will that all his slaves were to be freed following the death of his wife, and he made financial provisions for their care that lasted until the 1830s.

The cumulative installed capacity of municipal waste energy in Europe increased by approximately 1.5 gigawatts (GW) from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the total installed capacity of municipal waste energy reached 4,994 megawatts.

This statistic shows the share of domestic tourism consumption in France's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) from 2010 to 2018. In 2013, the share of tourism consumption in France's GDP was 7.5 percent. Nine years later, this figure reached 7.4 percent.

This statistic presents the share of French and foreign tourists who took part in leisure activities in Paris in 2014. It appears that more than 70 percent of French tourists visited a museum, a permanent exhibition or a monuments and museums in 2014.

This statistic presents the hotel occupancy rate in Brittany in France in 2017, by hotel category. It can be seen that the most expensive hotels had an occupancy rate of almost 70 percent, compared to more than 60 percent for the cheapest category.

This statistic shows the number of visits from France to the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2004 and 2019. The number of trips by French residents to the UK increased from 3.25 million in 2013 to 3.7 million in 2014. In 2019 the number of similar trips amounted to around 3.57 million.
The cost of raising a child in Poland from 2014 to 2020 has increased. In 2020, it reached 258 thousand zloty.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 20.4 percent of Vietnamese respondents stated that they had increased their spending on grocery delivery services. In the same survey, 61.57 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 38.43 percent of respondents did.
Nearly every second respondent in Poland would decide to have a child despite the costs associated with parenthood. However, almost every fourth person would prefer to remain child-free.

During the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, the use of social media networks in Hungary increased compared to the pre-pandemic period. This is due to the fact that people spent more time at home and had to find ways to entertain or distract their children. As of April 2020, live streaming was the most popular new social media function, followed by video and voice chat.

This statistic shows the Chinese share of selected imports of medical supplies and equipment to the United States in 2019. In that year, Chinese imports of disposable paper household sanitary napkins accounted for some 33 percent of U.S. imports of medical disposables.

A survey held in the United States in May 2020 exploring awards show viewership found that just six percent of adults aged 18 to 34 years always watch the Golden Globe Awards, compared to around half of those aged 45 to 64 years. Those aged 18 to 34 years old were also the least likely to say they never watch the show, with 45 percent saying that they never tune in to the ceremony.

According to the data published by the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, the export of medical masks from China increased by almost ninefold over the first half of 2020 compared to the same period of the previous year. The exports of disinfectant liquids and wipes increased by almost 30-fold.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most companies in Poland felt the need to reduce their employment. The most significant number of employees who were laid off were in micro, small, and medium-sized companies.

As of mid-June 2020, the level of support for the protesters participating in the ongoing protests in response to the killing of George Floyd was higher than the level of opposition, with 50 percent of respondents either strongly or somewhat supporting the protesters. This compares to 29 percent of respondents who either strongly or somewhat opposed the protesters.

A survey held in the United States in May 2020 exploring awards show viewership found that only five percent of Americans always watch the Daytime Emmy Awards. The majority of respondents do not follow the ceremony, with 60 percent of those surveyed never watching the show.

As of mid-June 2020, 41 percent of U.S. adults surveyed strongly supported the measures implemented in cities with large protests due to the ongoing protests in response to the killing of George Floyd. This compares to 30 percent of respondents who strongly supported measures called in response to the protests in cities with smaller numbers of protesters.

As of July 2020, the majority of Russians believed that the environmental disaster in the Chernobyl region was caused by human activity. One fifth of respondents stated that the accident was a result of natural processes.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, also commonly known as coronavirus, Vietnamese businesses were predicted to increase their prices. According to the survey by Ipsos, 25 percent of the respondents stated that they expected their revenue to increase by more than 20 percent in the next six months.

As of June 23, 2020, around 81 percent of deaths due to COVID-19 in the state of New York were among White Americans, even though they make up just 69 percent of the total population. This statistic shows the percentage of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) deaths compared to population among White Americans in select U.S. states as of June 23, 2020.

During a March 2020 survey of U.S. employees, it was found that 30 percent of respondents stated that their company had more available employees than usual due to coronavirus-related remote working. In comparison, only 19 percent of respondents stated that their company had less available employees than usual.

According to a 2020 survey of U.S. full-time employees, 40 percent of respondents would prefer to work remotely, while 39 percent would prefer to work in an office. Only 21 percent of respondents stated that they would not have a preference between working remotely or in an office.

The top collaboration tool for remote work used by U.S. companies is Zoom, with 36 percent of companies reporting the use of this software. Microsoft Teams was the second most popular, with 19 percent of companies using this software.
This statistic shows the electricity prices for household end users in Germany and Denmark as of 2019, by tax component. That year, Danish households paid 132 euros in excise tax on electricity.

Following the May 25th death of George Floyd while in police custody, wide-ranging protests and demonstrations against the use of excessive force by police officers and lack of police accountability were held in multiple U.S. cities and abroad. During a June 2020 survey it was found that 31 percent of African American respondents had a more favorable view of brands who posted their support of the police on social media. In comparison, only 20 percent of white respondents felt the same. Some of the consequences of Floyd's death include demonstrations, public outcry, and increased discourse regarding racial inequality in the United States on social media. Many brands have posted statements of support to their social media platforms - however, many audiences either disapprove of or distrust brand's motives in doing so.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 121 points regarding private transport operations. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 90.9 points regarding package holidays. This is symbolizing a decrease of 5.9 points from the previous year.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who said vaccines are comparable with their religious beliefs in the European Union ( EU ) in 2018. In this year, 91 percent of individuals in Poland said vaccines are comparable with their religious beliefs.

This statistic presents the perception of the economic and labor consequences of the coronavirus in Spain as of April 2020. The majority of respondents, over 80 percent, thought that the economic and labor consequences of the coronavirus would be very serious.

Shopping, visiting shopping streets and gastronomy experience were the most popular leisure activities among tourists in Antwerp in 2018. Shopping and eating out were done by nearly 40 percent of the tourists, whereas roughly 30 percent visited the city's historical attractions and monuments. Furthermore, nearly 20 percent went to the countryside or the seaside.

In 2020, the export volume of chicken meat from Japan amounted to approximately 9,858 tons, up from around 9,316 tons in the previous year. Chicken meat exports had been steadily increasing since 2011.

How many Norwegian children have been bullied in primary school? In the school year 2016/17, 12 percent of all children between six and 16 years of age stated to have been bullied two to three times a month or more in primary school. This was the lowest percentage of children who stated to be bullied in the whole period from 2016 to 2021. In the following years, the percentage increased again, and in 2020/21, nearly 22 percent of all children said to be bullied monthly or more.

According to the survey conducted in May 2020, 25 percent of Hungarians found the lack of face-to-face interactions the most annoying thing about working from home during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. The second most popular answer was people who did not do anything.

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the U.S. museum industry. Museums reported a median income loss of 10 million U.S. dollars due to the pandemic, and lost about 8 million hours of staff time.

This statistic shows the results of a survey among American historians on the traits and characteristics that they associate with U.S. presidents, sorted by president. The survey was conducted in 2017. According to 91 percent of surveyed historians, U.S. presidents have been characterized by their public persuasion and leadership.

In 2019, nearly 95 percent of Russian youth living in urban areas had ICT skills, which was 0.6 percentage points higher than the share of young people with such abilities in rural areas. The share of young people with ICT skills in the country's rural regions gradually decreased over the observed period.

In January 2022, Russia planned to import nearly 1.5 million doses of Sputnik V, the vaccine against the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) developed by the Gamaleya Research Institute in Moscow. Furthermore, the country aimed to produce over one million doses of the vaccine by the end of the year.

The number of first-diagnosed cases of hepatitis B per 100,000 population in Russia decreased by over two thirds between 2010 and 2020. The morbidity rate reached 5.2 per 100,000 population in 2020, which was lower than the figure recorded in the previous year.

Over one third of offline retail businesses in Russia were estimated to stay closed for more than 20 percent of the lockdown period due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in the country. The majority of offline stores would most likely be closed for 10 to 20 percent of the time. Only six percent of offline retailers did not have plans to reopen.

In Norway, more females than males are undertaking upper secondary education. In 2020, around 101.4 thousand females and 97.3 thousand males were registered in upper secondary education. That was the highest number of students during the time under consideration.

In 2020, shipments of personal computing devices ( PCDs ) are expected to decline by around six percent, compared with the previous year. The market was valued at around 790 billion U.S. dollars in 2019, accounting for roughly 20 percent of the global personal computer market.
In 2021, there were 1,049 people killed by police in the United States. That year, there were 13 people killed by police in the country due to being beaten or restrained.
As of 2019, the rate of civilians killed by police in the United States was 33.5 per 10 million residents. This compares 9.2 deaths per 10 million residents in Canada, and 8.8 in Australia.

Of the ten highest ranked U.S. military leaders of all time, General George Washington is the only one to have held the title of both Commander in Chief of the Continental Army and President of the United States ( although Washington did command the Continental Army during George H. W. Bush's presidency ). The only other person to have held the title of both President and Commander in Chief of the Army was Commander-in-Chief of the Navy, Dwight D. Eisenhower, although Eisenhower had only been appointed to the position of Supreme Commander of the Allied Expeditionary Force in Europe in January 1945 ( and had not taken office as President of the U.S. ).

The highest number of COVID-19 cases was recorded in the Silesian region, where the disease was transmitted by the most significant number of people. The first cases of coronavirus infection in Poland were reported on 4 March. Since then, the number of infected people has been increasing steadily.

Take-Two Interactive is a video game distribution company headquartered in the United States. The company is divided into different publishing labels depending on the type of games or target audience ( Rockstar Games, 2K Games, Private Division and Social Point ). Take-Two Interactive's global revenue has shown a continuous increase since 2015. In the fiscal year 2021, Take-Two generated approximately 2.53 billion U.S. dollars in revenue from consoles.

This statistic shows the content of online training that Spanish companies provided during the coronavirus lockdown in 2020. The most common topics were related to the company's products or services, with 53 percent of companies offering this kind of training. Personal development and online training were also among the most common topics, with 52.9 percent and 51.5 percent of companies offering training in these areas, respectively.

The United Kingdom was the main export destination for Northern Ireland goods in 2020. In that year, exports to the UK generated a trade value of over three billion British pounds. The second most popular export destination was the United States, accounting for a trade value of 975 million British pounds.

The employment rate in the European Union declined in the first quarter of 2021 compared to the previous quarter. The employment rate in the CEE region decreased by 0.1 percent in the first quarter of 2021 compared to the fourth quarter of 2020.

The number of Swedish citizenship acquisitions increased over the past decade. In 2020, the number of men who acquired Swedish citizenship amounted to 42,837, while the number of women amounted to 38,081.

Following the May 25th death of George Floyd while in police custody, wide-ranging protests and demonstrations against the use of excessive force by police officers and lack of police accountability were held in multiple U.S. cities and abroad. During a June 2020 survey it was found that 24 percent of white adults in the United States thought it was very appropriate for a company's social media account to deliver messages on protests and demonstrations. In contrast, only 12 percent of African Americans thought the same.

A recent survey of U.S. adults showed that those who believed Donald Trump was elected president were more likely to engage in spreading conspiracy theories about the coronavirus. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who were more likely to spread coronavirus conspiracy theories if certain information was presented to them, as of March 9, 2020.

This statistic shows the share of higher education students and employees who were bullied in Norway in 2018. In the higher education sector, 12 percent of the students stated to have been bullied two or more times during the year.

In 2020, 744 work permits were granted to rejected asylum seekers in Sweden, accordingly to the professional field. The most common field of work was technicians, engineers and scientists with 742 work permits. The second most common field of work was sales and customer service workers with 244 work permits.

According to the findings of the survey conducted in May 2020, almost 40 percent of Hungarians believed that the country's economy would return to its state before the end of a year. Another 25 percent of respondents expected an economic recovery in six months.

The most common state visited by U.S. presidents is Florida. The most recent U.S. president to visit Florida was Donald Trump in 2018, when he visited both the White House and the U.S. Capitol Building in Florida. The state with the highest number of visits from U.S. presidents is California, which has been visited 39 times by 29 different presidents.

The influence of different types of drugs on driving a car or other motor vehicle was assessed in Poland in 2018. The influence of alcohol was measured at 1.7 times the influence of the control substance ( alcohol-free ). The influence of cannabis was measured at 1.1 times that of the control substance.

This statistic shows the rate of specific deaths ( excluding certain conditions such as heart disease and cancer ) in the United Kingdom in 2018, by gender and age. In this year, the death rate for males aged 85 and over was 127.1 per 100,000 population, compared to 215.7 for females of the same age.

As of March 2021, users in their teens and twenties accounted for the majority of Reddit's active app user accounts in the United States. According to App Ape, 27.5 percent of the social app's user base were aged between 20 and 29 years.
Nearly 60 percent of Poles stated that Russia has not explained the circumstances of the Katyn massacre adequately.

In March 2020, 38 percent of Poles stated that they strongly believed that the Smolensk air crash in January 2020 was caused by terrorists. In contrast, ten percent of respondents had the opposite opinion.

This statistic shows the share of domestic holiday trips taken in Great Britain in 2019, by car ownership and employment status. Households without a car made up the majority of the sample, with 93 percent of respondents reporting that they travelled by car.

A 2019 survey found that 44 percent of U.S. adults aged 18 to 29 years believed that climate change had a great deal of negative impacts on global agriculture. In comparison, only 28 percent of U.S. adults aged 65 years and older believed the same.

This statistic shows the share of domestic holiday trips taken in Great Britain in 2019, by age group. Over 22 percent of holiday trips taken by British residents were taken by those aged between 45 and 54.

This statistic shows the opinion of French customers regarding the trade of animal fur in 2022. In February 2022, more than 80 percent of the respondents declared that they were against the fur trade.

Belarus was the major importer of Russian condensed milk in 2019, purchasing nearly 4.6 billion Russian rubles worth of the product. The second leading importer was an unknown country, accounting for over 743 million Russian rubles worth of imports.

On Saturdays, the footfall in shopping centers in Poland amounted to approximately 60 percent of the number of visits recorded before the coronavirus epidemic. After the reopening of shops on 23 May 2020, the percentage of visits on Saturdays increased to 68 percent.
The global cloud telephony market is forecast to grow by 13.6 percent in 2020 compared to 2019. The market is expected to reach nearly 17.9 billion euros in 2021.

According to a survey, during the 2020 Hot Sale in Mexico, 62 percent of participants said they bought items online during the event because they were able to get special offers and discounts. In addition, 59 percent of respondents stated that they participated to take advantage of sales prices. The 2020 edition of the North American country's largest online sales event took place from June 25 to July 1.

Average retail prices of whey products in Russia have been following fluctuant trend over the observed period. At its lowest, the average price were recorded in August at 71.06 Russian rubles per kilogram, whereas the highest price were recorded in January at 74.02 Russian rubles per kilogram, respectively.

In a survey conducted in January and February of 2019, around 54 percent of respondents in Peru stated that they believed the most important factor needed in order to achieve gender equality was more women being represented in government and politics. Additionally, 45 percent of respondents believed that having more women in senior positions in business or CEO/board positions is also an essential factor for gender equality.

In 2020, around 73 percent of respondents in Chile strongly or somewhat agreed that unless men took actions to support women's rights, gender equality would not improve. Another 24 percent of respondents disagreed with the statement. Chilean men are less likely to identify as feminists than women.

During a June 2020 survey, registered voters were asked how important they thought it was for Congress to pass a bill to reduce economic inequality. The survey shows that 34 percent of respondents believed that Congress should pass such a bill as a top priority.

This statistic displays the distribution of polyurethane ( PU ) production worldwide in 2017, by end-use application. In that year, construction accounted for 29 percent of the global production of polyurethane.
In 2020, the Lego Group had a gross margin of 69.8 percent. The toy manufacturer had a global revenue of around 5.2 billion euros that year.

American football is a commonly watched sport both in the United States and worldwide. Some of the biggest stars in the game are household names and often divide opinion based on their public persona and fans'loyalties. During a June 2020 survey in the United States, 19 percent of respondents stated that they were aware a lot about NFL players'reactions to the killing of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer.

The majority of respondents stated that the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Romania had a significant impact on their professional activities. However, the level of impact varied from one industry to another. The most affected industry was tourism and hospitality, as nine out of ten respondents reported having neither lost their job nor had their salary lowered during the coronavirus crisis. On the other hand, 18 percent of respondents working in the field of telecommunications stated that they lost their job during the COVID-19 pandemic in Romania.

From June 8 to June 14, 2020, the turnover of small retail businesses in Russia grew at a significantly elevated rate compared to the equivalent period of 2019. The highest mark was recorded in the food and grocery segment, where the average turnover increased by 23 percent.

The Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug had the highest number of COVID-19 cases per 100 thousand population among Russian federal subjects, measuring at approximately 5.1 thousand as of November 30, 2020. The average rate of infection in the country was recorded at roughly 1.3 thousand per 100 thousand population over the observed period.

In 2018, health expenditure in Nigeria accounted for some six percent of the country's GDP. Between 2006 and 2018, the share fluctuated, but remained within the four percent range. Nigeria's GDP is projected to increase to 1,959.29 billion U.S. dollars by 2021.

In 2019, the average annual expenditure of households in the South East on health care was 10.3 thousand Nigerian Naira. This was the highest figure compared to other zones of Nigeria. On the contrary, households in the South West spent on average 4.4 thousand Naira on health issues, the lowest amount nationwide.
The highest number of requests for the ECHR to be solved in Romania was recorded in 2018, totaling 979 requests. In 2020, the number of requests decreased to 155.

In 2019, private healthcare expenditure in Nigeria amounted to 3.7 trillion Nigerian Naira. This figure is projected to increase to 4.4 trillion Naira by 2021. On the other hand, public healthcare expenditure in Nigeria was estimated at 1.3 trillion Naira in 2019, accounting for about 60 percent of total healthcare expenditure.

Between 2018 and 2020, the prevalence of wasting among children under five years old was highest in Western Africa at 6.9 percent. It was lowest in Southern Africa at 3.2 percent. The average prevalence of wasting in the continent was 5.3 percent.

As of May 2020, the average price of oranges in Nicaragua was the highest among the group of Latin American countries displayed. At that point in time, the fruit was sold at around three U.S. dollars per kilogram in the country. In comparison, the price of an orange in Argentina amounted to 0.65 dollars per kilogram.

This statistic shows the proportion of people who were concerned about the spread of different viruses in France from 2005 to 2020. In March 2005, 33 percent of respondents were very concerned about the spread of the SARS virus.

In 2021, the majority of transfers involving men's professional soccer players came with contracts being the final transaction in 66.8 percent of cases. This indicates that in the majority of cases, professional soccer clubs purchased players with contracts already in place.

In 2021, domestic soccer clubs worldwide spent an estimated 4.9 billion U.S. dollars on international transfers of male professional players, representing a decrease of around 17 percent from the previous year. These transfers involved players representing 185 different nationalities, highlighting the global nature of soccer.

In 2019, the average transfer fee for men's professional soccer players worldwide amounted to 2.68 million U.S. dollars. This value is significantly higher than the average transfer fee of 1.74 million U.S. dollars in 2011.

This statistic shows the value of venture capital private equity investments in femtech companies worldwide from 2012 to 2020. In 2020, venture capital investments in femtech reached 517 million U.S. dollars, a decrease from the 647 million U.S. dollars seen in 2018.

In 2021, the majority of transfers involved players representing domestic soccer clubs in Portugal. The combined transfers across the country involved players representing 185 different clubs, with the majority representing clubs in the top division of Portuguese soccer.

In 2019, after earning more than 200 million Indian rupees, Khana Khazana star Ajeev Kapoor was listed as the best-paid chef from India. Ranveer Brar and Vikas Khanna were some other names on the list.

In 2021, domestic soccer clubs worldwide made 686 transfers involving female professional players aged between 19 and 23. These players represented the largest age group in the transfers in that year.

As of June 2021, it was calculated that among employers of state and local government workers, education and health services industry had the highest share of employer costs for wages and salaries at 64 percent. For benefits, the public administration industry had the highest share at 43 percent.

As of June 2021, it was calculated that employers of civilian workers in the United States all averaged around 30 percent of their compensation costs for benefits as compared to just 30 percent of their wage and salary costs. The highest spending on benefits came from the production, transportation, and material movement group where employers spent an average of 33.2 percent of their total compensation costs on benefits.

In 2020, the most important topic in the presidential election campaign in Poland was the economy. Every second respondent considered this topic to be of particular importance. The second most important topic was health care.

As of March 11, 2020, 20 out of 48 cluster coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) infections in South Korea occurred at medical facilities, followed by social welfare facilities. In total, over 80 percent of the confirmed cases in South Korea were linked to these cluster infections.
In 2020, 36 percent of oncology centers in Poland had to part with it due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The number of arrivals at accommodation establishments in Iceland increased each year between 2009 and 2019. Around 5.3 million arrivals ( of both international and domestic tourists ) were recorded in 2019.
In 2020, 40 percent of oncology centers in Poland had restrictions on the statements about the operation of such hospitals due to the coronavirus epidemic.

During the 2019-2020 flu season in the United States, there were around 20,296 deaths reported among people aged 65 years and older. This statistic shows the number of influenza deaths in the U.S. during the 2019-2020 influenza season, by age group.

It was calculated that the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of Kansas reached 38,764 U.S. dollars in 2020. This is a large increase from the PCE of 2000 which stood at 22,938 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

This statistic shows the volume of gas vented during the production of oil in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2006 to 2019, in metric tons. It shows that the volume of gas vented increased significantly over this period from 25,000 metric tons in 2006 to 95,000 metric tons in 2019.

Approximately one half of Russians intended to take part in the upcoming plebiscite on constitutional amendments from June 25 to July 1, 2020, according to a survey from June-July 2020. The share of respondents who would participate in the voting decreased from the previous month, when nearly one third of the participants was planning to vote for the changes.

The revenue of the recorded music industry in Denmark increased overall from 2015 to 2019. In 2015, the revenue amounted to roughly 456 million Danish kroner, and peaked in 2019 with over 600 million Danish kroner.

This statistic shows the consumption of animal products in France in 2019, by type of product. It displays that 73 percent of respondents ate red meat, compared to 28 percent consuming red meat substitutes or stopped eating red meat altogether.

In 2020, 87 percent of oncology centers patients in Poland during the coronavirus epidemic ( COVID-19 ) claimed that they had been to the hospital and underwent an analysis of anemia, an infection, and an epidemiological interview.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's CPI. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the CPI was projected to increase by 4.05 percent. In the same scenario, the country's GDP will increase by 6.27 percent.

American adults were most likely to support a mix of free ad-supported and paid ad-supported podcasts, with 65 percent of White respondents preferring a combination of both options, as of May 2020. Black respondents were more likely to prefer a model where all podcasts are free to access, with just nine percent of Black adults supporting a paid model, where some content is available for free but advertising is also featured.

This graph represents the average distance traveled by public transport users in France in 2019, by city. It turns out that Paris was the city with the longest average distance traveled by public transport users, at more than 10.5 kilometers.

In the first quarter of 2020, the average fixed internet download speed worldwide dropped by 2.2 percent compared to the same quarter in 2019. The first quarter of 2020 also saw a 1.6 percent decline in mobile download speeds. The decrease in mobile download speeds are most likely due to restrictions brought on by the coronavirus pandemic. Many countries were forced to place extensive restrictions on travel which in turn, caused internet users to stay at home and restructure their online activities.

According to most recent economic data, the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of Vermont in 2020 reached 47,099 U.S. dollars. This is a large increase from the PCE of 2000 which stood at 25,826 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

Recent economic data shows that in 2020 the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of West Virginia amounted to 37,226 U.S. dollars. This is a large increase from the PCE of 2000 which stood at 19,067 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

Discounts and free delivery were the decisive factors for making an online purchase according to 69 percent of Russian customers in 2020. The second most important factor, named by 67 percent of respondents, was the availability of a product description on the website.

As of 2020, roughly 1.7 million people in Nigeria were living with HIV. Female adults aged 15 years and over accounted for 975 thousand of the total 1.7 million, representing the group most affected by the epidemic in the country.

Arizona has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1912, voting for the nationwide winner in 23 out of 59 elections, giving a success rate of forty percent. In these 59 elections, Arizona has voted for the Republican nominee 34 times, and the Democratic nominee on ten occasions. Since 1952, Arizona has voted for the Republican nominee in all elections except 1964, and in the 2020 election, Donald Trump won the popular vote in the Grand Canyon State by a margin of 16 percent. As of 2020, no U.S. president has ever been born in or resided in Arizona upon taking office, although former Vice President and Republican nominee, Sarah Palin, was born in Arizona in 1964.

In 2019, Idaho added two billion U.S. dollars to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States through its arts and culture production industry. This value had increased from its 2001 value of 1.44 billion U.S. dollars.

As of the first half of 2021, 7,868 items were requested for removal from search results by federal or government entities in the United States. This represents a nine percent decrease from the previous reporting period.

An ongoing survey of U.S. registered nurses found that only 68 percent had access to N95 respirators on their units. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. registered nurses with access to N95 and PAPR type respirators as of March 3, 2020.

As of September 29, 2020, the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in the Netherlands resulted in over 12.7 thousand hospitalizations. However, the distribution of hospital admissions differed greatly by age. To this day, most hospitalizations occurred with older patients. In the Netherlands, roughly 70 percent of hospitalized patients were notably aged 60 years old and over. Children have also been admitted to Dutch hospitals due to the coronavirus, although to a much lesser extent.

In the first quarter of 2020, the labor force participation rate among South Africans aged 15 years and older was at 60.5 percent for females and 66.2 percent for males. However, when comparing the participation rate by race, it is evident that the number of white South Africans in the labor force increased the most.

This statistic displays the funding volume of global supply chain and logistics start-ups from 2014 to 2019. In 2019, global supply chain and logistics start-ups raised approximately 12.6 billion U.S. dollars in funding.

South Dakota's arts and culture production industry contributed 1.27 billion U.S. dollars to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States in 2019. This was an increase from its 2001 value of 828 million U.S. dollars.

In 2019, the value added to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States from Texas'arts and culture production industry reached 49.89 billion U.S. dollars. This value had increased from its 2001 level of 28.65 billion U.S. dollars.

As of April 2020, the most common word used to describe the online services in Norway was Google. Norwegian internet users also used terms such as Yahoo, Facebook, Amazon, and eBay. Other popular terms were Apple, Twitter, and Instagram.

According to a survey conducted in June 2020, 66 percent of Democrats strongly approved of the Supreme Court's ruling on the Affordable Care Act, which protects people with pre-existing conditions from being denied coverage by insurance companies. The same survey found that 63 percent of Democrats also strongly approved of the court's decision on Roe v. Wade, which protects a woman's right to an abortion.

The highest amount of money spent on Facebook ads related to the presidential election in Poland was by the campaign of the incumbent President Andrzej Duda. The ads of the presidential campaign of the incumbent Warsaw Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski appeared less frequently, but the costliest was the Facebook ad of the candidate of the KO ( Koalicja Obywatelska ) party, which cost over 180 thousand zloty.

The eSports market has boomed in recent years with more and more viewers tuning in to watch their favorite games being played by some of the best gamers in the world. As a result, a new market has opened up for sponsors and advertisers to sell their products. According to a 2019 report, sponsorship and advertising spending on eSports is estimated to increase from 125 million U.S. dollars in 2017 to over 630 million U.S. dollars in 2023.

Delaware has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections ever held, voting for the nationwide winner in 42 out of 59 elections, giving a success rate of 69 percent. Throughout most of the nineteenth century, Delaware was a staunchly Democratic state, voting for the Democratic nominee in all elections between 1828 ad 1956 ( although Republican nominees did sometimes win in the 1864 election ), and siding primarily with the Democratic nominee in the twentieth century. However, Delaware has been considered a battleground state in the past three decades, voting for the Republican nominee in all elections since 1992, and in the 2020 election, Donald Trump won the popular vote by a 3.2 percent margin. As of 2020, no U.S. president has ever been born in or resided in Delaware upon taking office, although both Democratic nominees in the 1968 and 1980 elections, had represented Delaware in the Senate before running for president.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's industry sector. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the industry sector was projected to increase by 7.1 percent. In the same scenario, the agriculture sector will grow at a rate of 2.35 percent and the services sector will grow at a rate of 6.47 percent.

From 2004 to 2018, there were around 1,072 heat-related deaths among those aged 65 to 74 years in the United States. This statistic illustrates the number of deaths in the United States caused by heat from 2004 to 2018, by age group.
