From 2004 to 2018, there were around 1,410 deaths caused by heat in the United States among those aged 55 to 64 years per 100,000 population among males. This statistic illustrates the number of deaths in the United States caused by heat from 2004 to 2018, by gender and age group.

Hawaii has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1960, voting for the winning candidate in 39 out of 52 elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Hawaii has voted for the Democratic nominee in 23 elections, and the only times where the Republican nominees won were in 1964 and 1984, where Richard Nixon and Ronald Reagan respectively won re-election in landslide victories. In the 2020 election, Joe Biden carried the state with a near thirty percent margin in the popular vote.

The COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 hit the sports industry hard - many professional leagues across the globe suspended their seasons and hundreds of thousands of jobs were put at risk as public sporting events across the world were cancelled. Analysis suggests the New England Patriots could lose more than 370 million U.S. dollars as a result of lost ticketing revenue of postponed games due to the crisis.

The majority of companies in the Romanian e-commerce industry stated that sales decreased by 50 to 60 percent during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. At the same time, ten percent of companies reported a sales drop of more than 80 percent.
In 2019, the highest percentage of online payments was registered in Bucharest, with 58.1 percent, while only 5.4 percent of online transactions were completed in Timis.

Among pregnant women surveyed in 2019, around 5.4 percent had used marijuana in the past month. The statistic illustrates the percentage of pregnant women in the U.S. who had used marijuana in the past month from 2016 to 2019.

According to a survey conducted in the United States in February 2020, around 61 percent of Democrats felt that Donald Trump's presence on Fox News had a lot of influence on the news that was produced on the platform. In comparison, just 28 percent of Republicans felt the same, with around 47 percent of respondents stating that Trump had no influence at all on the news that was produced on the platform.

The average age of a person employed in the Russian education system continuously increased since 2000. A decade later, a student of the country's educational institutions was on average nearly 44 years old. Among employees of the economy as a whole, the average age was nearly four years lower.

Nebraska has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1892, voting for the nationwide winner in 19 out of 33 elections, which gives a success rate of 59 percent. Nebraska has traditionally voted for the more conservative candidate of the major parties ; siding primarily with the Republican Party from the 1880s until the 1940s, before voting mostly Democrat since the 1960s. The only times where Nebraska did not vote for a major party nominee were in the 1912 election, where it voted for former-President Theodore Roosevelt, and in the 1964 election, where it voted for Lyndon B. Johnson. In the 2020 election, Donald Trump won the popular vote in the Beehive State by a margin of 16 percent.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's industry sector. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the industry sector was projected to increase by 6.47 percent. In the same scenario, the agriculture sector will grow at a rate of 2.35 percent and the services sector will grow at a rate of 6.47 percent.

Nevada has taken part in 43 U.S. presidential elections since 1864, voting for the winning candidate on 32 occasions, which gives a success rate of 73 percent. Nevada has always voted for a major party candidate, choosing the Republican and Democratic nominees twenty times each. The only times where Nevada did not vote for a major party nominee were in 1892, where it voted for the People's Party candidate, and in 1912, where it voted for former President Theodore Roosevelt as he ran on the ticket of the Progressive Party. In the 2020 election, the Democratic nominee, Joe Biden, won Nevada's popular vote by a margin of just 2.4 percent. As of the 2020 election, no president or major party candidate has ever been from the Silver State. Nevada's allocation of electoral votes has been relatively low since its admission to the union, rising to four votes from 1912 until 1988, although it has had the joint-lowest of any state since 1992.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Denmark fell to around 175 thousand, down from over one million recorded in the same period a year earlier. In June the number of tourist arrivals in Danish accommodations reached approximately 325 thousand. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

Oregon has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1860, voting for the nationwide winner in forty elections, giving a success rate of seventy percent. Oregon has always voted for either of the major party candidates, and in early years, Oregon did not have a strong allegiance with any of the major parties, voting with the nationwide winner in all elections between 1892 and 1928. However, since 1932, Oregon has voted for the Democratic nominee in twenty elections, and the Republican nominee in 24 elections ( including all elections from 1996 to 2012 ) ; in the 2016 election, Hillary Clinton won the popular vote in the Beehive State by a margin of 16 percent. In the 2020 election, Joe Biden won Oregon's popular vote by a margin of 19 percent. As of 2020, no U.S. president has ever resided or was born in Oregon, although both Democratic nominees in the 1968 and 1980 elections, had represented Oregon in the Senate before running for president.

Rhode Island has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1792, and has voted for the nationwide winner in thirty of these 41 elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Rhode Island has always voted for a major party candidate, choosing the Democratic-Republican Party's nominees in its first two elections, before voting for the Democratic Party's nominee 25 times, and the Republican candidate 24 times since 1856. The only time where Rhode Island did not vote for a major party candidate was in the 1912 election, where it granted its 38 electoral votes to Theodore Roosevelt, who was running as the candidate of the newly-formed Progressive Party. After voting Democrat in all elections between 1992 and 2016, Rhode Island voted red in 2020, as Donald Trump defeated the Democratic nominee, Joe Biden, by less than one percent of the popular vote.

In British Columbia, salaried employees worked an average of 39.5 hours a week in goods producing industries and 36.3 hours in the service producing industries in 2020. The hours in the service producing industries had decreased from their 2001 averages of 37.3 hours a week.

Between mid-March and mid-April 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic and the closure of many physical shops in Poland, online sales of sedatives and sleeping pills have increased by 24 percent compared to the same period a year earlier. The most significant increase in sales of antidepressants and sedatives was recorded in the category of psychotropic drugs.

In 2007, salaried employees in Nunavut worked an average of 39 hours a week in goods producing industries and 37 hours in the service producing industries. The hours in the service producing industries had increased from their 2001 averages of 36.8 hours a week.

In 2020, the most important problem that the citizens of Bucharest were facing was the poor state of the city's road network infrastructure. At the same time, over 40 percent of respondents considered that corruption in the Bucharest City Hall was a pressing issue.

In Nova Scotia, the workers from every job and industry had worked a total of 717.5 million hours in 2020. This was a large increase from the 2001 value when work time amounted to 658.5 million hours for the year.
This statistic shows the volume of goods handled in seaports in France in 2016, by type. In 2016, the volume of liquid bulk handled in French seaports amounted to nearly 135 million tons.

Indonesia's GDP was forecast to grow by 5.3 percent in 2020. This figure was estimated before the outbreak of the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, and the announcement of a lockdown in Indonesia to slow down the spread of the virus. As of March 25, 2020, the death toll in Indonesia has risen to 34.

In August 2021, the export value of machinery and other capital equipment from Kenya was measured at roughly 775 million Kenyan shillings ( KSh ) ( roughly 6.8 million U.S. dollars ). The amount was slightly down from the previous month, when it reached nearly 1.6 billion KSh ( approximately 12.6 million U.S. dollars ).

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Austria fell to around 35 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from over 2.3 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Austrian accommodations recovered to 1.5 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Poland fell to around 70 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from 2.3 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Polish accommodations increased to 1.3 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

This statistic shows the news aggregator websites used by French internet users aged 18 to 24 in 2020. It appears that 20 percent of respondents had used Google News to get different news links, while only two percent had used Flipcart.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Sweden fell to around 0.5 million due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from 2.2 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. In June the number of tourist arrivals in Swedish accommodations reached 1.6 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in North Macedonia fell to around 16 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from over 81 thousand recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Macedonian accommodations increased to approximately 5.1 thousand. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

According to a survey from 2021, the most trusted news media in France was the RBC newspaper with 64 percent of French respondents stating that they considered it a reliable source of information. The newspaper Le Monde was the second most trusted news media, followed by the TUI television channel. On the other hand, 58 percent of French people did not trust the source of information of the website Le Huffington Post.

The volume of waste management facilities in Russia has been decreasing over the observed period. The number of enterprises and landfills for waste utilization, decontamination, and disposal has also been falling gradually between 2012 and 2018.

The Army & Air Force Exchange Service generated a total revenue of 7.5 billion U.S. dollars worldwide in fiscal year 2020. This reflects a decrease over the previous year's total of 8.6 billion U.S. dollars. The Army & Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ), also known as The Exchange, is a retailer which operates on U.S. Army and Air Force bases around the world.

In 2020, the Army & Air Force Exchange Service operated a total of 4,873 stores. The Army & Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ), also known as The Exchange, is a retailer which operates on U.S. Army and Air Force bases around the world.

In 2018, the number of cases of child abuse in Romania was 10,788. More than 90 percent of the cases concerned child neglect. Other types of child abuse were related to emotional, physical, and sexual abuse.

Nigeria's total land area amounts to about 92 million hectares. The largest share of Nigeria's land area is occupied by the country's forests, which extend over 88 million hectares. Agricultural land in Nigeria covers a total area of 70.7 million hectares, making it the second largest ecosystem in terms of area in the country.

This statistic represents the average monthly combined water and sewer bills for residential customers in the United States between 2001 and 2018. In 2018, the average combined water and sewer bill for residential customers in the United States came to 100 U.S. dollars per month.

A June 2020 survey revealed that 30.4 percent of online U.S. adults with an income of less than 10,000 U.S. dollars had missed at least one payment for their internet bill since the outbreak of COVID-19 in the United States. In comparison, only 9.2 percent of U.S. adults with an income of 100,000 U.S. dollars or more had missed at least one of their internet payment bills.
This statistic shows the death rate for asbestosis in the United States from 1999 to 2018. The maximum death rate in the given period for asbestosis was 6.8 per one million inhabitants.
In 2019, the Defense Commissary Agency had a total of 77 million customer transactions. The Defense Commissary Agency had 635 commissaries in 13 countries and two U.S. territories that year.

In 2019, the United States accounted for over 53 percent of the global SVoD market, generating more than 222.6 billion U.S. dollars in revenue. China was ranked second, with a market size of over 70.5 billion U.S. dollars. SVoD services like Netflix are popular in the U.S. and China, and many subscribers around the world have access to premium content via subscription-based models.
In 2019, the net income of Camping World was approximately minus 111.6 million U.S. dollars. The company had global revenues of around 4.9 billion U.S. dollars that year.

In 2020, the production of copper by the mining company Minera La Bambas in Peru decreased by 0.04 percent, versus the previous year. The production of copper by the company Antamina, however, increased by 0.02 percent in that same year.

Beer brewery `` De Vrijfeling '' was the highest-rated craft beer in the Netherlands in July 2022, with a weighted average rating of 4.4 out of 5. Brewery `` Bierlige Brouwerij '' was the highest-rated brewery in the Netherlands with a weighted average rating of 4.3.

From January 26 to February 7, 2022, around 22.5 percent of adults in the U.S. reported symptoms of depressive disorder in the past week. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. respondents over the age of 18 years who reported symptoms of depressive disorder in the last seven days, between April 23, 2020 and February 7, 2022.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 54.01 percent of Vietnamese respondents stated that the coronavirus pandemic had a major impact on their leisure travel plans. In the same survey, 61.57 percent of respondents indicated that it had a major impact on their day to day lifestyle and working life, respectively.

Between July 2018 and June 2019, the most popular pharmaceutical-related search question in the United States was `` what is tramadol ''. This search query generated an average of 33,000 monthly searches during the measured timeframe. Other popular pharmaceutical-related search queries included `` what is niacin/nicotine patch used for '' and `` is there a generic version of metformin available ''.

Between July 2018 and June 2019, the most searched disease or health problem in the United States was the common cold. Other popular search queries regarding diseases and health problems included fever, headache, and sore throat.

In 2021, the number of unique visitors on the official website of the Peruvian department of information and telecommunications ( ICT ), called ICTanduay.com, during the celebration of Cyber Days in Peru, amounted to 744 million. That year, the second most visited website during the event was that of the department of health, with more than 496 million visits.

In 2021, the unemployment rate in Angola was higher among women. In the fourth quarter of the year, the female unemployment rate reached roughly 5.3 percent, while it was at 4.5 percent for men. Overall, the country had an unemployment rate of 5.3 percent.

A November 2020 survey revealed that 26 percent of video games in the mobile phone category were played in Vietnam. Additionally, 2 percent of mobile games were played in Germany, while 2 percent of mobile games were played in Indonesia.

According to a 2020 global survey of IT security decision makers, 47 percent of respondents have implemented security automation but have not yet deployed them. Another 39 percent of respondents have deployed security automation and are scaling it up.

Overall, the weekly number of people tested for the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Sweden increased in 2020. From the week covering the 7th to the 13th of December, 2,593,073 tests were performed. In total, over seven million tests had been performed for the coronavirus in Sweden, and among these, around 124 thousand had tested positive, as of December 17, 2020.

In 2021, consumers in the United States spent an average of 11.5 hours per week listening to ads on Pandora. This marks a significant decrease from the time spent in 2018, when consumers in the U.S. spent an average of 14.7 hours per week listening to ads on the radio platform.
By the end of 2020, the population of the administrative area of Shanghai municipality in China had reached approximately 24.9 million people. This was a slight increase from the previous year.

The majority of respondents were of the opinion that the two most important measures to be taken were developing a vaccine and mass immunization. Only 12 percent considered other solutions to be as important as the mentioned two.
This statistic shows the gross profit of Nautilus Inc. worldwide from 2014 to 2020. In 2020, Nautilus Inc. generated a gross profit of approximately 227.6 million U.S. dollars.

In 2020, approximately ten percent of all TikTok downloads in Brazil were generated through the mobile app's app store. That year, TikTok generated over two billion downloads via app stores in the South American country.

As of March 2, 2021, there were around 353 COVID-19 deaths per 100,000 population among Asian U.S. residents living in California. This statistic illustrates the COVID-19 death rates per 100,000 population for Asian U.S. residents as of March 2, 2021, by state.

The average cost of sending remittances to Russia reached one percent in the second quarter of 2021, marking a slight increase compared to the previous quarter. Over the observed period, the highest average cost of remittances was recorded at two percent in the third quarter of 2017.

The production costs of hydrogen from natural gas using carbon capture utilization and storage ( CCUS ) technology in the United States amounted to 0.61 U.S. dollars per kilogram in 2018. The production costs of hydrogen without using CCUS amounted to 0.34 U.S. dollars per kilogram.

This statistic shows the total number of civil court cases in Canada from 2006/07 to 2019/20, distinguished by type of case. In 2019/20, there were 473,786 total active civil cases in Canada with a court hearing.

This statistic shows the average daily caseload of adult criminal courts in Canada from the fiscal year of 2009 to the fiscal year of 2019. In the fiscal year of 2019, the average daily caseload of adult criminal courts in Canada stood at 249,387 cases.

In 2020, the number of respondents who declared that they were atheists increased by three percent compared to 2018. The number of those who believe in God but do not identify with any religion also increased.

A July 2020 survey revealed that 49 percent of online adults in the United States thought that Alibaba should be banned from operating in the U.S. In particular, younger online users were more likely to oppose the e-commerce giant - 49 percent of U.S. adults aged 18 to 34 years felt that Alibaba should be banned from operating in the U.S.

This statistic shows the number of employees at the leading pest control companies in the United States in 2020. With a total of 15,274 employees, Pestrolife was the leading pest control company in the United States in 2020.

This statistic shows how French consumers were cutting down their food budget in 2019. It reveals that 47 percent of respondents were cooking more often from scratch, while 44 percent were buying supermarket own-brand products.

The number of millionaires in Poland has been systematically increasing since 2008. The count of people with investable assets of one million zloty and more was 35 thousand in 2019, over six times as many as in 2008.

As of April 2020, the Indonesian government has set aside 452 billion Indonesian rupiah to incentivize domestic tourists to visit any destination in Indonesia, as the country is currently experiencing the effects of the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 outbreak. According to the source, this economic stimulus package was to counter the impact of the outbreak of COVID-19 on the Indonesian economy, particularly the tourism sector. Indonesia registered its first coronavirus-related death on March 11, 2020 on Bali, a popular tourist destination. Globally, the tourism sector has been greatly affected by the spread of the virus.

In 2021, the production of sorghum in Nigeria increased by 33.5 percent compared to the previous year. Between 2010 and 2021, the highest growth was registered in 2011, when the volume of sorghum produced in the country increased by 34.4 percent.

A July 2020 survey revealed that 52 percent of online adults in the United States aged 18 to 34 thought that TikTok should be banned from operating in the U.S. In comparison, only 22 percent of U.S. adults aged 45 to 64 thought the same thing.
Between 2017 and 2018, 60 percent of households in Tanzania owned a television. The share slightly decreased compared to 2011 and 2012, when around 70 percent of households had a TV.

Of the surveyed clinicians, psychiatrists were the most knowledgeable about mHealth rehabilitation technologies. This statistic shows the percentage of clinicians who were very or extremely knowledgeable about current mobile rehabilitation technologies in the U.S., by specialty, as of 2019.

As of 2019, the price index of maize in South Africa was at 154.9 points, an increase of roughly 5.5 points from the previous year. Between 2001 and 2019, the price index followed an overall increasing trend, with several fluctuations. The highest price index was measured in 2016, at 320.7 points, whereas the lowest was registered in 2005 at 54.9 points.
This statistic shows the distribution of revenue made from vinyl records sales in France in 2019, by age group. More than half of the revenue was generated among people aged 50 and older.

Between March 2018 and February 2019, the incidence of poverty was higher among people with no education than among those who attended primary school. In total, 41 percent of the population in Angola with no education was living under the poverty line, against 56 percent of the population who attended primary school.

In 2020, it was proposed that teachers and doctors should receive a pay rise of 3.1 percent and 2.8 percent respectively, by the UK government in order to attract and retain staff in these difficult and high-risk jobs during the Coronavirus pandemic. Other public sector workers who will receive a pay rise in 2020 are police officers, prison officers and members of the national crime agency, who will receive a pay rise of 2.5 percent each.

Over 2.2 thousand patents and work permits were issued in Russia to individuals from January 1 to June 30, 2021. The number of patents issued in the country increased by nearly 60 percent compared to the previous year.

In the production year 2019/2020, the aggregate production of maize in South Africa was roughly 12.5 million metric tons. The state with highest production volume was Western Cape with approximately 6.5 million metric tons. This accounts for roughly 48.8 percent of the total South African maize production.

In 2019, the net income of Cypress Semiconductor Corporation amounted to approximately 31.1 million U.S. dollars, a decrease from the net income of 183.6 million U.S. dollars that was recorded in 2018.

According to a survey conducted in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in March 2020, over half of respondents aged 55 years and older were concerned about overcrowding on overseas holiday destinations in 2020. By comparison, only a quarter of respondents aged between 18 and 24 years were concerned about overcrowding when booking overseas holidays.

China was the main import partner for Kenya in 2020. The value of imports coming from the Asian country was approximately 363 billion Kenyan shillings ( KSh ), around 3.1 billion U.S. dollars. India followed, being the second main import partner for Kenya, with imports worth around 191 billion KSh ( nearly two billion U.S. dollars ).

The Last of Us Part II, the second installment in the series based on the novels of the same name written by Neil Gaiman, was released in May 2020 and already sold four million copies worldwide. Only a week after its release, the game sold more than four million digital and physical units.

As of 2018/19, the producer price index of wheat in South Africa was at 199.8 points, an increase of roughly 10.5 points from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, the index followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The peak was reached in 2015/16, with 200.4 points. This can be linked to an increase in the domestic demand for wheat, along with lower production of maize, the main competitor in the local market.

As of September 2020, around 62 percent of Republicans distrusted a lot in medical advice coming from Joe Biden. This statistic shows the percentage of Republicans who trusted or distrusted a lot in medical advice coming from Joe Biden as of September 2020.

As of 2020, over 5.2 million children were enrolled in primary schools in Kenya. The number slightly increased compared to the previous year. Male students were in higher number, approximately 5.2 million, while females were 493,000. The primary school enrollment rate in Kenya has increased in the last years.

The share of Danes subscribing to video streaming services like Netflix increased in the past two years. In the fourth quarter of 2020, 17 percent of people subscribed to such services. By comparison, the corresponding figure for the fourth quarter of 2018 was ten percent.

In 2019/2020, the preliminary production of grain sorghum in South Africa amounted to 161.5 thousand metric tons, which represented a slight increase of roughly 1.5 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2020 an overall negative trend can be observed, with a comprehensive decrease of 65.7 percent. The highest quantity of grain sorghum produced in South Africa was 446.9 thousand metric tons in 2003/2004, which is also the highest recorded quantity in the given time period.

As of 2019, the price index of grain sorghum in South Africa was at 198.9 points, an increase of roughly 5.5 points from the previous year. Between 2001 and 2019, the price index followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The lowest price index was registered in 2005 at 34.7 points, while the highest one was recorded in 2016 at 221.4 points.

In the first half of 2020, the most followed U.S. Congress members on Twitter were those with a large number of followers. The median Twitter follower count of members of the 115th Congress was over 80,000. In contrast, the median Facebook follower count of these members was 15,000. Overall, the median Twitter follower count of all U.S. Congress members was 84,000, while the median Facebook follower count was 74,000.

As a result of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, it is estimated that the global automotive sector will experience a downturn in 2020. The European Union is expected to be the most affected market, as a decline of 2.5 billion U.S. dollars is forecast.

Estimates suggest that Apple TV Plus will have 40 million users in the United States in 2020, four times the number of users Apple TV had in 2019. Apple TV Plus is an online video streaming service launched by Apple in November 2019, and is available to all Apple devices.

During the first quarter of 2020, around 31 percent of respondents from the United States stated that they have seen Korean media content very often in their country. Overall, the share of people who have seen Korean media content at least once was higher in emerging markets than in developed countries.

This statistic shows the annual healthcare costs for an average person in the U.S. as of 2021, by type of service. The average cost of an inpatient service was 1,233 U.S. dollars, compared to 119 dollars for an outpatient service.

In 2019/2020, the preliminary production volume of sunflower seeds in South Africa amounted to 723.5 thousand metric tons, which illustrated a decline of roughly 14 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2020, drastic fluctuations were registered in the volume of sunflower seeds produced in the country. The lowest quantity was 516.5 thousand metric tons in 2009/2010, while the peak was 978.2 thousand metric tons in 2001/2002.

In the first quarter of 2022, the unit sales of Ghost of Toshima amounted to approximately eight million units, up from about 5.5 million units in the corresponding period of the previous year. The game was released exclusively on PlayStation 4 in Japan in July 2013.

In July 2021, Angola's oil production amounted to 1.2 million barrels per day. The production decreased in comparison to the previous month, when it was measured at 1.2 million barrels per day. Angola is among the ten largest oil producers in Africa. Most of the crude oil produced in the country is associated gas coming from oil fields.

Major League Baseball has a minimum player salary in place to ensure that its athletes are fairly compensated for the work they do. The MLB minimum salary in 2020 stood at a handsome 500,000 U.S. dollars annually, representing a steady increase each year over the last 15 years. However, there is still room for improvement in the eyes of many fans. During a June 2020 survey in the United States, only 12 percent of respondents had a very favorable opinion of MLB's rule change that allows for more playing time in order to increase the player salary.

This statistic shows the expectations of French men regarding the duration of their sexual intercourse in 2019. We can see here that a little more than 70 percent of the men questioned wanted their sexual intercourse to last a little longer, compared to 15 percent who wished it to last much longer.

In 2019 and 2020, Free State was the highest state with soya beans production in South Africa with roughly 506.5 thousand metric tons. This accounts for nearly 60 percent of the total commercial production. Mpumalanga came second with 431.5 thousand metric tons, roughly 13 percent of the total production.

The number of employees in the cultural sector in Greece has generally increased over the period from 2011 to 2019. In 2019, there were around 129.5 thousand people employed in the culture sector in Greece, an increase of about three thousand from the previous year.

According to the incubation period of several coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) viruses, the SARS-CoV-2* can range from one to 14 days, but there are some indications that it could be up to 24 days. In comparison, seasonal influenza has an incubation period of about two days but can range from one to four days.

The number of employees in the cultural sector in Croatia has fluctuated over the period from 2011 to 2019. In 2019, the numbers reached their peak at approximately 60.8 thousand, an increase of about three thousand from the previous year.

As of 2018, the preliminary gross value of oats in South Africa amounted to roughly 102.5 million South African rands ( equivalent to nearly 6.2 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.6 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2015, the gross value of oats followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. It is worth noting that most of the locally produced oats in South Africa are used for human consumption.

This statistic shows the share of foreign wine tourists in Argentina in 2017, broken down by country of origin. That year, more than 40 percent of foreign wine tourists visiting Argentina came from Brazil, followed by the United States and Canada with 36 percent each.

In 2020, the oil extraction and refinery sector contributed 36.3 percent to the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Angola. The second-biggest contributor to the country's GDP was the retail sector, with 15.1 percent. Agriculture, forestry, and fishing represented nine percent of the Angolan GDP.
The adjusted EBITDA of Delivery Hero in 2020 amounted to a loss of over 626 million euros. The Chinese food ordering platform is the parent company of the British food ordering app Delivery Hero UK.

According to a survey conducted in March 2020, the most important piece of information needed by U.S. consumers in order to feel safe while traveling for vacation was information on the destination, followed by data on hotels and destinations.

The statistic shows the main barriers to responsible investment ( RI ) in France in 2019. With 38 percent of respondents, the lack of suitable products was cited as one of the main barriers to responsible investment.

Around 69 percent of adults aged 25 to 34 years in the United States reported that they were less likely to pursue senior housing for themselves or a loved one due to the coronavirus pandemic. This statistic illustrates the changes in the likelihood of pursuing senior housing due to the coronavirus pandemic in the United States as of May 2020, by age.

As of 2019, the processed volume of canola in South Africa declined to 102.5 thousand metric tons, down from 99.5 thousand metric tons in the previous year. In the period under review, canola's processed volume followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. It is an important crop for South Africa, with local production mainly concentrated in the Western Cape.

During a June 2020 survey conducted in the United States, respondents were asked about how often they see people of the same race and ethnicity portrayed in advertising material. According to the survey results, 37 percent of respondents felt that they saw the same race and ethnicity represented in adverts a lot, while just 11 percent said they never saw anybody who represented their racial background in promotional materials.
As of March 1, 2022, there have been around 854,936 deaths due to COVID-19 in the state of California. California is one of the states with the highest number of COVID-19 cases.

The Roman Catholic Church is the largest religious organization in Poland. In 2018, 93.3 percent of Poles belonged to this church. The second largest church is the Polish Orthodox Church, which belongs to the Russian Orthodox Church, and the number of members of this organization has increased by 0.7 percentage points over the observed period.

Nearly 90 percent of Poles perceived their country as physically safe in 2018. According to the survey, the sense of security in the place of residence was higher among rural residents than among those living in urban areas.

The global hematology testing market was estimated to be around 4.5 billion U.S. dollars in 2018. This statistic shows the size of the global hematology testing market in 2018 and a forecast for 2029.

Between 2007 and 2016, each year between 22.5 and 27.5 billion passenger-kilometers were traveled by rail in Paris and le-de-France. In 2017, the number of passenger-kilometers traveled by rail in Paris and le-de-France amounted to 27.3 billion.

Since the beginning of the lockdown due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis in France in March 2020, the number of people who have signed a petition against the pension reform has increased. On December 5, 2019, the French government has announced the introduction of a new pension system that will replace the old solidarity-based system. Since then, the number of people who have signed a petition against the reform in France has been increasing.

According to a survey conducted among exhibition companies in Europe, the majority of respondents believed that face-to-face events would resume in some form in 2021, although not in the same way as before the coronavirus pandemic. Over 40 percent of respondents expected a gradual return to events with confirmed attendance, while around 13 percent expected a complete return to events with prior booking.

As of April 2020, 64 percent of global retailers reported that they planned to reopen their stores as soon as the COVID-19 restrictions are lifted. Moreover, 23 percent of the sample stated that they planned to open all their stores, while nine percent of retailers did not have plans to reopen their stores.

The COVID-19 pandemic that spread across the world at the beginning of 2020 was not only a big threat to public health, but also to the entire sports industry. Many professional and amateur leagues and events were canceled and the public was advised to not spend time in large groups or in public areas. During a July 2020 survey in the United States, 74 percent of respondents stated that it was okay for sports leagues and teams to use COVID-19 testing resources to test their players.

In 2020, the United States was the leading importer of orange juice worldwide, with imports valued at approximately 407 million U.S. dollars. France ranked in second place that year, with an orange juice import value of about 515 million U.S. dollars.

In 2020, Brazil exported the largest amount of orange juice worldwide at 1.42 billion U.S. dollars. The United States was the second largest exporter of orange juice, at 539 million U.S. dollars that year.

As of March 2020, more than one half of French respondents believed that the spread of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) was due to its unpredictability rather than the fault of the country's authorities. On the other hand, more than one third of Italians thought that the spread of the virus was foreseen and was not adequately addressed by the authorities.
In 2019, more than 80 percent of respondents in Poland stated that the government does not combat effectively and does not encourage discrimination against LGBTI people.
In financial year 2021, around 1,450 kilotons of lithium carbonate equivalent was exported from Australia. Forecasts show the export volume to rise up to 2,500 kilotons by fiscal year 2023.

As of September 2021, the export volume of coffee in Tanzania was measured at 8.5 thousand metric tons. The amount was slightly higher than the one measured in August. The country is one of the leading coffee producers in the world.

A cybersecurity survey revealed that respondents from the United States and Australia were the most likely to allow their friends and family to use their work laptop to check and respond to personal e-mails and social media messages. Only 35 percent of respondents from the United Kingdom stated that they would allow their friends and family to use their work laptop for personal use.

In 2018, the fertility rate in Ghana for women between the ages of 20 and 24 years was 172.1 births per 1,000 women. The fertility rate for women in Ghana was highest in this age group, and lowest for women aged 45 to 49 years.

Nearly 40 percent of respondents were not sure whether their old devices could be recycled or not. Nevertheless, almost one third of Romanians stated that they would try to recycle their old devices, even if it cost them money.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary production value of pears in South Africa was at roughly 2.97 billion South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 177.8 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 1.5 percent from the preceding year. Since 2000, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with a comprehensive growth of roughly 95 percent.

In 2020, 26 percent of Russians considered Belarusian-Russian relations to be friendly, while only 12 percent of respondents held a positive opinion about the relationship from the Belarusian perspective.

According to a survey from September 2020, the majority of Russians believed that the current president of Belarus, Alexander Lukashenko, was not eligible for re-election. The share of respondents who considered Lukashenko to be eligible for another presidential post reached 28 percent.

This statistic shows the increase of phishing attacks on organizations according to IT security professionals worldwide in 2018 and 2019. During the 2019 survey period, 40 percent of respondents reported an increase in phishing attacks on organizations compared to the previous year.

In February 2020, it was found that the majority of British people believed a total quarantine would be the correct response to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, with 73 percent of respondents saying that this would be the best policy. Additionally, 70 percent of Brits think that the government should advise people who are self-isolating due to coronavirus to check in regularly to make sure they are OK.

The Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) per capita at current prices in Tanzania was highly varied across the regions in the country. Dar es Salaam, the largest city in East Africa, had the highest GDP per capita, measured at 4,521.5 thousand Tanzanian shillings ( TZS ) ( roughly 21.5 U.S. dollars ). The region of Kiambu, within the former Central Province of Tanzania, recorded a GDP per capita of 1,868 TZS ( approximately 6.5 U.S. dollars ), which was the second highest in the country.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most companies in Poland felt the need to reorganize their business. Sixty percent of companies decided to implement changes in their organization in the form of a temporary cessation.

The age group with the highest transaction value on demand videos in Denmark in the fourth quarter of 2020 was 25 to 34-year-olds, reaching a value of 16.3 million Danish kroner. The second largest age group was 35 to 44-year-olds, with a value of 15.1 million Danish kroner.

In August 2021, the number of trees financed by the search engine Ecosia amounted to 1.7 million. The online search provider has been financially supporting reforestation projects on a monthly basis since 2015. The volume of trees that were planted in 2020 was over 4.7 million.

In 2021, the equity holders of the Japanese pharmaceutical company Takeda Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. held a share of around 15.3 percent of the company's outstanding shares. The total number of outstanding shares of Takeda Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. amounted to around 1.7 trillion Japanese yen at that time.

In 2018/2019, the sales average price of peaches on markets in South Africa was measured at 15,867 South African Rands ( 907 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton. This represented a slight increase of roughly 2.5 percent from the previous year. Since 2000, the selling price has been following an overall increasing trend. At that year, the price was measured at 2,813 Rands ( 151 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary production volume of plums in South Africa amounted to 58.5 thousand metric tons, a slight decrease of roughly 16.5 percent from the previous year. Since 2000, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with some fluctuations. The highest volume was reached in 2016/2017, at 87.2 thousand metric tons.

In the first quarter of 2021, China was the main import partner of Angola, with a share of 49 percent in the total imports. South Africa followed, accounting for 33 percent of all imports. The country is also the main destination of Angolan exports.

This statistic present the prevalence against the coronavirus among the Spanish population as of May 2020, by symptomatology. During that month, more than 14 percent of those surveyed had more than five symptoms.

This statistic shows the prevalence against the coronavirus of the Spanish population as of May 2020, broken down by age. In that month, the prevalence rate of those aged between 45 and 49 years old who had developed antibodies against the coronavirus amounted to 5.8 percent.

From February 4 to March 6, 2020, the proportion of adult Canadians who believed that they were at risk of personally becoming sick due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) increased from 36 to 41 percent. This statistic depicts changes in perceived coronavirus infection risk among Canadians from February to March 2020.

This statistic shows the share of French users of electric scooters in 2019, by destination. It appears that the majority of French people using electric scooters for their daily commute were using them to go to work or to study, with around 30 percent of respondents.

This statistic shows the top federal contract obligations for top 5 services in response to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, as of June 30, 2020. The top contract obligation for clinical trial services totaled some 1.25 billion U.S. dollars.

As of September 2020, a survey on parenting in the United States revealed that 74 percent of responding parents whose children had access to social media did not share their child's information on social media because they did not want their child to have access to it. Additionally, only 13 percent of U.S. parents whose children were on social media wanted their child to be able to access it.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary export volume of plums from South Africa was roughly 42.5 thousand metric tons, a decrease of roughly 16.5 percent from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with some fluctuations. The highest volume of plums exported was in 2016/2017, at roughly 64.8 thousand metric tons.

In 2019, Brazil was the Latin American country with the largest capital investment in the travel and tourism sector, with nearly 18 billion U.S. dollars. It was followed by Mexico with over 9.3 billion U.S. dollars. That same year, Brazil also registered the highest direct contribution to GDP among Latin American countries, with over 209 billion U.S. dollars.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ) in Poland, changes in the working time of employees were introduced. The majority of employees worked from home, and the place of work was changed for almost half of them. Every fourth respondent worked from the same place where they used to work every day.
The most significant number of transportation-related injuries in Russia were recorded in the first quarter of 2020. The highest number of road accidents in the country was reported in that period.
As of April 2020, online searches for hand sanitizers increased by 19,166 percent compared to the previous year. In the same time period, online searches for hand wipes increased by 3,092 percent.

This statistic presents the frequency at which French people used the highway in 2019. Nearly 20 percent of those questioned declared that they used the expressway several times a month, compared to 11 percent who used it every day.

As of 2017/2018, the preliminary sales volume on markets of figs in South Africa amounted to 215.9 metric tons, which illustrated an increase of roughly 24.5 percent from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2018, drastic fluctuations were registered in the sales quantity on local markets. The lowest volume was measured in 2005/2006 at 27.9 metric tons, while the peak was reached in 2017/2018 at 215.9 metric tons.

This statistic shows the results of a survey regarding the capacity of various institutions to deal effectively with the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis in France in 2020. Results show that the majority of respondents had confidence in medical professionals and scientists to confront the coronavirus epidemic. However, only 40 percent of respondents trusted the national government to do the right thing concerning the coronavirus crisis.

As of 2018/19, the preliminary gross production value of strawberries and other berries in South Africa amounted to roughly 232.5 million South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 15.2 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2019, the gross production value followed a comprehensive increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The major drops during this period can be linked to bad weather conditions.
This statistic shows the number of specialized fashion retailers in France in 2018, by core business. That year, there were more than 300 general fashion stores in France.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary sales volume of musk melons on markets in South Africa amounted to roughly 6.4 thousand metric tons, which illustrated a decrease of roughly 24.8 percent from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, the sales volume fluctuated significantly, with an overall declining trend. The peak was registered in 2000 with 13.1 thousand metric tons, while the lowest was measured in 2010 at 5.3 thousand metric tons.

The most expensive nature-based tourism trip in Costa Rica in 2019 was the Costa Rican Waterpark and Beach Trip ( Cancun ), which cost more than 4,100 euros per person. The least expensive trip was the San Rafael National Park ( Costa Rica ), which only cost 67 euros per person.

As of 2018, the production of good wine in South Africa amounted to approximately 8.3 million gross liters. This represented a decrease of roughly 14.5 percent from the previous year. From 2000 onwards, an overall increasing trend can be observed. At that year, the production of good wine in South Africa was at 5.3 million gross liters.

In 2021, the Dominican Republic was the Latin American and Caribbean country with the highest purchasing power, based on an index score. According to this global ranking, consumers in the DR had an average purchasing power of 73.5 points. That same year, Brazil ranked second in the region with a purchasing power index score of 49.4.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary gross production value of avocados in South Africa amounted to roughly 1.4 billion South African Rands ( this is equivalent to nearly 104.8 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.2 percent from 2017/2018. Since 2000, the gross production value of avocados followed an overall increasing trend, with several fluctuations. It is worth noting that the production value is affected by the quantity of avocados produced.

This statistic shows the annual expenditure on domestic tourism trips in Portugal from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the annual expenditure on domestic tourism trips amounted to approximately 2.44 billion euros.

This statistic depicts the largest behavioral health hospitals in the United States as of 2018, by number of acute-care beds. During this year, the largest behavioral health hospital was McLean Hospital, with 561 acute-care beds.
This statistic shows the most common types of insider threats in the United States in 2020. That year, privilege misuse accounted for 19 percent of all insider threats in the United States.

This statistic displays the results of a survey on the share of young adults and children who understand why exercise and sports are good for them in 2017/2018, by age. The respondents were asked to respond to the statement `` I understand why exercise and sports are good for me ''. Approximately 74.7 percent of the children aged between 5 and 6 years old in England strongly agreed with the statement.

In the wake of the First World War, the League of Nations was established at the Paris Peace Conference of June 28, 1919, and one of its primary aims was to prevent further global conflicts, by maintaining international peace and security through diplomacy and negotiation rather than military action. One of the key principles of the League of Nations was the idea of international disarmament, and the complete elimination of all weapons of mass destruction, which was a high-profile issue throughout the remainder of the 1920s. Unfortunately for the League of Nations, the US Congress refused to join the League ( despite President Wilson being the leading architect behind the League's founding ), while the other Great Powers ( Britain, France, Italy, and Japan ) were reluctant to provide military assistance or adhere to the economic sanctions put in place by the League. By the end of 1934, League membership reached its highest level of 58 member states, however this was the year after the two primary aggressors of the Second World War, Germany and Japan, had left the League.

This statistic shows the projected number of obese children worldwide in 2020 and a forecast for 2025 and 2030. It is estimated that in 2030 around 253.9 million children aged 5 to 19 years will be obese.

In 2019, the most popular product category for online purchase in Russia was clothing and textile goods, with over 150 thousand orders made on the website of the given category over the observed period. Baby goods were the second most demanded product category, with nearly 40 thousand orders.

As of December 2020, the average download speed of fixed internet connections in Moldova was at approximately 93.5 Megabits per second ( Mbps ). Mobile internet connections were much slower, at around 37.5 Mbps.

This statistic shows the number of obese children aged 5 to 19 years in countries worldwide who are predicted to have obesity over the course of their lifetime as of 203010. It was predicted that in the United States there will be around 32 million obese children.
This statistic shows the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in Finland as an annual average from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, the average CPI was measured at 122.02, where the base year 2015 equals 100.
Nearly every fourth Pole is afraid to lose his job due to the second wave of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in 2020.

As of 2018/19, the preliminary gross production value of pineapples in South Africa amounted to roughly 250.5 million South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 15.3 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.3 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2019, the gross production value followed a comprehensive increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The largest increase was registered in 2015/16, with a growth of roughly 56.2 percent in comparison to the preceding year.
This statistic shows the number of mechanically propelled boating vessels in the United States in 2020, by size. In 2020, there were 6,542 16 to less than 26 feet in size.

In 2020, there were over 567 thousand registered pickleball players in the United States, up from 543 thousand in the previous year. The sport is played with a paddle usually made of wood and is similar to tennis, badminton, and table tennis.

As of 2018, around 37 percent of U.S. non-Hispanic white adults were current e-cigarette users. The statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. adults who were current e-cigarette users as of 2018, by ethnicity.
Since 4 March, when the first coronavirus case ( COVID-19 ) was confirmed in Poland, the number of people quarantined has been growing.

An August 2020 survey revealed that 23 percent of parents in the United States were very concerned about the amount of time their child ( ren ) spent on digital devices during the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, 33 percent of U.S. parents were somewhat concerned about the amount of screen time their children had.

In Estonia, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 735.9 million euros in 2017. This marked the highest value since 2012, and an increase of 183 million euros compared to 2016.

As of 2018/19, the sales average price of oranges on markets in South Africa was at 3,367 South African Rands ( 208.83 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton. This represented a slight decline in comparison to the previous year. Since 2000, the average selling price has followed an overall increasing trend. At that year, the price was measured at 733 Rands ( 47.81 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton.

This statistic shows the impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis on the mood of farmers in France in March 2020. It reveals that more than half of the respondents were neither pessimistic nor optimistic about their situation.
In Austria, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 2.42 billion euros in 2018. This was the second highest value since 2012, when the output value was 2.55 billion euros.
In Poland, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 5.57 billion euros in 2017. This marked the highest value since 2011.

In 2018, around 81.9 percent of pregnant females in the U.S. reported alcohol use in the past 12 months. This statistic shows the percentage of pregnant females in the U.S. who reported alcohol use or binge drinking in the past month from 2015 to 2018.

As of April 2020, 34 percent of Hungarian homeowners who had started planning to renovate their homes put the project on hold due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Another 23 percent of respondents had already cancelled their home renovations.

The average monthly salary in Denmark in 2019 was highest among employees in the mining and quarrying industry, at around 61 thousand Danish kroner. The average monthly salary in the country overall amounted to around 42 thousand Danish kroner.

As of 2019, 70.4 percent of the U.S. population under 18 years old lived in a household with a broadband internet subscription. The statistic illustrates the percentage of the U.S. population under 18 years old living in a household with a computer as of 2019, by internet subscription type.

This statistic shows the popular opinion on government action to contain the novel coronavirus COVID-19 outbreak in France 2020. According to Ipsos, 75 percent of respondents considered that the government had hidden information concerning the coronavirus from the public. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

Rakhim Abramov from Uzbekistan was the most successful Instagram blogger in the country, with his earnings exceeding 14.6 million U.S. dollars between May 2019 and April 2020. Dina Saeva ranked second with nearly nine million U.S. dollars in revenue.

The majority of respondents stated that their professors did not provide any support or guidance related to the online education system during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Romania. However, for more than ten percent of respondents, professors were very involved in their online education.
As of March 2020, the Brazilian soccer player Lionel Messi scored 31 goals in the 2019/2020 season, the lowest total in the last 15 years.

In Hungary, the forest and logging industry generated a gross value added of 247.5 million euros in 2017. This marked the highest value generated since 2009, and an increase of 17 million euros compared to the previous year.

In 2019, around 71 percent of U.S. healthcare organizations reported to use the electronic health record ( EMR ) as one of their three most used sources for their disease registry. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. healthcare organizations using select sources for their disease registrar, as of 2019.

In Sweden, the forest and logging industry generated a gross value added of 3.53 billion euros in 2017. The GVA generated by this industry peaked in 2011 at 4.24 billion euros. After a decrease of 692 million euros between 2011 and 2015, the GVA remained relatively stable.

According to a survey conducted in 2019, 60.7 percent of U.S. healthcare organizations reported that between 1 and 49 percent of their patients used telehealth services. This statistic shows the percentage of patients who used telehealth services in the U.S. in 2019.

In the first half of 2021, the value added by the transportation and storage sector to Kenya's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) was measured at 437 billion Kenyan shillings ( KSh ) ( approximately 4.1 billion U.S. dollars ). The amount represented a decline in comparison to the previous year, when the sector's added value to the country's GDP was measured at 817 billion KSh ( roughly 7.5 billion U.S. dollars ).

This statistic presents the annual decline in jobs in Spain from 2020 to 2023, by scenario. Should a coronavirus vaccine be found and approved by the end of 2021, the number of layoffs could range between 12.2 and 20.7 throughout the year 2022, in a mid-scenario.

Kenya's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) from the manufacturing sector grew by nearly nine percent in the third quarter of 2021, compared to the same quarter of the previous year. The indicator was measured at 9.6 percent in the quarter ending September 2021.

From January to March 2020, the top non-profit funder for COVID-19 response was the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, which had pledged over 728 million U.S. dollars for the cause. The foundation was followed by the World Food Programme, which had pledged roughly 222 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the number of pipeline incidents with liquid release in Alberta, Canada in 2018, by volume. There were 205 incidents with liquid release in volumes greater than one cubic meter in 2018.

According to a survey carried out in the UK in March 2020, around a third of respondents said they will dine out less often than before the coronavirus outbreak, while a further 11 percent said they will not go out at all. On the other hand, 46 percent of respondents said they will dine out the same amount as before, and three percent said they will go out more often than before.

In 2020, there were 16,049 merchant vessels in South Korea. According to the source, a merchant ship is defined as a ship on which no more than 20 percent of the gross tonnage is occupied by the owner. The data only include ships with at least one deck.

As of March 31, 2021, the total assets of the Shinkin Central Bank amounted to approximately 43.7 trillion Japanese yen, up from about 40.8 trillion yen in the previous fiscal year. The Shinkin Central Bank is the central bank for Shinkin banks. Shinkin banks are regional commercial banks that extend credit to the small and medium-sized enterprises and individuals in their respective areas.

In fiscal year 2020, the total liabilities of the Shinkin Central Bank amounted to approximately 42 trillion Japanese yen. The Shinkin Central Bank is the central bank for Shinkin banks and engages in financial activities to support the Shinkin banking system. Shinkin banks are regional commercial banks, whose business is primarily focused on the local communities.

This statistic shows the average annual number of alcohol-related deaths in the U.S. from 2011 to 2015, by condition and gender. During this time, there were an average of 6,542 alcohol-related deaths among males per year in the U.S., compared to 2,942 among females.

As of August 2020, the vast majority of Hungarians preferred that their children attended school in person during the upcoming schoolyear. Only five percent of respondents wanted their children to take classes online.

In 2017, there were around 3,099 potentially preventable inpatient hospital stays among U.S. adults aged 65 years and older for chronic conditions, compared to 1,098 inpatient hospital stays among this age group for acute conditions. This statistic illustrates the rate of potentially preventable adult inpatient hospital stays in the United States in 2017, by condition type and age.

In Norway, the employment rate was higher among men than among women for most years during the period from 2010 to 2020. However, in 2020, the rate was 69.7 percent among men, while it was 64.6 percent among women.

In the second quarter of 2021, the share of Danes aged between 16 and 24 years who listened to music amounted to nearly 60 percent. By contrast, the share of people aged 75 years and older who listened to music was only 14 percent.

As of March 3, 2022, the total number of death caused by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Indonesia amounted to about 146 thousand. The total number of COVID-19 cases to date in the country was around 2.9 million with over 2.8 million recovered.

The number of unemployed people in Norway increased significantly from 2019 to 2020. Whereas about 105 thousand people were unemployed in Norway in 2019, the number had increased to over 129 thousand as of 2020.

The majority of parents surveyed for this study were mainly concerned about their child not being able to socialize and make friends again after a long period of being isolated during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Romania. Nevertheless, more than 40 percent of respondents were also worried that their child would not be able to catch up with the school curriculum after having been out of school for such a long time.

This statistic shows the main concerns of the French regarding the choice of their holiday destination in 2015. That year, 37 percent of French respondents were worried about the political instability in a country, while 36 percent cited the risk of an attack as their main concern.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around 16.6 percent of South Korean respondents stated that they stocked up on items because they thought that they or their household might be quarantined and would therefore not be able to buy groceries. In the same survey, 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

This statistic shows the objects of fantasy of French men and women on a summer vacation in 2017. For both women and men, the most cited object of fantasy was the hotel room with a view ( 49 % of women, 58 % of men ).

In 2021, the value of new business jet transactions globally amounted to 48.7 billion U.S. dollars, down from 59.2 billion U.S. dollars in 2019. The value of pre-owned business jets also decreased from 40.1 billion U.S. dollars in 2019 to 51.9 billion U.S. dollars in 2021.
As of March 2020, over half of all business jets in the global fleet were 13 years old and over. Only 21 percent of business jets in the global fleet were less than six years old.

Tizen is the leading smart TV streaming device worldwide. In 2020, the Roku-based smart TV platform had a market share of 12.7 percent. Sony PlayStation and WebOS ranked second and third with 7.3 and 6.4 percent respectively.

As of 2018, roughly 65 percent of the total population in East Africa were living in urban areas. Djibouti was the country with the highest share of urban population in the East African region, with roughly 75 percent of the total population residing in urban areas. Somalia followed, with roughly 60 percent of the total population living in urban areas.

From January to June 2019, the most popular direct-to-consumer brand on social media in the United States was Kylie Cosmetics. The cosmetics brand generated almost 1.3 billion social media actions per post. Additionally, the brand created over 92.6 million video actions on social media per post.

The SARS epidemic between 2002 and 2003 in China did not result in a long-term economic loss. During the outbreak in the first half of 2003, the quarterly GDP fell by two percent in China. Transportation was the most-hit sector with a drop by 5.4 percentage points.

This statistic represents the global market share of solar photovoltaic ( PV ) capacity additions from 2015 to 2022. In 2022, it is estimated that the global market share of solar PV capacity additions will be around 4.6 percent.

The majority of respondents were mainly concerned about food safety during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Romania. Nevertheless, more than 40 percent were worried that food from outside would be contaminated.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the postal and courier business in France from 2010 to 2020. In 2019, the postal and courier activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 15.3 billion euros.

The global demand for electricity is expected to decrease by around two percent in 2020 due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. This would translate into a decline of some 995 petawatt hours compared to the previous year.

According to a 2020 global public cloud security survey, 43 percent of respondents reported that they were very concerned about the security of public clouds. Only five percent of respondents reported that they were not concerned at all about the security of public clouds.

This statistic presents the total amount of goods transported annually in France by train between 2008 and 2018, in million tonne-kilometers. In 2016, around 32.3 billion tonne-kilometers of goods were transported within France by train.

Following a series of high profile instances of police brutality and racial inequality in the United States in 2020, several professional athletes and teams spoke out on social media to bring awareness to the situation. During an August 2020 survey in the United States, 28 percent of respondents said that this protest was very effective in bringing attention to police brutality and racial inequality.

In 2019, female CEOs of biotech companies based in the United States were paid an average of 4.6 billion U.S. dollars. The average annual compensation for female CEOs of U.S.-based biotech companies was significantly higher than those of male CEOs.
As of March 31, 2020, small jets accounted for 25 percent of the business jets fleet in Europe.

In a survey conducted in Italy in September 2020, 51 percent of respondents declared that, if elections were held today, they would vote for the candidate who received the most votes. Moreover, 17 percent of interviewees stated that they would vote for the candidate according to the number of parliament seats they would like to see. Lastly, nine percent of respondents did not know yet whom they would vote for.

As of March, 2020, half of Hungarians stated that they would continue to use public transport during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak because they did not have any other means of transportation. Another 19 percent of respondents stated that they would use public transport only when absolutely necessary.

As of September 2020, the fintech startup N26 led by Andr Neves had the highest total funding amount for Brazil among other Latin American countries, with more than 1.4 billion U.S. dollars. The food startup Foodzinho ranked second in the ranking, with nearly 597 million dollars in total funding.

As of May 2021, the Japanese car manufacturer Mitsubishi Motors TW was the most followed celebrity channel on YouTube in Taiwan. Its YouTube channel amassed about 618 million video views on the island. The second place belonged to the Taiwanese singer and actor Sodagreen and the third spot was taken by the Taiwanese-Canadian artist and fashion designer Johny John.

In the week ending June 17, 2020, around 81 percent of food and drink sites in London held online sales. Food and drink sites in the United Kingdom had a total of 6,849 registered enterprises in the three months to June 2020.

As of 2018, the share of households with access to sufficient drinking water was higher in rural areas ( around 88 percent ) compared to urban areas ( around 87 percent ). The overall share of households in Ghana with access to drinking water was above the average of the Sub-Saharan Africa ( 62.5 percent ).

In July 2020, the monthly average price for a kilogram of eggs in Egypt was 6.7 Egyptian pounds ( 0.43 U.S. dollars ), which illustrated a decline of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding month. From January 2019 onwards, the mean price per kilogram fluctuated between five Egyptian pounds ( 0.32 U.S. dollars ) in August 2019 and 11.6 Egyptian pounds ( 0.81 U.S. dollars ) in April 2019. The largest drop was in April 2019, as the price dropped by close to 20 percent.

In order to reach the global energy and emission goals set under the sustainable development scenario ( SDS ), the world needs to achieve zero emissions by 2050. The energy sector is the biggest emitter of greenhouse gases ( GHGs ) worldwide, and in order to decouple energy emissions from growth in the global economy, the sector needs to achieve zero emissions by 2050 as well.

As of end-February 2020, 35 percent of Alzheimer  s disease-modifying therapies in clinical trial phase III of development were targeting synaptic plasticity/neuroprotection pathways. This statistic illustrates Alzheimer  s disease-modifying therapies in phase III of development worldwide as of 2020, by type.

This statistic presents the distribution of companies that were led to layoffs due to the coronavirus crisis as of June 2020, by type. Companies in the tourism sector were the most affected by the layoffs, with a quarter of the companies surveyed. In contrast with companies in other sectors, such as FMCG or automotive, that only 4.5 percent of their companies had to dismiss employees.

This statistic presents the perception of Spanish professionals on how their company is adapting to the coronavirus crisis as of June 2020. In that month, 66.3 percent of the professionals surveyed considered their company's response to the COVID-19 pandemic good.

The National Football League ( NFL ) is a professional football league in the United States. The league was founded in 1920 as the American Professional Football Association and played its inaugural season with eleven teams. Nowadays, the NFL comprises 32 teams spread out over two conferences, the National Football Conference ( NFC ) and the American Football Conference ( AFC ), that each consist of four divisions. In a September 2020 survey in the United States, eight percent of respondents stated that they attended about one game per season on average.

The majority of respondents stated that the measures taken by the Romanian authorities against the spread of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Romania were appropriate. However, one third of respondents considered that these measures were insufficient.

Monday Night Football on ESPN presents the final games and highlights of the NFL weekend to households across the United States. In a September 2020 survey in the United States, 15 percent of respondents stated that they watched Monday Night Football every week, while 44 percent never tuned in to the program.

Monday Night Football on ESPN presents the final games and highlights of the NFL weekend to households across the United States. In a September 2020 survey in the United States, 20 percent of respondents aged 35 to 44 stated that they watched Monday Night Football every week, while 14 percent only tuned in when their favorite team was playing.

The statistic shows the inflation rate in the five largest European economies from 1980 to 2021. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials ( e.g. gas, oil ), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2018, the average inflation rate in Germany was about 0.38 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows the unemployment rate in the five largest European economies from 1980 to 2021. The unemployment rate is the percentage of unemployed workers in the total labor force. In 2021, the unemployment rate in Germany was at about 4.3 percent.

The number of people employed in the U.S. intermodal container leasing market was at its highest in 2019, with 374,000 people. In 2021, the number of people employed in this industry was estimated to be around 351,000.

From April 12 to June 30, 2020, around 24.1 percent of adults aged 18 to 29 years in the United States reported having psychological distress in the past week due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. adults who reported having psychological distress in the past week due to the COVID-19 pandemic in 2018 and 2020, by age and income group.

This statistic shows the fashion store revenue of Zalando in Europe from the first quarter of 2018 to the fourth quarter of 2020. In the fourth quarter of 2020, Zalando's revenue reached 2.3 billion euros, an increase compared to the previous quarter.
In the second quarter of 2021, the gross wages index in market services in Italy stood at 110.8 points. Compared to the same period of the previous year, the index increased by about four points.

In 2020, the incidence rate of motor insurance claims in Ireland was highest for accidental damage, at 26 per 1,000 policies. Windscreen and accidental damage claims made up the majority of claims, while third party injury and theft were the least common.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic and the closure of many physical shops in Poland, the means of purchasing groceries has changed. More than half of the respondents have been buying groceries through traditional shops, and almost 30 percent via the internet.

As of March 2020, over 60 percent of Hungarians stated that they would not wash their hands, or they would make sure to wash their hands with soap and water only. Another 25 percent of respondents only rinsed their hands with water.

In 2020, China was the largest paper exporting country for Japan, accounting for almost one fifth of Japan's total paper exports. In that year, China exported more than 12.5 million metric tons of paper to Japan.

As of August 2020, around 46 percent of respondents around the world expected identity theft to increase significantly over the next 12 months. Additionally, 35 percent of respondents believed that the risk of identity theft would increase slightly.
Hungary has the highest value-added tax ( VAT ) rate in the European Union ( EU ), at 30 percent. The standard VAT rate in most countries in the EU is 20 percent.

In the past 10 years, the share of children from cultural minorities in primary school in Norway increased significantly. In 2010, five percent of the children were from a minority group, whereas in 2020, nine percent were from a cultural minority.
The statistic shows the share of visitors to the Forbidden City in China in 2019, by gender. That year, female visitors accounted for 56 percent of all visitors to the Forbidden City.

In 2021, nearly 70 percent of urban households in Argentina were found to live under the poverty line, while only 10 percent were considered to be below the poverty threshold. Meanwhile, the population living in urban areas in the South American country was estimated to live under the poverty line to a lesser extent, with around 60 percent. The poverty rate in Argentina has been continuously increasing in the past years.
