According to a 2021 survey, approximately 14 percent of small and medium-sized enterprises ( SMEs ) in Mexico had incorporated online sales since the COVID-19 outbreak in the country. Meanwhile, approximately 42 percent of the SMEs surveyed had been selling online products for two to five years prior to the survey.

In 2020, approximately 0.3 thousand international conferences were held in Japan. According to the source, international conferences are defined as events which are open to the participation of scholars from other countries, and which are not exclusively national in nature.

More than one half of Russians would not take part in the so-called `` cashback '' program, which would have reimbursed participants who took part in the tour, provided that they could get a refund from the purchased tour package. However, more than 40 percent of those surveyed would participate in such a program.

The number of enterprises in the Danish freight transport industry decreased by 590 enterprises in 2019 in comparison to the previous year. Therefore, the number of enterprises declined to 4,868 enterprises in 2019.

According to the findings of the survey, 58 percent of Hungarians stated that they used the services of foreign online shops when shopping for goods across borders. Of the respondents, over half had purchased clothes from online stores such as Aliexpress or Wish.

In 2019, the majority of Hungarians stated that they considered cultural diversity as the most positive aspect of diversity in Hungary. Another 33 percent of respondents found religious diversity to be the most beneficial.

As of June 26, 2021, the test incidence rate ( RT-PCR ) for the whole of France was around 15.7 percent. The region with the highest incidence rate was the Paris Region ( Ile-de-France ). This was also the region that registered the highest number of positive cases in France.

In 2018, Algeria's trade deficit amounted to approximately -19.5 billion U.S. dollars. In the period under review, the country registered the largest trade deficit in 2015, with a value of around -20.2 billion U.S. dollars.

From 2015 to 2016, fruit contributed to 9.8 percent of the potassium intake in children aged between 7 and 3 years in the United States. The leading ten food categories for potassium intake contributed to around 43.8 percent of total potassium intake for this age group. This statistic illustrates the distribution of the leading ten food contributors to potassium intake in the United States from 2015 to 2016, by age and food category.

From 2015 to 2016, burritos and tacos contributed to 5.4 percent of the sodium intake in people who were underweight and therefore considered underweight, while deli meat sandwiches contributed to 5.4 percent of sodium intake in this weight group. The leading ten food categories for sodium intake contributed to around 43.1 percent of total sodium intake for this weight group. This statistic illustrates the distribution of the leading ten food contributors to sodium intake in the United States from 2015 to 2016, by weight and food category.

The number of newly registered passenger cars in Denmark fluctuated from 2017 to 2020. In 2020, there were about 198 thousand new passenger cars registered in Denmark, which was a decrease of more than 23 thousand cars compared to the previous year.

As of March 6, 2022, the total number of death caused by coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Libya was over 6.3 thousand. The total number of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) cases to date in the country was around 496 thousand with over 486 thousand recovered. The highest daily death toll in the country was recorded on January 21, 2022 at over 1.3 thousand.

According to a 2018/2019 study, approximately 54 percent of children and teenage students in urban areas of Costa Rica used the internet to listen to music, against nearly 46 percent of those surveyed in rural areas of the Central American country.
This statistic shows the percentage of adults in the U.S. with arthritis in 2020, by state and gender. As of that year, around 42.9 percent of women aged 18 years and older in Alabama had arthritis.

In 2020, there were about 33.5 million automated teller machines ( ATMs ) installed and operational in the United States. This is a decrease from 2008, when there were about 46.1 million ATMs installed and operational in the U.S.

This statistic shows the purchasing channels for detox beverages among French consumers in 2019. It reveals that almost two-thirds of respondents purchased their detox drinks in supermarkets or hypermarkets.

Nearly every second respondent in Poland declared that the most significant problem related to the COVID-19 pandemic was the quarantine for people coming from abroad. Every third respondent was worried about restrictions on travel, and every fourth about visits to hospitals.

As of July 2020, the monthly average price for old rumin cheese in Egypt was 106.6 Egyptian pounds ( 7.02 U.S. dollars ) per kilogram, a decline of close to 1.2 percent from June 2020. From January 2019 onwards, the mean price per kilogram fluctuated between 106.6 Egyptian pounds ( 7.02 U.S. dollars ) and 109.5 Egyptian pounds ( 7.35 U.S. dollars ). Moreover, in the same time period, the average price for all cheese in Egypt was at 107.5 Egyptian pounds ( 7.26 U.S. dollars ) per kilogram.

In a McKinsey Consumer survey fielded in June 2020, around 45 percent of female respondents and 37 percent of male respondents in the U.S. reported that they or someone from their household had either avoided or delayed medical care due to COVID-19-related concerns. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults who delayed or avoided medical care due to COVID-19-related concerns as of June 2020, by gender.

In 2020, Mexico scored 5.17 points out of 10 in the GovTech maturity index. The country's highest score was in the `` procurement : frameworks '' dimension ( 8.29 points ) and the lowest in the `` government : policy environment '' ( 4 points ).

In 2020 there were 25 deaths due to terrorist attacks in the European Union and United Kingdom, compared with 18 in 2019. During the provided time-period, the year with the most deaths was 2016, when there were 147.

How many crimes are reported in Denmark? In 2020, the number of overall crimes amounted to 442.5 thousand, which was a decrease of around 63 thousand crimes from the previous year. Furthermore, the number of reported crimes peaked in 2011, reaching 561.6 thousand crimes.

The number of reported and charged robberies in shops in Denmark generally decreased during the past decade. In 2010, 830 cases of robberies were reported, and 707 were charged. In 2020, 327 cases of robberies were reported, and 364 were charged.

Between September 2019 and August 2020, the most popular organic search term regarding Donald Trump in the United States was `` Trump for president ''. This search term generated an average of 10.27 thousand monthly searches. The second-most popular organic search term was `` Donald Trump ''.
This statistic shows the Medicare inpatient per-user actual costs from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the per-user cost was 21,764 U.S. dollars, compared to 17,064 U.S. dollars in 2009.

In 2020, the most popular type of presents to give for Christmas in Mexico were books, with 73.5 percent of respondents stating to prefer this type of gift. Toys ranked second, with 46.2 percent of the people surveyed. Beauty products were the third most favored type of presents, with 37.3 percent of the respondents.

As of August 2020, around 73 percent of countries reported that they had allocated funding specifically for mental health as part of their response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the percentage of countries who had allocated funding for mental health as part of their COVID-19 response, as of August 2020.

As of January 19, 2022, India had the highest number of confirmed cases of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in the Asia-Pacific region, with over 37.9 million people having been infected. Indonesia has recorded approximately 3.7 million cases of COVID-19 as of January 19, 2022.

As of September 2020, the most popular home screen customization app on the Apple App Store was the Home App, which generated approximately 2.5 million daily installs from iPhone users worldwide. The Home App is a do-it-yourself app that allows users to change the look and feel of their iPhone home screen with a variety of wallpapers, backgrounds, and other customizations.

In 2020, more than half of the businesses operating in Honduras with an annual turnover of more than 500 million Honduran dollars ( approximately 1.3 billion U.S. dollars based on April 15, 2020 exchange rates ) had a website or a social media account, whereas only 36 percent of micro and small businesses did the same.

In the school year 2019/2020, around 2.6 million pupils were enrolled in pre-primary school institutions in Algeria, increasing compared to the previous year. In the same year, there were more male ( 255,851 ) than female ( 247,853 ) pupils in Algeria.

This statistic depicts the medicare inpatient costs as a percentage of total hospital costs in the United States from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, medicare inpatient costs made up around 11.8 percent of total hospital costs.

Between 1768 and 1772, almost 1.7 million slaves were exported from the Thirteen Colonies to the British mainland. Of this 1.7 million, almost 1.2 million ( or over 72 percent ) were exported from the more southern colonies of Virginia, Delaware and Pennsylvania, while roughly 100,000 slaves were exported from Massachusetts and New Jersey respectively. The most profitable colonies for the export of slaves in the decades leading up to independence were Virginia and Pennsylvania, which profited greatly from the triangular trade route between Britain, Africa and the New World. This route saw slaveowners bring manufactured products to Africa to trade for slaves, then transport the slaves to the New World to harvest raw materials, before taking these materials back to Britain where they would then be consumed or used in manufacturing.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults that take dietary supplements, distributed by income. The statistic is based on a survey conducted in August 2020. Among U.S. adults with an income of less than 50,000 U.S. dollars, 69 percent reported taking dietary supplements. Almost two-thirds of the adults population in the United States takes dietary supplements. The nutritional supplement industry has seen a large growth in the market, especially in protein supplements and vitamins.

This statistic depicts the top reasons for dietary supplement use among U.S. adults who take supplements. The statistic is based on a survey conducted in August 2019. Some 30 percent of those who take dietary supplements stated that they use them for overall wellness and prevention.

In 2019, only 2.3 percent of brand stories reached over 20 million Instagram followers, down from 11.2 percent in 2018. Stories are user-generated content such as photos, videos, and text that disappear 24 hours after being posted. Brands use Instagram Stories to increase brand awareness, drive sales, and engage with customers.

Among U.S. adult users of dietary supplements, 39 percent of respondents stated thay they increased the usage of vitamin C since the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. This statistic is based on a survey conducted in August 2020. In general, around two-thirds of the adult population in the United States takes dietary supplements.

In 2020, the source had measured the bounce rate of several cosmetic websites. The bounce rate represents the share of visits from search engines and social media that are converted into visits to a website. Thus, the higher the bounce rate, the more attractive a website is to search engines and social media users. According to the source, the website idealo.fr had a bounce rate of 36.8 percent, while that of Beautysuccess.fr reached 50.8 percent.

The S & P 500 index fell by approximately 2,400 points in the four weeks from February 12 to March 11, 2020, but has since recovered to 4,199 points as of January 29, 2022. In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, 30 percent of Polish respondents had problems with the lack of face-to-face communication and interpersonal skills.

In 2019, over 161.5 thousand students were enrolled in tertiary education in Tunisia. The majority of them were females, with a total of approximately 167.2 thousand. In comparison, there were around 121.8 thousand male students in the country. Overall, the number of students in tertiary education in Tunisia decreased from 201.8 thousand in 2014 to 161.5 thousand in 2019.

The highest number of victims of criminal offences in Norway were victims of theft, with over 65 thousand victims in 2019. Furthermore, over 31 thousand people were victims of violence and maltreatment.

The outbreak of COVID-19, also known as novel coronavirus, has led to revised growth expectations for enterprise value for tech companies in 2020. A survey of senior executives from ICT companies around the world revealed that the majority expect a reduction in revenues in 2020 as a result of the pandemic. However, close to 40 percent of respondents expect no change in revenues for their company in 2020.

The outbreak of COVID-19, also known as novel coronavirus, has led to an increased demand for medical information and products. Between January and March 2020, the number of medical app downloads increased by 136 percent in South Korea. This statistic shows the percentage growth in the number of medical app downloads worldwide, by country, from January to March 2020.

In 2019, over 1.5 thousand cases of police violence were reported in Brazil, down from over 1.6 thousand cases of police violence recorded one year before. In the past five years, the highest number of police violence complaints was reported in 2018.

More than half of the IT enterprises surveyed in Norway in 2020 stated that their employees are more productive when working from home during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. 22 percent of the enterprises said that their employees are about as productive as when working from the office.

In 2020, the state of Rio Grande do Sul had the highest number of police officers killed in Brazil, with 49 officers. It was followed by Minas Gerais with 44 deaths. That same year, the number of police officers killed in the country totaled 196.

Between the years 2020 and 2027, the compound annual growth rate of vertical farming is expected to be highest in the United States, with a CAGR of 24.9 percent. China is also expected to experience a high CAGR of 24.6 percent during that timeframe. Vertical farming is a type of indoor farming that utilizes high-tech growing methods to cultivate plants in stacked layers.

In August 2020, the average monthly price for round rebar in Egypt was measured at 10,089 Egyptian pounds per metric ton ( this is comparable to 583.5 U.S. dollars ), which represented a decline of around 2.9 percent from the preceding month. During the period under investigation, the mean price per metric ton fluctuated between 10,089 Egyptian pounds ( 583.5 U.S. dollars ) in August 2019 and 12,378 Egyptian pounds ( 707.5 U.S. dollars ) in September 2019. The largest price drop was between September 2019 and January 2020, as the mean price for one metric ton of round rebar dropped by around 23.2 percent.

The COVID-19 pandemic that spread across the world at the beginning of 2020 was not only a big threat to public health, but also to the entire sports industry. Many professional and amateur leagues and events were canceled and the public was advised to not spend time in large groups or in public areas. During a March 2020 survey in the United States, 14 percent of respondents strongly agreed that the lack of live sports had a significant impact on their daily life.

Between 1885 and 1988, the sugar output in the northern hemisphere more than doubled, rising from around five million metric tons to over 22 million metric tons. Although the United States was the leading producer of sugar from cane in most years, their output was never more than one million metric tons, while Canada's output never fell below one million metric tons. Mexico's sugar output was generally the lowest of the four countries, although their production did rise in the late 1920s and 1930s, and they are expected to have overtaken the US in sugar production by 2028.

In fiscal year 2022, it cost approximately 51 Japanese yen per kilogram to recycle PET ( polyethylene terephthalate ) bottles in Japan. The unit cost for recycling paper packaging was around 16 Japanese yen per kilogram.
1,093 people were imprisoned for traffic offences in Norway in 2018. Furthermore, 953 people were imprisoned for drug-related crimes, while 753 people were imprisoned for sexual offences.

As of August 2020, the monthly average price for wood in Egypt was at 5,868 Egyptian pounds per cubic meter ( this is equivalent to 352.87 U.S. dollars ) for hardwood and 9,000 Egyptian pounds per cubic meter ( 515.94 U.S. dollars ) for softwood. In 2020, the rules on abortion in Poland were considered too restrictive by 62 percent of respondents. In 2019, the export value of agriculture, hunting, and fishery products from Algeria amounted to 11.9 billion Algerian dinars ( around 125 million U.S. dollars ). In the period under review, the export value of the sector increased by nearly 30 percent.

In 2019, 32.4 people in South Korea died within six months after working experience in the shipbuilding industry. According to the source, the number of deaths was higher in the first three years of working experience.

The impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic on the Romanian economy was expected to cause a decrease in GDP growth in 2020.

The number of direct jobs created by the app economy in the European Union ( EU ) has increased steadily since January 2016, and is projected to reach 671 thousand by July 2019. In January 2016, the number of direct jobs in the app economy was estimated at 519 thousand.

As of April 2021, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) for food and non-alcoholic beverages in Ghana increased in comparison to the previous month. In 2019, the unemployment rate in Algeria was higher among women. In the last decade, the unemployment rate in the country fluctuated between around eight and 20 percent. In 2020, most Hungarians who were going to buy Christmas presents for their loved ones stated that they would buy them close family members. Another 21 percent of respondents stated that they would buy Christmas gifts for their friends.

As of August 2020, around 56 percent of U.S. adults strongly disagreed with the statement that e-cigarettes are less harmful than traditional cigarettes. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults who strongly or somewhat disagreed or agreed with select statements regarding e-cigarettes, as of August 2020.

According to a global survey conducted in 2019, the majority of respondents in both manufacturing and non-manufacturing industries felt fairly confident in their business'ability to understand and tackle cyber threats. However, manufacturing companies were more likely to feel confident, with 21 percent of respondents in the industry stating so, compared to 19 percent of respondents in other industries.

As of November 2020, 22 percent of content evaluated for delisting from search results in Denmark was due to insufficient information while five percent of content requested for delisting regarded personal information.

This statistic shows the volume of French imports and exports of used textile articles and rags from 2015 to 2019. In 2019, the exports of used textile articles and rags amounted to more than 1.7 million tons, compared to imports that year which were less than 250,000 tons.

This statistic shows the number of clinical trial starts for novel heart failure drugs in the United States from 2009 to 2018, by clinical trial phase. In 2018, there were 4 phase I clinical trial starts for heart failure drugs in the United States.

In the first week of March 2020, sales of antibacterial gel in Argentina increased by almost 300 percent compared to the same period in 2019. Antibacterial gel was the top-selling hygiene product in the South American country in both periods. In contrast, sales of toilet soaps grew by around 75 percent during the first week of March 2020, in comparison to the same period a year earlier. The increase was associated with the COVID-19 outbreak, caused by the novel coronavirus ( SARS-CoV-2 ).
As of January 2021, the number of mobile money customers in Uganda was at 30.7 million. The population of mobile money users grew by roughly two million in comparison to the previous year.

Online searches regarding the U.S. American miniseries The Queen's Gambit have surged in Mexico since its release on October 23, 2020. Approximately two weeks later, online interest in the Netflix series has grown among viewers with the term `` Gambito de Dama ''  as it was called in the Latin American country  peaking at the end of November.
In 2020, the proved natural gas reserves in Angola amounted to 300 billion cubic meters. The volume decreased compared to the previous year, when it was measured at 322 billion cubic meters.

In 2020, the natural gas demand in Angola increased to 820 million cubic meters. The country consumes approximately 90 percent of the natural gas produced in the region. Angola's natural gas production amounted to roughly 1.5 billion cubic meters in 2019.

The number of foreign students enrolled in higher education in Spain amounted to approximately 107 thousand in the academic year 2019/2020. Of these, 33.5 percent came from the European Union and 28.4 percent from Latin America and the Caribbean.

In the fiscal year 2020, the Japanese chemical company Shin-Etsu Chemical Co., Ltd. employed approximately 24 thousand people. Figures have been increasing since 2011. The company is headquartered in Tokyo.

As of 2020, nearly all Norwegians between 16 and 25 years used the internet for instant messaging. To be precise, 99 percent of the respondents used it. 97 percent used it to go online, while 96 percent used it to communicate through social media.
This graph shows the number of foreign populations in selected European countries in 1960, 1976 and 1990. In 1960, there were 731,000 foreign populations living in Germany.

As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, many people turned to video gaming as a form of entertainment during long periods of being locked down at home. During a survey in the United States in June 2020, respondents stated that their time spent playing fighting games had increased by 27.5 percent.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most Polish companies exporting cosmetics plan to reduce their exports. Almost every fifth company is planning to maintain its export levels at the current level.

The highest number of confirmed coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) cases in Estonia as of January 24, 2022, was in the capital region of Tallinn, with 4,543 cases. The second highest number of cases was reported in the region of Vrmland, with 4,169 cases.

In 2020, the private consumption expenditure in Vietnam accounted for approximately 68.4 percent of the country's total GDP. In that year, the GDP of Vietnam was estimated at around 94.58 billion U.S. dollars.

In April 2020, the majority of Russians supported the idea of introducing a requirement for wearing face masks in public places in order to prevent the further expansion of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) across the country. The second most popular measure was a ban on large gatherings.

The average retail price of wheat flour increased by over 13 percent in Russia between 2017 and 2020. A kilogram of flour cost approximately 40 Russian rubles in stores across the country over the latest observed period.

Approximately one half of Russians agreed to some extent that people who returned to their pre-serfdom times should be given the opportunity to live in the same conditions as under the Soviet regime, according to a survey from September 2020. The share of respondents who agreed with the statement decreased from 55 percent in March 1995 to 49 percent in September 2020.

In 2018, around 69 percent of white adults aged 65 years and older in the United States were given a flu vaccination, compared to around 59 percent of black adults. This statistic illustrates the percentage of white and black adults aged 65 years and older in the United States who received a flu vaccination from 2009 to 2018.

In a survey from September 2020, around 38 percent of caregivers in the United States reported an increase in the financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic illustrates the percentage of caregivers in the United States who reported an increase or decrease in financial hardship, increased financial hardiness, and no financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic as of September 2020.

A December 2019 survey revealed that 38 percent of adults in the United States have either stopped or were unsure of continuing to communicate with an ex-romantic partner via online means. Additionally, only 20 percent of U.S. adults stated that they were currently checking in on an ex-romantic partner online.

The statistic illustrates the products reporting the highest growth in clicks during Black Friday in the Netherlands in 2019, compared to an average day. It shows that the number of clicks on online advertising for consoles increased by over 1,500 percent, while for wireless speakers the number of clicks grew by 810 percent.

This statistic shows the reasons why French people are more eager to buy Christmas gifts in December 2020 compared to the same period of the previous year. That year, 45 percent of respondents were already thinking about Christmas presents they would give to their loved ones.

This statistic shows the forecasted electricity generation in France in 2050, by energy source. It indicates that nuclear power will remain the major source of electricity generation in France, with an expected contribution of 180.5 terawatt hours.
